The oldest is 23 years old and he is an assistant driver. The youngest is 20 years old, and she is jobless. They are now in difficulty. This family needs US $50 for selling foods at the market.

loans.use: Food sales

loans.name: Binh

texts.en: Mr. Binh is 38 years old and his wife, Mrs. Thanh, is 37 years old. He has 5 children. Miss Nhi is 20 years old. She has stopped going to school to help her family. Miss Nhung is 18 years old. She is working in HCM city. Miss Ny is 16 years old, miss Na is 13 years old, and miss No is 6 years old. They are students. Mr. Binh has a big family, but only 2,000 square meters of rice land. The income from this land is not enough to support his family. He has to work as a labor worker, but his job is unstable. His wife has a small business selling foods for breakfast, and she seeks to borrow US $50 for this business.

loans.use: To sell foods for breakfast

loans.name: Irma Alicia

texts.en:
Irma Alicia is a single mom with 5 children. In order to support her children and make sure that they receive education, and because their father does not pay the much needed alimony, Irma decided to start her own business selling clothes. She then switched to selling chicken, which was much more profitable, and now has more and more clients every day. Since then, she has incorporated more items to her menu such as bates, giblets, escalopes, flautas, salads, etc. Little by little she has seen her business grow with her dedication and effort.

For Irma, it has not been an easy task to raise her 5 children by herself, but she has achieved this with her hard work. Right now she needs a $200 loan to buy merchandise so her business is well supplied and so it can continue to grow. Irma needs your help and she is thankful for your generosity and support.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

La señora Irma Alicia es madre soltera de cinco hijos, ante la necesidad de darle sustento y educación a sus hijos, dado que el padre de ellos no les da la pensión que necesitan, Irma decidió iniciar su propio negocio vendiendo ropa, después inició con la venta de pollo, que le empezó a dejar mayores ganancias, y cada día tiene más clientes, ahora ha incorporado más variedad de pollo, bates, menudencias, entero, milanesa, flautas, ensaladas, etc., poco a poco ha hecho crecer con su dedicación y esfuerzo.

No ha sido fácil para Irma sacar adelante a sus cinco hijos ella sola, pero con su trabajo lo ha logrado, en estos momentos requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 200 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, para tener bien surtido su negocio y poder continuar creciendo con él. Ella necesita de tu ayuda, y agradece tu generosidad y apoyo.

loans.use: Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.en:
María is married and has 3 daughters ages 12,14 and 17. Her husband's income was not enough to cover the family's basic needs, so María decided to start working, but she realized that it took too much time away from her family. This is why she started her own business selling hamburgers and tacos. When María had just started, she was selling right outside of her house, but she was then able to buy a place and little by little her number of clients and sales began to rise.

María wants to see her business grow and wishes to buy a bigger refrigerator as well as to remodel her facility; this would allow her to increase production and get more clients. To achieve all this, María needs a $250 loan which she will repay within 3 to 6 months. You can be an important part of the growth of this business and help María's family: they'll be very grateful.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

La señora Maria es casada, tiene tres hijas de 12, 14 y 17 años de edad, con el salario de su esposo no era posible cubrir todas las necesidades de la familia, así que Maria decidió trabajar, pero se dio cuenta de que todos los trabajos le quitaban mucho tiempo que quería pasar con su familia, por este motivo inició su propio negocio con la venta de hamburguesas y tacos. Cuando empezó vendía afuera de su casa, pero ahora le fue posible adquirir un local, poco a poco sus clientes y sus ventas se han incrementado.

Maria quiere continuar creciendo, y ahora desea comprar un refrigerador más grande y remodelar su local, esto le permitirá incrementar su producción y poder ganar más clientes, para esto requiere de un préstamo por $ 250 dólares, ella ofrece devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. Tú puedes ser parte fundamental en el crecimiento de este negocio y ayudar a esta familia, ellos te lo agradecerán.

loans.use: Para remodelar el local

loans.name: Akofa

texts.en: Akofa has been a long-standing client of Kraban Support Foundation. She trades in livestock by purchasing and selling fowls from her district, known as Atebubu-Amantin, to the neighbouring country called Burkina Faso. She has participated in the TEACH lending skills programme of Kraban Support Foundation. She now requires a loan of $750 from KIVA to enable her purchase more fowls for sale in Burkina Faso to take advantage of the seasonal high demand.

loans.use: Buy fowl to sell

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.en:
Mrs. Consuelo has a store that she started 16 years ago with her savings. She runs her business out of her house and she attends to her clients everyday of the week. Her daughter helps her in the business. Her store hours are from 6:00 AM to 22:00PM.

Consuelo will use the loan to buy store supplies and bazaar products: rice, sugar, meats, chicken, detergents, imitation jewelry, and other. With this, Consuelo will be able to assist and satisfy the needs of her clients.

Consuelo is 47 years old. She has four children of which two are students. Consuelo’s husband helps her with the business and also works as a taxi driver. Consuelo states that the income generated by her husband has been a big help in financing the business but that any remaining income needs to cover all of the family expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Martha Martinez, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Consuelo tiene negocio de tienda desde hace 16 años se inicio con ahorros. Su negocio esta ubicado en su domicilio y da atención a sus clientes todos los días de la semana. Su hija la ayuda en el negocio su horario de atención es desde las 6: AM a 22: PM

Con el crédito Consuelo comprara víveres y productos de bazar: Arroz, azúcar, carnes, pollos, detergentes, bisutería y otros. Con esto Consuelo podrá atender y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.

Consuelo tiene 47 años 4 hijos de los cuales 2 estudian. El esposo de Consuelo la ayuda en su negocio y también trabaja como taxista. Consuelo indica que los ingresos generados por esposo la ayudan mucho, porque de esta manera no se descapitaliza su negocio al dirigir parte de este a los gastos de la familia en su totalidad.

loans.use:
Invest in products for her store/  
Invertir en productos para su tienda

loans.name: Viviana

texts.en:
Viviana has a business selling crabs, in bundles and in jars. Viviana has experience in this business because it is a family owned business of 9 years. Her parents helped her brothers with the business. Viviana has managed the business following the death of her mother and because her clients call on her. Viviana works 4 days a week and attends to her clients from 7:00 AM to 20:00PM, delivering her products to the various restaurants that request them.

Viviana is applying for a loan to buy more crabs, meet and satisfy the demand of new clients, and to increase her business.

Viviana is 28 years old and has five children of which four are students. Her husband works as a taxi driver and helps her with the delivery of the merchandise to the various selling sites within and outside of her area. Viviana has also told us that as her business grows so does her income, allowing her to give her family a better quality of life in terms of nutrition and education.

Translated from Spanish by Martha Martinez, Kiva Volunteer.

Viviana tienen negocio de venta de cangrejos por atados y en tarrina. Viviana tiene experiencia en este negocio porque viene de familia desde hace 9 años. Sus padres les dieron el sustento a sus hermanos de este negocio. Viviana toma la dirección del negocio debido a que su mama falleció y sus clientes la buscaban. Viviana labora 4 días a la semana su atención al cliente es de 7:00 AM a 20:00 PM entregando sus productos a los diferentes restaurantes a quienes ellos proveen.

Viviana solicita préstamo para comprar mas cangrejos y poder cumplir con la demanda de nuevos clientes y así poder satisfacerlos e incrementar su negocio.

Viviana tiene 28 años 5 hijos de los cuales 4 estudian. Su esposo labora como taxista apoyándola siempre en el traslado de su mercadería a los diferentes puntos de ventas que tiene en el sector y fuera del sector. Viviana también nos dice que con el incremento de su negocio sus ganancias crecen y con ello podrá dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida en alimentación y educación.

loans.use:
Invest in crabs/  
Invertir en cangrejos

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro has 14 years experience in the production of insecticides, following work with friends who made their living to support their families with this type of business. For 13 years, Pedro has taken on this business to make a living for himself and his family. His business is in his home, producing insecticides per client request. Pedro works 6 days a week, at which time he produces and delivers his product. The insecticides are used to kill rodents, cockroaches, ants, mosquitoes, and other. His wife helps him with the sales at home as neighbors purchase his product.

Pedro is applying for a loan to buy raw material and to make labels. He indicates that his sales have grown and that his current income does not cover for the increase in client demand.

Pedro is 47 years old and has four children who study. His wife helps in the business and considers that the loan will increase her husband’s income which will benefit their home and help meet his responsibilities.

Translated from Spanish by Martha Martinez, Kiva Volunteer.

Pedro tiene experiencia en elaboración de insecticidas 14 años porque trabajaba con unos amigos que tenían de sustento para sus familia este negocio. Desde hace 13 años Pedro tomo también este negocio como medio de vida para el y su familia. Su negocio esta ubicado en su casa produciendo insecticidas sobre pedidos. Pedro labora 6 días a la semana tiempo en que los produce y los entrega. Sus insecticidas son para matar roedores, cucarachas, hormigas, mosquitos y otros. Su esposa lo ayuda en la venta en casa porque vecinos le compra.

Pedro solicita crédito para compra de materia prima y elaboración de etiquetas. Indica además que sus ventas han aumentado y con capital que tiene no cubre la demanda de sus clientes.

Pedro tiene 47 años 4 hijos todos estudian. Su esposa lo apoya en su negocio y considera que con el préstamo su esposo generara más ingresos para beneficio de su hogar y poder cumplir con sus responsabilidades.

loans.use:
To buy raw material for the production of his product/ 
Comprar materia prima para la elaboracion de su producto

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
For 13 years, Maria has been selling fried pork pieces and stuffed corn patties of potatoes and pork. She gained experience from her parents who ran a similar business to earn a living. Along with her children, Maria runs the business in front of her house, giving good service to her clients in providing good portions and cleanliness. She attends to her clients from 15:30PM to 20:00PM.

Maria would like the loan to buy a big cart with ample storage room to meet her needs, and to be able to sell her product with greater care. With the growing demand for her product, Maria sees the need to enhance the presentation of her product.

Maria is 37 years old and has 2 children that study. In their spare time, the children help Maria run the business because they know the business is their only source of income to cover their home expenses. Additionally, they are eager to own a piece of land to be able to build a house one day.

Translated from Spanish by Martha Martinez, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria tiene negocio de venta de fritada de carne de cerdo(fried pork pieces), tortillas de papas y colas desde hace 13 años. Su experiencia la adquirió porque sus padres tenían este negocio como medio de sustento para el hogar. Maria juntos con sus hijos atienden el negocio en portal de su vivienda dando una buena atención a sus clientes en porciones y limpieza. Su atención a sus clientes es desde las 15:30 A 20:00 PM

Maria desea con el préstamo adquirir una nueva carreta grande con compartimientos adecuados a sus necesidades para poder exhibir sus productos con mas precaución. Debido a que su demanda a crecido Maria se ve obligada a mejorar la presentación de sus fritadas.

Maria tiene 37 años y 2 hijos sus hijos estudian y en ratos libres la apoyan en su negocio por que saben que es la única fuente de sustento para los gastos del hogar, además anhelan tener un terreno propio donde poder construir algún día su casa.

loans.use:
To purchase a new cart/ 
Comprar una nueva carreta

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda has had a business selling clothes for 5 years. She began her business with her own savings. She gained experience from a young age, given she would help her relatives with sales. Currently, she sells her products per request. She serves her clients every day of the week from 8:00 AM to 20:00 PM.

Erlinda will use the loan to buy clothes, school uniforms, and school supplies to meet the demands of the school season.

Erlinda is 35 years old and has three children who are students. She has stated that her children’s education is the main reason for her to move forward with the business and that she needs to expand the business to be able to generate more income to cover her day to day needs.

Translated from Spanish by Martha Martinez, Kiva Volunteer.

Erlinda tiene negocio de venta de ropa desde hace 5 años. Inicio su negocio con ahorros que tenia. Su experiencia en el negocio lo tiene desde que era muy joven, ya que ayudaba a vender a familiares. Actualmente vende sus productos sobre pedidos. Atiende a sus clientes todos los días de la semana desde las 8:00 AM a 20:00 PM

Erlinda con el crédito comprara ropa, útiles escolares que es lo que le están pidiendo por ser época escolar al igual que uniformes.

Erlinda tiene 35 años 3 hijos los mismos que están estudiando. Ella manifiesta que la educación de sus hijos es la razón mas fuerte que tiene para seguir adelante con su negocio y necesita seguir incrementándolo para así obtener mayores ingresos que puedan cubrir las necesidades que se vayan presentando cada día.

loans.use:
To buy clothes and invest in school supplies/ 
Comprar ropa e invertir en utilies escolares

loans.name: Xu

texts.en: Xu 47 years old, and her husband was killed in a traffic accident a long time ago. She has a grocery store at home to support an eldest son and youngest daughter. Her son stopped going to school to be able to earn money. Her daughter is attending grade 7. Their income is $10 per person/month. Xu wants to get a loan of $75 in order to supply her grocery store. They will repay monthly.

loans.use: To supply the grocery store.

loans.name: Tieu

texts.en: Tieu is 55 years old. She lives with 4 people including her daughter, her son in law, and two baby grandchildren. Employment is not stable, so Tieu had to become a door to door salesperson to earn part of the money for the family. Tieu sells corn. Their income is $6 per person/month. They hope to get a loan of $75 to develop this business. They will repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: To sell boiled corn door to door.

loans.name: Sayaad Zia

texts.en:
S. Zia lives in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and he has a retail food shop in the main city of Kabul. He has good experience because he has been a shopkeeper for 10 years.

He wants to take a loan and buy some items for his shop such as newpapers, packets of crisps and packets of sweets. This is important for his shop because there is a rush on newsagents in the city. He wants to expand his business and make good use of this loan. He is sure that he can do it.

loans.use: Expand business by buying new items for sale

loans.name: Rashta

texts.en:
Rashta lives in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is 40 years old and a widow. Her husband died 8 years ago and she is the one who tries to help her family.

She took her 3rd loan cycle and opened a shop for her son who is a metal worker. Her son is happy because he can support his family now. Rashta wants to take anther loan for her son to enlarge the shop large and to buy some new tools to improve the business. Her son hopes to join his brothers in school so that they can study and help their families in the future.

loans.use: To buy new machines

loans.name: Sania

texts.en: Sania 36 years old lives in District 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is married and has 2 children. She took her 2nd loan cycle and her husband used it to buy a car and repair it. He works from 7AM up to 8PM as a taxi driver. He works hard and now he faces economical difficulty because the engine doesn't work. His wife wants to take anther loan for her husband to buy a new engine for the car so that he can start working again.

loans.use: Buy a new car engine

loans.name: Qahara

texts.en:
Qahara lives in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She lives with all the members of her family and she is single. Her father died during the war in Kabul. She is the youngest of her family and she has a younger brother who is a singer.

She took her 2nd loan cycle and bought her brother what he needed for singing. He wants to be one of the most popular singers, so his sister wants to take anther loan to open a shop and find more clients for his singing. He is very happy because he has a chance to be a good singer.

loans.use: Rent a shop

loans.name: Parie Gul

texts.en: Parie G. is 49 years old. She lives in District 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is uneducated and her husband has a metal working shop. She took her 2nd loan cycle to enlarge her husband's shop. His business has improved and now his wife wants to take anther loan so that she can buy new plates, a tent, and carpet to rent and use the income to help and support her family. This is one of her best wishes.

loans.use: Buy items for rent

loans.name: Be Be Ko

texts.en:
Be Be Ko is 40 years old. She lives in District 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She lives with her family and her husband is sick at home and can't work.

She took her 3rd loan cycle and opened a general store for her son. His business is good. Now his mother wants to take anther loan to expand the business so that her son can help support the whole family.

loans.use: to buy extra thing

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria has three years of experience as a seller of costmetics and jewelry in her own store. She began by working for other persons as a clothes salesperson in the center of the city. This was the motivating factor for her when she decided to begin to save money in order to begin her own shop. Because this work demanded much of her time outside of her house, she did not pay as much attention to her sons as she would like. With the help of her husband she obtained funding and invested in various products. She works every day of the week from 9 am until 6 pm.

Maria would like this credit in order to supply her business with other types of products. A larger supply of products would allow her to have more sales.

Maria is married and the mother of two sons, one of whom is a student. Her husband works in a factory, maintaining/repairing the factory equipment. He helps out his wife as much as he can. She goal is to be able to purchase a small terrain/piece of land, as her family is currently living in her parents' house.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Maria tiene una experiencia de 3 años con su negocio de venta de cosméticos y bisutería. Se inicio trabajando para otras personas vendiendo ropa en el centro de la ciudad. Este fue el motivo por el cual ella decide comenzar a ahorrar para tener su propio negocio. Razón de que este trabajo le demandaba estar mucho tiempo fuera de su casa y por ende no estar pendiente de sus hijos. Con la ayuda de su esposo logra reunir un capital y lo invierte en dichos productos. Trabaja todos los días de la semana desde las 9 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m.

Maria desea el crédito para poder surtir su negocio con otra clase de productos. Además al comprar un mayor volumen de productos ella obtendrá mayor ganancia. /p>

Maria es casada. Tiene 2 hijos. Uno de los cuales ya estudia. Su esposo trabaja en una empresa dando manutención a las maquinas de la compañía. Le ayuda en lo que mas puede a su esposa. Su deseo es poder ahorrar para comprarse un terrenito. Ya que actualmente ellos viven en la casa de los padres de el.

loans.use: Invest in cosmetics and jewelry

loans.name: Dover

texts.en:
Dover has eight years of experience in business, having dedicated himself to bricklaying work. For his own initiative and with the help of his wife he decided to open a local food store. He worked by himself over week-end from 5 pm to 12 pm. He offers his clients roasted corn [choclos asados], chicken skewers [chuzos] and chicken wings [alitas]. Those close to his wife prepare the products which he sells at the store. His sons are a great help at the store and they are attentive to customer requests.

Dover would like this credit in order to invest in the purchase of provisions and little by little be able to expand his store. He is also looking into the possibility of aslo selling snacks and works every day. One year ago Dover he was shot in the leg, leaivng him without possiblity of working and without receiving pay.

Dover is 42 years old, and is married. He has three sons who are currently studying and help out in the store. His wife also works hard to help at the store. His goal is to be able to expand his store in order to provide better services for his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Dover tiene una experiencia de 8 años en el negocio. El se dedicaba a la albañilería. Por su propia iniciativa y con la ayuda de su esposa decide ponerse el local de venta de comida. Trabaja solo los fines de semana en horario de 5 p.m. hasta las 12 p.m. Ofrece a sus clientes choclos asados, chuzos, alitas. El junto a su esposa preparan los alimentos que por la tarde los venden. Sus hijos son de gran ayuda para el negocio ya que ellos atienden los pedidos de los clientes

Dover desea el crédito para invertir en la compra de víveres y además poco a poco poder ir adecuando su local. También esta pensando en la posibilidad de incluir venta de meriendas y trabajar todos los dias. Dover hace 1 año le dispararon en la pierna lo cual lo dejo imposibilitado de trabajar y por ende sin capital de trabajo. /p>

Dover tiene 42 años, es casado. Tiene 3 hijos los que estudian y le ayudan en el negocio. Su esposa es de gran ayuda para su trabajo. Su deseo es poder agrandar su negocio para darles un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

loans.use: Adapt to his premises and buy more provisions for his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in eggs, ham and cheeses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Set up a new point of sale

loans.name: Edison

texts.en:
Edison has 8 years of experience in his cabinetry workshop. He learned his trade working for another person. Later, his father recognized his personal qualities and helped him buy his own tools. Still later, he began to manufacture his own products, with which he has done very well. He currently has other cabinet-makers working for him. His work begins at 8 am and continues till 6 pm. He works every day except Sunday.

Edison is applying for the loan so that he can invest in the chemicals he uses in his business, such as lacquer, paint, diluent, and glue. With another part of the loan, he will invest in wood with which to make his products. His products are in high demand right now.

Edison is 34 years old and married. He has 2 children, both in school. With the fruits of his labor, he has been able to buy a site to house his workshop and is building his house of cement. His wife helps in any way she can in the business, also. He wishes to increase his capital so that he can produce more products and, as a result, increase his earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Edison tiene una experiencia de 8 años en su taller de ebanisteria. Oficio que lo aprendió trabajando para otra persona. Luego de esto su padre vio en el sus cualidades y lo ayuda para que se compre sus propias maquinas. Luego de esto comienza a elaborar sus propios productos con los que le ha ido muy bien. Al momento cuenta con personas a su cargo dándoles trabajo. Su labor comienza a las 8 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m. Trabaja todos los días de la semana excepto los días domingos.

Edison desea el crédito para poder invertir en químicos para su negocio como lo es laca, pintura, diluyente, pegamento y otra parte invertir algo en madera para seguir elaborando sus productos. Al momento tiene una buena demanda de su negocio.

Edison tiene 34 años, es casado. Tiene 2 hijos los que estudian. Fruto de su trabajo ha logrado comprar un solar en donde tiene su taller y esta construyendo su casita de cemento. Su esposa también le ayuda en lo que puede con el negocio. Su deseo es incrementar su capital de trabajo para producir mas productos y por ende obtener mayor ganancia.

loans.use: Invest in chemicals for the manufacture of his products

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en:
Jaime has 8 years of experience selling and repairing shoes, a trade he learned little by little while working for someone else. His initiative to rent a site where he could put his own business was wise, since it has gone very well for him. He works every day of the week from 7 a.m. until 12 p.m., when he closes to business to return home to eat. He opens again from 2 p.m. until 7 p.m. He makes shoes on order for his clients, and repairs shoes and suitcases.

Jaime would like the loan so that he can buy a glass display case in which to display his products. He will also buy raw materials with which to continue producing shoes.

Jaime is single and 40 years old. He lives with a married brother and his mother.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Jaime tiene una experiencia de 8 años en el negocio de ventas y reparacion de calzado. Actividad que aprendió trabajando para otra persona de donde poco a poco fue adquiriendo el conocimiento. Su iniciativa de alquilar un local para poner su negocio fue decisiva ya que le ha ido muy bien. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 7 a.m. hasta las 12 p.m. Luego el cierra su negocio para ir a comer. Lo vuelve abrir desde las 2 p.m. hasta las 7 p.m. Su trabajo consiste en elaborar zapatos los que después los entrega ha clientes fijos. Además en su taller realiza trabajos de costura de zapatos y maletas.

Jaime desea el crédito para poder comprar una vitrina donde poder exhibir sus productos y también comprar materia prima para seguir elaborando zapatos. /p>

Jaime es soltero. Tiene 40 años. Vive con un hermano que es casado y su madre.

loans.use: Buy a glass display case

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth has 5 years of experience selling household products. She used to work as a seamstress. Her husband moved to Spain 7 years ago, which was her motivation for beginning to work. She went to work for the sake of her children, who were still young and needed her financial support. She started her own business and it is going very well. She works every day of the week from 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Her daughter helps her in the business, as well.

Elizabeth would like this loan so that she can add electrical appliances, products she does not currently sell, to her inventory. She already has orders for these items.

Although Elizabeth is married, her husband lives in another country. Periodically he sends her financial help for the children. She is 45 years old and has 3 children. Two of her children are married and no longer live with her. She is living in her in-law's home right now. She aspires to be able to renovate the house where she lives in order to open a bazaar (store)there. She hopes to start that business with the earnings from her present business along with the help of her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Elizabeth tiene una experiencia de 5 años en venta de articulos para el hogar. Ella se dedicaba a la costura. Su esposo viajo hace 7 años a España. Lo que fue el motivo para que ella comience a trabajar. En si lo hizo por sus hijos ya que ellos eran todavía jóvenes y necesitaban su apoyo. Comenzó con su negocio y al momento le va muy bien. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 10 a.m. hasta las 5 p.m. Su hija también le ayuda con las ventas de su negocio.

Elizabeth desea el crédito para incluir dentro de sus ventas artículos eléctricos que no los tiene al momento. Ya que tiene pedidos de ellos.

Elizabeth esta casada pero su esposo esta en otro país. Le envía periódicamente la ayuda para sus hijos. Tiene 45 años y 3 hijos. Dos de ellos ya están casados y no viven con ella. Actualmente vive en la casa de sus suegros. Su aspiración es poder adecuar su casa donde vive para poner un bazar. Negocio que lo piensa poner con las ganancias que genere el actual y también con la ayuda de su esposo.

loans.use: Invest in electrical appliances

loans.name: Maritza

texts.en:
Maritza has 8 years of experience in her business. She learned the trade fron her husband, who worked alongside his brothers from the time he was 12 years old. With her savings he helped her buy the machinery for the repair shop. They currently work together. She sells the lubricants and he repairs the cars. She works every day of the week from 8 a.m. till 6 p.m.

Maritza would like the loan so that she can invest in an additional class of lubricants for cars in order to better serve her clients. Because she does not now carry these lubricants, her husband has to leave his work to go purchase them when they are needed, which takes his time away from the repairs. Their service will be better when they have all the lubricants they need right in the repair shop.

Maritza is 30 years old with 2 children. Together she and her husband have succeeded in moving their business ahead, and now they hope to buy some land, where little by little they will build a home and a new repair workshop. At the moment they are renting both the site of the workshop and their home. They know that with this investment their earnings will increase.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Maritza tiene una experiencia de 8 años con su negocio. Actividad que la aprendió de su esposo el cual trabajaba desde la edad de 12 años junto a sus hermanos. Con los ahorros de ella le ayudo en la compra de maquinarias para el taller. Actualmente ellos trabajan juntos. Ella se dedica a la venta de lubricantes y el repara los carros que llegan al negocio. Trabaja todos los días de la semana desde las 8 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m.

Maritza desea el crédito para invertir en otra clase de lubricantes para los carros y de esta manera darle un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Como no cuenta con estos productos su esposo tiene que salir a comprarlos lo que le lleva tiempo. Una vez ya en el taller su servicio será mejor.

Maritza es casada. Tiene 30 años y 2 hijos. Juntos han lograron sacar adelante el negocio y su deseo es poder comprar un solar. Donde poco a poco ir construyendo su casita e instalar el taller ahí. Actualmente ellos alquilan donde tiene su taller y su domicilio. Saben que con la inversión que realizaran sus ingresos van a mejorar.

loans.use: Invest in lubricants for cars

loans.name: Phorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Phorn N. is a widow living with her four children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She is a hard-working mother struggling to feed her children and parents (who are living with her) by selling fish in the local market. Phorn N., 37 years old, can typically make around $6 a day. One of her children is a construction worker who contributes his daily wage to the household. Her other 3 children are students who help to cook meals for their family while they leave school.

Phorn N. hopes to use the loan to purchase more fish due to great demand from her customers. In the future, Phorn N. hopes to buy her own stand in the market so that she spends less than renting someone ele's monthly. Additionally, if it is possible, she would like to repair her house and send her children to the local university.

loans.use: To purchase more fish

loans.name: Korotoum

texts.en: O. Korotoum, 36 years old, is a dynamic woman with 3 children. She sells bananas and other fruits in Abobo market in the suburb of Abidjan. She has being doing this activity since she was 18. But without enough financial resources she has never got the chance to develop it. With this loan, she wants to diversify her activities in legumes. She wants to go to the fruits and legumes production fields in order to get a better price directly from producers, while continuing to purchase from intermediary sellers.

loans.use: Loan will be used to purchase more stock of goods (banana & other fruits) to benefit from bulk purchase price.

loans.name: Beatriz Adriana

texts.en:
Adriana is 22 years old. She is single and works as an employee in a factory. She lives with her parents, brothers and sisters. 8 months ago she began to sell beauty products to her coworkers, neighbors and friends. She started her business because she needed to help out even more with the family expenses. She wants to be a successful woman and that is the reason that she does two jobs at the same time.

Now she is requesting for a loan of $550.00, because she wants to purchase more merchandise and increase her number of customers by offering a greater variety of products. And we are sure that, if she gets this loan with your help, she will become a great business woman.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Bamba

texts.en:
M. Bamba is a single 23-year-old woman living at Angre near Abidjan. She left school because her parents were not able to pay for university studies. She decided to start a cosmetics sales business in order to pay her evening university courses in law. She has been doing so since 2004 and is now at the bachelor's level.

She wants a loan to expand the business in order to be able to pay for law school next year if she passes the exam. M. has demonstrated ambition and consciousness since she got her first loan with AE&I in 2004.

loans.use: Loan will be used to expand the business

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Ms. Juana was born in Monterrey. She is 40 years old, married, and has 2 children. One daughter, just eight years old, has serious problems with her heart, and she will have surgery next August. This is the reason that Juana needed to start working, helping her husband in the business of selling snacks.

Juana is requesting this loan of $475.00 to purchase more products, so that she can earn more money. She wants to make her family life better and help her husband. You can help this family, and they will appreciate your help. You can make the difference.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Amoin Edith

texts.en:
N. Amoin Edith is a 32-year-old woman with 3 children. She is the concubine of a bus driver who lost his job in 2006. Her clothes sales activities are the main financial resources for her family. She is very dynamic and is helping her husband to purchase a second-hand cab (taxi) in order to continue his activities with his own car.
Her first son is in grammar school and she works hard to help him get beyond the level where she was obliged to stop school because of the poverty of her family. N. Edith is very dynamic and ambitious and fights each day to pull her family out of the precarious situation they live in.

loans.use: Loan will be used to expand the business and diversify products offered.

loans.name: Ana Rosaura

texts.en:
Ana Rosaura was born in Tuxtla Gutierrez, Chiapas. She is 35 years old. She moved to Monterrey when she was 20 years old, with all her family, including her parents, brothers, and sisters, in order to get a better life’s opportunities. Now she has her own family with her husband and a daughter and a son.

Ana works by herself with her business at her house. She has sold furniture to offices for 5 years, and also she sells office supplies, like papers, gift bags, etc. At the beginning of her business she sold two or three furniture’s per month. When the time passed she got a loan and her business increased selling office supplies. Now she needs $475.00 to purchase more merchandise. She will repay this loan in 4 to 8 months. Please give Ana your support to make her business grow up.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Nelly Margarita

texts.en:
Nelly is 32 years old and she is from Monterrey. She is married to David; he is an employee in a factory. They have a son and his name is also David and he is 10 years old.

Nelly has always has worked in her own business. She sells makeup and beauty products to friends, neighbors and relatives. She began to do it because she needed to help her husband with their family expenses. With this activity she is helping him and taking care of her son.

Now she is requesting a loan of $750.00 to increase her inventory for the next Mother’s Day that we are going to celebrate here in Mexico, so that she will be able to sell more and make her business grow.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Enedina

texts.en:
Ms. Enedina is originally from the town of San Nicolás de los Garza in the state of Nuevo León. She works making handicrafts and cushions, a skill which she has learned through taking various classes. Enedina's skill and talent have helped her get ahead in this business. She is the single mother of one small daughter and wants to give her all the best, which is her motivation for working so hard day after day.

In order to continue in her business, Enedina requires a variety of materials to meet the requests of all her customers. She needs a loan of $250.00, which she promises to repay over a period of 3 to 6 months. The growth of this business is in your hands, and so is the well-being of this family. Enedina and her daughter thank you sincerely for your care and collaboration.

loans.use: To buy supplies

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en:
After having worked for eighteen years at a company where he supervised the work of inspectors, three years ago Mr. Fernando was laid off. He has the responsibility of a family, which still relies on him for economic and moral support. Taking advantage of a plot of land which he owns near his house, along with the money he recieved when he was laid off, he decided to open his own business selling office supplies and sweets. His shop is across the street from a school, and he benefits from this strategic location. He would like to diversify his product line, including, for example, accessories for women, and in this way he plans to increase his sales and to continue growing as a micro-entrepreneur.

Fernando is requesting a loan of $475.00, which he will use to buy merchandise, in order to offer better service and variety to his customers. You can be a fundamental part of Fernando's business, and in this was to improve the living conditions of his family. They thank you sincerely for your help.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Dora Elva

texts.en:
Fifteen years ago, Dora's husband suffered an accident. He was granted a very small pension, but it was not sufficient to sustain the family and cover the school fees of the children. At that time Dora decided to start a business selling clothing and sandals. She works all week in the markets and on the weekends she does it outside her house. Sometimes she gets help from her in-laws and her children.

At present, Dora needs a loan of $475.00, which she will use to buy seasonal clothing and sandals. This will permit her to offer a better variety to her customers and in this way increase her sales. She will repay this loan over a period of 4 to 8 months. Today is the day to help someone who really needs it. Dora and her family thank you for your generosity and your support.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

loans.use: To buy merchandise

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Mamounata

texts.en:
Déné Mamounata is a single 44-year-old woman with 5 children. Her husband divorced her because she has had 5 daughters and no boys. The mentality and traditional practices have pushed her out of her home.

Déné is taking care courageously of her 5 daughters. She has decided to send all her 5 daughters to school in order to prove that they can do as well as boys. She is paying all their schools fees from her trade activities.

Deme’s challenge is to fight against poverty and against the retrograde thinking of her ethnic community about females. Let’s contribute to her tremendous challenge.

loans.use: Loan will be used to purchase more goods in order to benefit from bulk purchase price

loans.name: Ama Odette

texts.en:
H. Ama Odette is a single 29-year-old woman with 2 children. She is from a very poor family and did not have a chance to go to school. She lost her parents when she was a child and was forced to marry an old man she never loved. She has left home and lived with her son and her daughter in Anono near Abidjan. She produces and sells cassava, banana, taro and other legumes.

She wants a loan to increase cassava production and acquire equipment for cassava paste processing to add more value to her products.

H. Ama Odette is very dynamic and ambitious despite her difficult situation.

loans.use: Loan will be used to diversify goods and acquire equipment for cassava paste processing

loans.name: Eba Jeanne

texts.en:
A. Eba Jeanne is a war displaced woman. She is 36 and has 3 children. She was living in the western region of Côte d’Ivoire where her husband was killed by rebels in September, 2003. She joined Anono in the suburb of Abidjan in December, 2003 with her 2 boys and her 4-month-old daughter.

Eba Jeanne heard about “Afrique Emergence & Investissements (AE&I)” from her sister who hosted her and her children on her arrival. She then took a $500 loan from AE&I and started selling stewpans, saucepan and bowls. This revenue-generating activity has helped her overcome her difficult situation and covered living expenses for her and her 3 children. Eka Eba Jeanne wants to expand her business and be able to send her second boy to school in October, 2007.

loans.use: Loan will be used to purchase more goods in bulk and benefit from lower price

loans.name: Yoh

texts.en:
C. Yoh, 27 years old, is a dynamic woman with 1 child. She sells various dry food products in Adjame-Willi in the north suburb of Abidjan. She will get married in August, 2007 and her ambition is to be financially and economically autonomous from her husband. This will help her to be able to fully participate in family decision-making and be respected by her husband and loved by her family.

C. wants to expand her activities by adding sugar, milk and rice in the list of products offer. She is ambitious.

loans.use: Loan will be used to expand her activities by adding sugar, milk and rice to her products list

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Mr. Bernadino has a carpentry workshop where he makes all sorts of wooden furniture. He has been using the same equipment for the past 3 years and says "I ask you to please help me buy new machinery to make furniture, because the old one is really hard to work with, it is almost becoming almost obsolete. I believe I can buy new equipment with $1,200."

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. B. tiene un taller de carpintería elabora todo tipo de muebles de madera tiene tres años con estas instalaciones. "Les pido de favor me ayuden a comprar un equipo para la elaboración de muebles, con el actual ya se batalla pues esta obsoleto creo que con $1,200.00 dlls lo compraré".

loans.use: Comprar nuevo equipo de mercancia

loans.name: Fatou

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the fifteen women of the Trois Cocotiers association, led by Fatou S.. In their loan application, the group described their business as follows:

“The group Trois Cocotiers of Ndiaye Ndiaye is a group of women who are motivated by the same will and who work to advance the power of women to make their own decisions, in their natural environment. Our objectives are to provide a source of independence for women, to combat the migration of women from rural villages, and to improve the living conditions of our members.

Business activities: The group plans one principal business activity which will consist of purchasing and reselling seafood products. We will purchase the seafood products that are in high demand in our local market, and resell them for a fair price to the surrounding populations.”

Original French business description:

«Le GIE Trois cocotiers de Ndiaye Ndiaye est un groupement e femmes animer d’une même volonté et qui oeuvrent pour le pouvoir de décision des femmes dans leurs milieu naturel.

Objectif :

Donner une autonomie aux femmes

Lutter contre l’exode des femmes

Améliorer les conditions de vie de ces membres

Activités :

Le groupement se propose une activité principale qui consiste à l’achat et vente de produits halieutique. Il s’agit d’acheter les produits halieutiques très sollicités dans le marché local et les revendre à bon prix aux populations locales.»

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines. Commonly organized by groups of twenty to thirty housewives who live in the same village, the tontines provide poor women throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these associations are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. The SEM Fund works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

loans.use: Purchase of seafood products (oysters, dried fish, shellfish, etc.) from local fishermen; storage and transport to market for retail sale

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 26 years old and very hardworking. Even though she has suffered very much, this hasn’t caused her to give up. She has a 3 year-old son named Sergio Armando. His love and affection keeps up his mother’s spirits. She is a single mother because the man she was going to marry abused her both physically and emotionally. She receives no financial help from the child’s father because she has lost all communication with him. Rosario only completed fourth grade and couldn’t continue studying because, when she was 14 years old, her mother her mother died slowly of a disease that was too costly for the family to treat.

Loan: Rosario says that the experience she has gained by being included in the Friendship Bridge women’s group called Pakachelaj has been very good. She has been able to put into practice some of the leadership skills she has learned as the group’s secretary and she has participated in two loan cycles with Friendship Bridge. She will invest this new loan in cultivating vegetables: onions and carrots (vegetables that grow well in her area) and some export crops, such as broccoli and snow peas. A small part of the loan will be invested in raising chickens of a local breed. The amount she is requesting is $425.00.

Rosario’s Dreams: She would like to provide as much education as possible to her son—she hopes to see him achieve a profession. She hopes that during the next few years she will be able to increase her agricultural production to be more highly competitive in her area.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosario es una mujer de 26 años, muy trabajadora y aunque ha sufrido muchísimo eso no ha sido motivo para que ella se dé por vencido, tiene un niño de tres años de edad el es Sergio Armando un niño que con su cariño anima a su madre ya que es madre soltera porque con la persona con la que se iba a casar la golpeaba mucho y verbalmente la daño muchísimo actualmente no recibe ningún apoyo para la manutención de su hijo debido a que toda la comunicación con el padre del niño se perdió. Estudio hasta el cuarto grado de primaria y no pudo seguir estudiando pues cuando ella tenía catorce años, su madre murió de una enfermedad que según manifiesta era demasiada grave y el tratamiento de ésta, era muy costosa y como no pudieron con esto la madre fue muriendo lentamente.

CREDITO: Rosario manifiesta que la experiencia que ha obtenido en Puente de Amistad al estar incluida en un grupo de mujeres de nombre Pakachelaj, ha sido muy buena ya que ha podido poner en practica un tanto de liderazgo comunitario dentro de este grupo pues ella era la secretaria del grupo y ha participado en dos ciclos de crédito con la institución. Ella invertirá el capital, en el cultivo de hortalizas: cebolla, zanahoria (cultivos de la zona) y algunos cultivos de exportación como Brócoli y arbeja dulce y una pequeña parte para la cría de algunas gallinas criollas. Y el monto que solicita actualmente es de $ 425.00.

  • LOS SUEÑOS DE ROSARIO:

    • Brindarle todo el estudio posible a su hijo ya que desea verlo hecho todo un profesional.Desea que en unos años logre aumentar su producción agrícola y ser competitiva en otro nivel productivo del área.

loans.use: To grow vegetables such as carrots and onions

loans.name: Fatou Ndour

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the fifteen women of the Jeunes Femmes de Ndiaye Ndiaye association, led by Fatou Ndour S.. In their loan application, the group described their business as follows:

“The group Jeunes Femmes de Ndiaye Ndiaye is a group of women who are motivated by the same will and who work to advance the power of women to make their own decisions, in their natural environment. Our objectives are to alleviate the burden of the housewife, to provide a source of independence for women, to combat the migration of women from rural villages, and to improve the living conditions of our members.

Business activities: The activities planned by the group consist, among other things, of retail trade in local products [such as dried fish, palm oil, peanuts, salt, mangoes, brooms and baskets woven from palm fronds, etc.], which is the main business of our group. This consists of purchasing diverse products that are in high demand in our local market, and reselling them for a fair price to the surrounding populations.”

Original French business description:

«Le GIE des jeunes femmes de Ndiaye Ndiaye est un groupement e femmes animer d’un même idéal est d’une même volonté et qui oeuvrent pour le pouvoir de décision des femmes dans leurs milieu naturel.

Objectif :

Alléger le panier de la ménagère

Donner une autonomie aux femmes

Lutter contre l’exode des femmes

Améliorer les conditions de vie de ces membres

Activités :

Les activités que se propose le groupement sont entre autre le commerce qui reste l’activité principale du groupement. Il s’agit d’acheter des marchandises divers très sollicités dans le marché local et les revendre à bon prix aux populations locales»

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines. Commonly organized by groups of twenty to thirty housewives who live in the same village, the tontines provide poor women throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these associations are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. The SEM Fund works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

loans.use: Purchase and storage of local village products; transportation to market for retail sale

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a 36 year-old woman from the small town of Monte Mercedes. Her husband’s name is Rogelio Sequec and she has five children. She shows herself to be a very good mother, which is demonstrated by the fact that when she married, she also adopted as her own her husband’s two children from a previous marriage. Of her own five children, four are currently studying.

She only made it to third grade and couldn’t continue studying because she had many brothers and sisters. Her father preferred that only the boys study until sixth grade, and she was destined to work in the kitchen with her mother. On occasion, her father would take her to the fields to help out with the corn crop and to do other agricultural work.

When she was 22 years old, she married and moved to the town of Concepción, Sololá, which is where she lives now. She works with her family to grow onions and they also have a small store.

Loan: Rosita says that being able to invest capital in her business has been one of the best things that has happened to her. She realized that the amount she received almost seven months ago has made a difference in her business. She has been able to supply her store better and her sales have increased accordingly. The amount she is currently requesting is Q. 4,000.00 Guatemalan Quetzals (approx. $450.00).

Dreams: When asked about her dreams, she responds with tears in her eyes… “I don’t want my children to suffer like I have suffered from not knowing many of the things one learns in school. For this reason, my husband and I have decided to help our children get ahead, so that someday they won’t have to work in the fields like we have had to do, because it is very hard work.”

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosita, es una mujer de 36 años de edad originaria de la aldea Monte Mercedes, esposa de Rogelio Sequec, madre de cinco niños y demuestra ser muy buena madre ya que cuando se caso también adopto como propios a dos hijos de su esposo de un matrimonio anterior, de sus cuatro hijos propios cuatro están actualmente estudiando

Ella únicamente alcanzo el primer grado de primaria pero ya no pudo continuar debido a que eran muchos hermanos y el padre prefirió darles estudio únicamente a sus hijos varones hasta sexto de primaria y ella fue destinada a trabajar con la madre en la cocina y en ocasiones el padre se la llevaba al campo a trabajar en el calzado de la milpa y algunos otros trabajos agrícolas

A los veintidós años se caso y se traslado al municipio de Concepción, Sololá en donde vive actualmente y se dedica junto a su familia al cultivo de cebolla, a la administración de una pequeña tienda

CREDITO: Ella manifiesta que el brindarle un capital para su negocio ha sido una de las mejores cosas que le ha pasado, pues ella se da cuenta que con el monto que recibió hace casi siete meses ha visto un progreso en su negocio, ha podido surtir mejor su tienda y ve que las ventas igualmente han mejorado muchísimo. El monto que solicita actualmente es de: Q. 4,000.00.<7p>

SUEÑOS: Con lagrimas en los ojos… ella responde… • No quiero que mis hijos pequeños sufran como yo he sufrido por no saber mucho de los que se aprende en la escuela. Por eso nos hemos propuesto sacar adelante a nuestros hijos con mi esposo, para que algún día ellos no trabajen en el campo como lo hemos hecho nosotros, pues es un trabajo muy duro

loans.use: To grow vegetables and to buy merchandise for her basic goods store

loans.name: Yorma

texts.en:
Yorma is a repeat lender in the Mifex and Kiva program. She has done great with her first loan. She was able to invest in new products that were extremely popular during the end of the year because of the Christmas season. With the profits she made from those months, she was able to put tile on her floor, which was made out of cement before, and she was also able to buy some more mirrors. Yorma's business is now at a new level. Clients visit her more often because of the cleanliness of the shop and wholesalers supply her more because of the quantity of beauty products she sells.

She is very happy with the results of her investments and she is eager to continue growing. In fact, Yorma paid off her first loan ahead of schedule because of her success and her desire to receive further financing. She now wants to buy a high chair that will allow to her cut children's hair. She is hoping she will be able to break into this market as she sees that there are very few shops that focus on kids haircuts. She will also continue investing in hair and beauty products for her clients.

Her four children have benefited from the loan as they have had extra money to spend on clothes and materials for the new school year. Her husband does not help her anymore, as he is now working with Mifex as one of our new loan officers. Yorma feels extremely grateful that she has been able to grow along with our Credit Union and she is sends her appreciation to the lenders worldwide who have supported Ecuadorian entrepreneurs.

loans.use: Buy a new high chair and continue investing in inventory for her shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in materials to make rugs, handbags, clothes and other artisan work

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita has 12 years of experience selling meat and pork. She works in this business together with her husband. She has succeeded in taking the business forward little by little with her savings. Currently she sells pork and chickens by the pound. She works only weekends, from 7 a.m. to 12 a.m. She and her husband slaughter the chickens they later distribute to their clients in the food business.

Margarita wants this loan so that she can invest in more meat, which will allow her to increase her earnings. She hopes that with the investment she will be able to work every day of the week.

Margarita is married with 4 adult children. She lives with her husband, her mother and a grandchild whom she is raising. Her husband handles the distribution of the chickens and pork. She helps him prepare the carcasses. He also works making deliveries with a cart the couple owns. In addition to her business, Margarita works in an administrative position in a health clinic. She is hoping that with this investment she will be able to improve her life and that of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Margarita tiene una experiencia de 12 años en el negocio de venta de carne y de chancho, actividad que la trabaja junto a su esposo. Ella poco a poco con sus ahorros ha logrado sacar adelante el trabajo. Actualmente venden carne de chancho y pollos por libras. Trabaja solo los fines de semana. En horario de 7 a.m. hasta las 12 a.m. Junto a su esposo se encargan de matar los pollos que luego los distribuyen a personas conocidas del sector.

Margarita desea el crédito para poder invertir en carnes lo que a ella le daría mayor ganancia. Lo que espera con la inversión poder trabajar también todos los días de la semana.

Margarita es casada. Tiene 4 hijos los que ya están adultos. Ahora vive junto a su esposo, su mama y un nieto que ella lo esta criando. Su esposo es la persona que prácticamente se encarga de repartir los pollos y chanchos. Ella ayuda en pelarlos. El también trabaja en un carrito que tienen. Saliendo a realizar fletes. Margarita además de su negocio trabaja en un centro de salud en el puesto de Auxiliar de Servicio. Esperando que con la inversión que realiza poder ir mejorando su vida y la de su familia.

loans.use: Invest in a greater quantity of meat and chicken

loans.name: Mariano

texts.en:
Mariano has worked out of a cabinetry workshop in his home for two years. He gained his experience working with family members from the time he was 13 years old. He started his business with a loan sent from Spain by his sister. With that loan Mariano bought unfinished coffins; he works to finish them. His wife creates the upholstery inside the coffins. Mariano has 3 clients to whom he sells his finished products. His work hours are 7:30 a.m. to 6:30 p.m.

Mariano is applying for a loan because demand for his products has increased; his current clients have been referring other potential buyers to him. He needs the loan to buy more unfinished coffins so that he can meet his new clients' demand and generate more income.

Mariano is 23 years old and married with a 3 year old daughter. He lives in his mother-in-law's house. He dreams of buying himself a plot of land with the earnings this investment will generate.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Mariano tiene un taller de ebanistería ubicado en su domicilio desde hace 2 años. Su experiencia la tiene porque trabajo con familiares desde los 13 años. Se inicio con su negocio con préstamo que le envió su hermana desde España. Con este préstamo Mariano compro ataúdes Semielaborados siendo su participación en darles Acabados. Su esposa le confecciona el tapizado interior del cofre mortuorio. Mariano tiene 3 clientes a quienes provee de sus productos terminados. Su atención es de 7:30 AM a 18:30 PM.

Mariano solicita un préstamo porque su demanda se ha incrementado, debido a que a quienes provee lo están refiriendo. Razón por lo que necesita crédito para comprar mas ataúdes semilaborados y cubrir la demanda de sus nuevos clientes y generar mas ingresos.

Mariano tiene 23 años es casado y tiene una hija de 3 años. Vive en casa de la suegra y tiene como anhelo comprarse un terreno con los ingresos que le generara la inversión en su negocio con el préstamo solicitado.

loans.use: Invest in more unfinished coffins

loans.name: Clímaco

texts.en:
Clímaco has sold fruit in the Caraguay market for 16 years. He works every day of the week and serves his clients with the help of his mother in two shifts: mornings from 5 a.m. to 12 p.m. and afternoons from 2 p.m. to 4 p.m.

With this loan Clímaco will buy various fruit, such as papaya, oranges, melons, grapes, bananas and other tropical fruit. His demand has increased and he needs capital to fulfill the needs of his clients. Clímaco not only sells wholesale, but retail as well.

Clímaco is 42 years old. His 2 children are in school; he is raising them alone because his wife abandoned him. His mother is his support in the household and the business. Clímaco points out that with the new investment in his business his earnings will increase and he will improve his quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Clímaco tiene negocio de venta de frutas varias en el Mercado Caraguay desde hace 16 años. Labora todos los días de la semana y atiende a sus clientes con ayuda de su mama en dos horarios en la mañana desde las 5AM a 12PM en las tardes desde las 14: PM a 16: PM.

Con el crédito Clímaco comprara frutas varias tales como: Papaya, Naranjas, Melones, Uvas, Bananas y otras frutas tropicales porque su demanda se ha incrementado y necesita capital para poder cumplir con sus clientes. Clímaco no solo vende al por mayor, sino también al por menor.

Clímaco tiene 42 años 2 hijos que están estudiando los esta criando sin su esposa por que ella lo abandono. Su mama es su apoyo en su hogar y negocio. Clímaco indica que con la nueva inversión en su negocio sus ganancias se incrementaran y mejorara su calidad de vida.

loans.use: Invest in a variety of fruit

loans.name: Ndeye

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the women of the Niaq Jarinu 2 association, led by Ndeye S.. In their loan application, the group described their business as follows:

“Project Context: The group is already active in marketing various products. The loan will cover a project involving the sale of local grains and seafood products by the women, following a rotation of ten people per lending period.

Purpose of the Loan: To increase the income of the women of our group, to establish a fund for a collective vegetable garden, and to support the loan recipients in achieving their purchase and sale objectives.

Business Activities: Sale of artisan products and vegetables; food sales, and small-scale retailing of local products [such as millet, dried fish and oysters, peanuts, palm oil, etc].

Method of Payment: The tourist market is not saturated in Foundioune, which is a large town. The revolving credit practiced by our group allows for higher returns on investment because it encourages a division of credit among our members and a sharing of risks. To repay the loan, our group proposes to make monthly installments over a period of twelve months. The success of our first loan, which did not cover all our members, has allowed us to apply for a second loan to cover the remaining members of our group.”

Original French business description:

«Contexte du Projet: Le groupement est déjà actif sur la commercialisation de produits divers. La prêt doit couvrir un projet de vente de céréales locales et de fruits de mer à l’intention des femmes suivant une rotation de 10 personnes par période de prêt.

Objectifs du Prêt :

- augmenter les revenus des femmes membres du groupement

- disposer d’un fond de départ pour l’aménagement ultérieur d’un potager collectif

- appuyer les bénéficiaires dans la réalisation de leurs objectifs d’achat et de vente

Activités :

- vente de produits artisanaux et de légumes

- restauration et vente

- petit commerce

Mode de paiement : Le marché du tourisme n’est pas saturé à Foundiougne qui est une grande ville. Le crédit revolving permet de mieux rentabiliser l’investissement dans la mesure où il favorise une division du crédit entre ses membres et un partage des risques. Pour la couverture du prêt, le groupement propose des versements mensuels pendant douze mois. L’état d’avancement de notre premier prêt qui na pas pu couvrir tout le groupement nous a permis de solliciter un second prêt pour pouvoir intéresser l’ensemble des membres dudit groupement.»

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines. Commonly organized by groups of twenty to thirty housewives who live in the same village, the tontines provide poor women throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these associations are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. The SEM Fund works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

loans.use: Bulk purchase of local products such as millet, dried seafood, palm oil, hand-woven mats and brooms, vegetables, etc.; storage and transportation to market for retail sale

loans.name: Hy

texts.en: Hy Chanthorn is 46-year-old and a mother of 5 children who lives with her husband in Phnom Penh, Camboida. She generates her income by selling palm sugar in the village and usually makes about $10/day of income. Her husband is self-employed as a tuk-tuk driver and makes  around $10/day. Two of Chanthorn's sons are tuk-tuk drivers as well, while another one is a construction worker. Their daily revenue is contributed to the household. Furthermore, the loan allows C. to purchase a trailer for her business and buy some wood to repair the house from leaking in the rainy season. In the future, C. wants a stand to sell her sugar at the market, where she will make her additional income. Eventually, if she saves enough money, she thinks about being able to build a new house and send her children to a university.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer for a business and repair house from leaking during the rainy season.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Chan T. is 32 years old and lives with her husband Hou Thim in the Kampung Cham Province, Cambodia. They both work very hard, and just gave birth to a new baby. She and her husband make a living by planting and cultivating crops in their field and make around $5/day from their plantation. This couple is striving to work almost day and night in their field plowing, cultivating, and fertilizing soil to grow more crops due to a great demand in the market. They hope to use a loan to purchase one horse and a cart in order to transport crops from their farm to the local market. In the future, they hope to save more money to buy one more plantation so they can grow a wider range of crops for an addtional income. Chan T. hopes one day she will have enough money to send her children to a local univesity.

loans.use: To purchase one horse and a cart to work in the farm .

loans.name: Yim

texts.en:
Yim R. is a mother of 3 children and lives with her husband and her parents in Kampung Cham province, Cambodia. She and her husband (picture here because R. is unavailable) make their living by making a small kind of brick oven and growing some crops in the field.They typically make around $8 a day. One of their children is a student, while the other two are too young to go to school. This couple works very hard by making brick ovens in response to their daily customer's demand. Yim R. hopes to use the loan to purchase a water pumping machine to grow crops, to dig a well, and to buy some tools to make ovens.
In the future, this couple hopes to make an additional income by expanding their business. If they save enough money, they would like to build a new house and keep supporting their chldren's studies until they can get a job themselves.

loans.use: To Purchase a pumping machine, to buy some business tools and to dig a well.

payments.comment: Congrats! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for taking a sincere interest in helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Yim Run start and sustain their businesses. Your willingness to share your financial resources has made a difference. We hope you continue to lend through CREDIT in the future. Sincerely, Joshua Benadum, CREDIT Intern, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Chun

texts.en:
Yim C. T.,is 29-years-old, is a mother of two children living with her husband in Kampuncham Province, Camboida. The couple makes their living by selling salt at the local market. This couple normally generates their income around $17/day and their children are students. They are involved in their business when they leave school.
C. T. hopes to use the loan to purchase more salt in response to their customer's demand. In the future, this couple hopes to make more additional income by opening a small enterprise with some workers to run their business. They want to be able to send their children to a university as well.

loans.use: To purchase more salt to run her business.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
In her business, Angela sells general products including clothing she makes herself. She started her business 4 years ago with 5 years of experience; she used to help her mother in the business. With her own savings, Angela started her business selling fashion accessories, children's clothing, blouses, kitchen utensils, such as sets of glasses, plates and pots, and other products. Angela also makes dresses, blouses and skirts. She tends to her business every day of the week from 6 a.m. to 10 p.m.

Angela wants a loan so that she can invest in more products: school supplies, clothing, and gifts.

Angela is 26 years old with 2 children, both in school. Her husband works in a meat business. Angela's house is currently under construction; she still has a dirt floor. She has confidence that with this loan her earnings will improve and she will be able to finish her floor.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Ángela tiene negocio donde vende productos generales incluyendo confección de Ropa. Se inicio con su negocio desde hace 4 años y una experiencia de 5 años porque ayudaba a su mama en el negocio. Angela con su propio ahorro dio inicio a su tienda vendiendo bisuterías, ropa de niños, blusas, utensilios para la cocina como juegos de vasos, platos, ollas y otros productos. Además Angela también confecciona vestidos, blusas, faldas. Atiende todos los días de la semana desde las 6: AM a 22: PM.

Angela desea un préstamo para poder invertirlo en mas productos de útiles escolares, ropa y regalos.

Ángela tiene 26 años 2 hijos. Ellos estudian. Su esposo también trabaja en un negocio de carnes. Ángela tiene su casa en construcción, y su piso actualmente es de tierra. Ella tiene la confianza que con el préstamo sus ingresos mejorara y por ende podrá terminar su piso.

loans.use: Buy inventory for her store

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea S. T. is 26 years old and lives with her husband and young child in Kampung Cham province, Cambodia. She runs a hairdresser shop and can typically earn around $2.5/day. Her husband (Pictured here because S. T. is unavailable) is a horse cart driver and normally makes around $4/day. S. T. hopes to use the loan to purchase some tools for her hairdresser shop and the rest will beused to repair the house from the leaking in the rainy season. 
In the future, S. T. hopes to make an additional income by extending her shop and teaching some students to help her. She would also like to save more money to supplement her child's education.

loans.use: To purchase some tools for her hairdresser shop.

loans.name: Phal

texts.en:
Phal P., 33-years-old, is a father of 2 children living with his wife and his parents in Kampung cham province, Cambodia. He makes his living by feeding and selling pigs and chickens, and can typically earn around $5 a day, while his wife stays at home to look after her children. One of his children is a student and another is too young to go to school. Phal Part, is struggling to supplement his family, especially his parents by feeding and selling pigs and chickens. Eventually  he hopes, the loan will allow him to make additional profits by purchasing more pigs and chickens to feed and sell at the local market. 
In the future, he expects to expand his business by purchasing one more piece of land to feed more pigs and chickens. If he has enough money, he would like to decorate his house and to send his children to a local university.

loans.use: To purchase more pigs and chickens to feed and sell to the local market.

loans.name: Abdurrahman

texts.en: Abdurrahman lives in Kongowe area in Dar es Salaam. He is married with three children. He owns a shop selling soft drinks in retail and wholesale. He has another business of selling fruits and vegetables of which his wife is in charge. Soft drinks business has higher turnover in his shop, mainly caused by hot weather of Dar es Salaam. Demand for soft drinks is high. Abdurrahman cannot meet this demand. He is in need of $1200 as a working capital to meet the demand for cold drinks. The more sales he makes will enable him get extra income for paying school fees for his children and improve his income level.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks for his store

loans.name: Baltazar

texts.en: Baltazar N. is married with four children and lives in the Tandika area of Dar es Salaam. He owns a small shop in the Tandika market where he sells new imported clothes. He is planning to include shoes in the store but his capital is not sufficient to cover this new business line. Baltazar needs funding of $750 to rent more space to facilitate an attractive display and expand his business to include shoes.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Bernadeta

texts.en: Bernadeta S. is married and has two children. She lives in Yombo area of Dar es Salaam. Bernadeta collects fresh fish from the Indian Ocean shores, spices and fries them, and sells the fish near her residence. She wants to make her  business attractive by improving sanitary conditions and purchasing other necessary supplies for her business premises. A display case and aluminum-foil wrapping materials would make her business more attractive to her customers. This will increase her sales and profit. Next year her first born will join secondary school. The increased income will enable her save for school fees. To implement her plan, she needs a loan of $550.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en: Haruna S. lives in a suburb called Lumo, adjacent to the Dar es Salaam International Airport (DIA) in Dar es Salaam. She is single, with no children, but supports a family of seven people including her parents. She sells fried fish near her home and has been in this business for 3 years. Her lack of capital and the cost of living that a large family demands have kept her business stagnant. She is planning to expand the business with an extra stock of cooking oil and charcoal. She will also need a large display case for the cooked fish and a deep freezer to keep fish fresh before cooking them. Haruna needs funding of $750 to make her plan work.

loans.use: BUSINESS EXPANSION

loans.name: Isack

texts.en: Isack W. lives in the Kitunda area in Dar es Salaam. He is married and has five children, two of which are in primary school and two in secondary school. Isack keeps chickens (layers and broilers) near his residence. He is planning on increasing the flock of chickens from 300 to 500. Isack must employ one person to take charge of the increased stock. The expansion strategy needs additional funding to buy more chicks and a stock of poultry feed. Isack's goal is to pay school fees for his secondary school children and increase the income for his family. Isack also owns a shop selling different consumable items (the shop in the photo), especially cold drinks. He opened this shop one year ago but in order to fill the shelves needs more working capital. To implement his growth plan, he needs additional funding of $1200.

loans.use: WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: Joyce
