texts.en: Joyce M. M. is married with  three children. She lives in the Ilala area of Dar es Salaam. Joyce has a shop that sells cosmetics. She has been in this business for more than 3years and previously ran a food-vending business. That business was not profitable because of inappropriate business skills and frequent cholera outbreaks in her area, which led to frequent restriction in food-vending by authorities. On the advice of a friend, she decided to start a cosmetics business.In January 2006, she attended a Business and Entrepreneurship Training offered by YOSEFO. She noticed a tremendous improvement in her business after putting into practice the lessons she learned. She now want to replenish her stock after the sales she made during Easter and needs a loan of $1000.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Sohaila

texts.en: Sohaila lives in District 6 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is married and she doesn’t have children. She and her husband live alone. She is a tailor. She has good working experience and she wants to take a loan to buy new machines because all the equipment that she has is old. She wants to get new machines to help her husband and make a good life for their future. She would like to thank AFSG.

loans.use: Buy sewing machines

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam lives in Tandika, the Temeke District in Dar es Salaam. She is married with four children and the elder daughter is in secondary school. Mariam runs a tailoring  business on the veranda of her home. The business hasn't been good recently due to insufficient sewing materials and competition from her neighbors. She wants to improve her business by increasing her supply of sewing materials and renting a business premise. The veranda of her house does not attract customers and does not provide enough space. She also wants to buy two saving machines and employ one assistant; a strategy that requires funding of $550.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mir Shah

texts.en:
Mir Shah lives in District 6 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He has 30 years of experience in his job. He works as a shopkeeper and he has a general store. He is uneducated.

Now he wants to enlarge his business and he needs money so he wants to take a loan from AFSG. He wants to be a good business dealer and to find more clients and find close relations with other businessmen until he can realize his best wishes. He hopes that he can do it.

loans.use: Buy Tea, Sugar, Soft Drinks, Flour, Ghee, etc.

loans.name: Hala Gul

texts.en: Hala Gul lives in District 6 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is a women who lives alone and supports herself  as a quilt maker. She is good at her job. She wants to take a loan to buy a machine for herself to make her work easier and to support herself better than now and make sure that she doesn’t face with any economic problems in the future. She is very happy about this loan because she can support herself.

loans.use: Buying Fabrics, Cotton, Needles, etc.

loans.name: Paskazia

texts.en: Paskazia lives in the Tandika area of Dar es Salaam. She is married with two children. In her tailoring business, Paskazia makes and repairs both men's and women's clothes. She employs one assistant. With additional capital of $750, she can buy two sewing machines, employ another assistant, and buy other tailoring supplies. This expansion strategy will help her increase her income. One of her two sons is in secondary school and an increased income will help her pay for school fees and other associated costs.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Abdul Latif

texts.en: Abdul Latif lives in District 6 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and he is a shopkeeper. He has a shop that sells video cassettes and he imports cassettes from Pakistan, India, and Iran. He wants to expand his business so he wants to take a loan and increase his imports. He also wants to open another shop in another district in Kabul. He is very happy now because he can solve all his problems with this loan.

loans.use: Buying Cassettes, CD's and DVD's

loans.name: Ramzia

texts.en:
Ramzia lives in District 6 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is an uneducated woman. She is married and she and she wants to help her husband, who is a plumber. He wants to open a shop in main city of Kabul because lots of the construction companies are there who always need plumbers. His wants to take the loan to help her husband make a good life for themselves. She is happy to be able to help her husband.

Note the picture featured in this business profile is the husband of entrepreneur. In Afghanistan, it is culturally unacceptable for some people to post a picture of a woman to the Internet. The loan is to the female entrepreneur.

loans.use: Buy plumbing supplies

loans.name: Salima

texts.en: Salima S. lives in the Makangarawe area in Dar es Salaam and owns a charcoal store near her residence. She has been in this business for 9 years now. She often runs out of stock and need to increase the size of the stock to smoothly run her charcoal business. Salima is planning to use her own savings as 20% of her total expansion cost. She needs a working capital boost of $550.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Rahima

texts.en:
Rahima lives in district 17 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She lives with her husband and she is uneducated. She hopes to help her husband, who is a taxi driver. He needs money because his car engine is now useless and he wants to buy a new engine to work on and new tires. This will allow him to expand his business and help his family. He is happy that his wife is taking this loan to solve his problems.

Note: The picture featured in this business profile is the husband of entrepreneur. In Afghanistan, it is culturally unacceptable to some people to post a picture of a woman to the Internet. However, the loan is to the female entrepreneur.

loans.use: Buy Tires, Repair Engine

loans.name: Pili

texts.en: Pili S. lives in the Yombo area in Dar es Salaam and is married with three children. Pili sells non-alcoholic beverages. Her stock supply ran out after Easter, when sales were great. She would like to replenish the stock and rent another premise (new outlet) to increase sales. To fulfill her plan, she needs funding of $750.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Asifa

texts.en: Asifa lives in District 17 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is a tailor and she is widow. Her husband died  5 years after their wedding in an explosion in Kabul. She supports her family and her children. She needs money to buy new sewing machines because she has 3 students who  work with her. She wants to buy a new sewing machine for each one of them so that she can expand her business and help her children. She hopes that she can develop this business.

loans.use: Buy sewing machines

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en: Rehema Said lives in Tandika in Dar es Salaam and is married with two children. Rehema was trained in tailoring by a Baptist Church in Dar es Salaam. She now runs a tailoring business, specializing in women's and children's clothes. She employs one assistant, and would like to expand her business by adding two sewing machines and one more assistant. Rehema also sells eggs as a subsidiary business. She buys eggs from poultry keepers and resells them at retail. She would like to improve this business by adding trays for carrying eggs. To facilitate her two businesses, Rehema needs funding of $750.

loans.use: WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.en:
Mr. Víctor has had his business for a year. He says "I sell Chicharrones (pork rind) and cueritos at home and I deliver them to several shopping areas. This is what supports me and my family. I would like to buy more raw material to expand my delivery routes and thus obtaining more income. I need to borrow $1,000 to invest in this business."

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. Víctor tiene 1 año con su negocio “Tengo una venta de Chicharrones y cueritos en mi casa los cuales reparto en varios centros comerciales, de ahí vivimos mi familia y yo, me gustaría poder comprar más materia prima para ampliar mis rutas de entrega y así tener más ingresos". Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para invertir en el negocio.

loans.use: Invertor en el negocio

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Mr. Rodríguez has been serving his community for 10 years selling goods at his grocery store. Along with his wife, Mr. Rodríguez takes care of the store and says, "I opened this grocery store with the help of my wife after I retired. We need to keep it well supplied because it is our only source of income. This is way we are asking for a $1,000 loan."

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. R. lleva una década sirviéndole a la comunidad con su tienda de abarrotes, él y su esposa son las personas encargadas de atender el negocio. "Desde mi retiro laboral me he dedicado a la venta de abarrotes con la ayuda de mi mujer por eso necesitamos tener bien surtida nuestra tienda pues es nuestra única fuente de ingresos, solicitamos $1,000.00 dlls.

loans.use: Para comprar grandes cantidades de mercancia.

loans.name: Anival

texts.en:
Mr. Suárez has a workshop that offers auto repair and painting services on the east side of the city. Because he has been in that area for a long time and because of his good customer service, Mr. Suárez cannot keep pace with the growing demand. He says "I have started to think about expanding my business, thus I need $1,200 to hire two employees and buy enough material and equipment."

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. Suárez tiene un taller de enderezado y pintura en el oriente de la ciudad, por la antigüedad en ese sector y su buena atención a los clientes no se da abasto. "Ha llegado el momento de pensar en extenderme y para esto necesito dar empleo a 2 personas y comprar suficiente material y herramienta, con 1,200.00 dlls.

loans.use: Para extender su negocio.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.en:
Mr. M. has a workshop on the west side of the city where he does vulcanization. He has been in this business for 2 years and still has not been able to acquire proper equipment to do his work. Mr. M. says "I need a hydraulic tire changer and several pneumatic guns; these would help reduce 50% of the average time spent with each client, and to buy these tools I need a $1,200 loan."

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. M. tiene una vulcanizadora de llantas automotriz en el poniente de la ciudad, lleva 2 años y aun no ha podido obtener el equipo adecuado para elaborar los trabajos. "Necesito una desmontadora hidráulica y varias pistolas neumáticas, esto me va a ayudar a reducir en un 50 % el tiempo promedio con cada cliente, para esto necesito $1,200.00 dlls

loans.use: Para comprar una desmontadora hidráulica y pistolas neumáticas.

loans.name: José Luis

texts.en:
Mr. R. has been selling school supplies for the past 12 years. He has always had the support of his family when it comes to attending clients. Mr. R. says "I would like to keep my store well supplied; I need to sell more products on a daily basis and to achieve this, I must maintain the competition level. I would like to sell office supplies and stationary, thus I need a $1,200 loan."

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. R. lleva 12 años con este tipo de comercio (artículos escolares), siempre es apoyado por su familia para la atención de los clientes. "Quiero mantener bien surtida mi papelería necesito vender cada día mas y para esto debo mantener el nivel de la competencia el propósito es vender artículos y papelería utilizada para oficinas, para esto necesito $1,200.00 dlls

loans.use: Comprar articulos para su papeleria.

loans.name: Ma. De Jesus Regina

texts.en:
Mrs. Hernández has a small grocery store and she would like to change it to a general store and provide a greater variety of products. She says "The first thing I'll do is improve the place and then stock it with the basic products all households need. In order to do this, I need a $1,200 loan."

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Hernández tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes su deseo es convertirla en una tienda regular y sobre todo tener variedad de productos. "Creo que lo primero que voy a realizar es mejorar el lugar y posteriormente surtirlo con la mayoría de los productos básicos que se necesitan en cualquier hogar, para esto necesito $1,200.00 dlls".

loans.use: Mejorar el lugar y surtirlo de productos.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Mr. M. opened his business 3 years ago and his wife and son help him watch it. He supplies bread for many stores in his area. Mr. M. says "I'd like to keep all my customers happy, but my mixer broke down so I can no longer make the same amount of bread. I need your help for a $1,200 loan."

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. M. ha formado su negocio en tres años y lo atienden su hijo y su esposa, él provee a varios negocios del sector. "Quiero seguir manteniendo a todos mis clientes contentos, solo que la batidora que tengo se quemo y ya no puedo producir la misma cantidad de piezas de pan, solicito su ayuda, con $1,200.00 dlls

loans.use: Comprar una batidora industrial.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.en:
Mr. H. has had his snack bar for 10 years. Both he and his wife have supported this business. Mr. H. says "I have a lot of experience with the snack business, and now I would like to improve my luncheonette in order to keep offering a great service for my clients. This is why I need a $1,200 loan."

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. H. lleva una década con su lonchería entre él y su esposa han sacado adelante este negocio. "Ya tengo mucha experiencia en la cuestión de los lonches hoy deseo reacondicionar mi puesto para seguir brindando un magnifico servicio a mis clientes para esto solicito un préstamo de $1,200.00 dlls

loans.use: Reacondicionar el puesto

loans.name: Kol

texts.en: Kol C. is 24 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  C. runs a tailoring business where she sells clothes to people at the local market.  Her business typically generates about $6.00 per day.  Her husband, is a credit officer at a bank and can make about $4.00 per day.  Their two children are very young and still attend school.  C. hopes to use the loan to purchase more clothes to expand her tailoring business.  In the future, the family hopes to have enough money to build a concrete house.  Eventually, they dream they will be able to send their children to a university.

loans.use: To buy clothes to expand tailoring business.

payments.comment: Congratulation! Mrs. Kol Chandy has successfully paid off her KIVA loan early.

loans.name: Soum

texts.en: Soum N. is 35 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  N. is a garment worker and makes about $3.00 per day.  Her husband is a moto-taxi driver and usually makes about $5.00 per day.  The couple has two children.  One of their daughters (who is pictured here) is still a student, while the other works in a garment factory, making about $60 a month.  N. hopes to use this loan to buy a cow which she will raise and then sell to a butcher at the market.  In the future, N. and her husband hope to have enough money to build a new house for the family.  Eventually, they hope they will be able to send their daughter to a university.

loans.use: To buy a cow to raise

loans.name: Santos

texts.en:
Santos P. has a small piece of land in Santa Lucia, Ecuador. Although his farm is small, it has been providing for him and his family for about 20 years. He is now seeking to make an investment in order to make his lands become more productive. He wants to invest in fertilizers and pesticides in order to improve the rice he grows. William and his family also raise pigs on their farm, only selling them when they are in need of money. William has his rice processed and commercialized at his association’s facilities.

The Santa Lucia Communal Bank

He is part of one of the newest Communal Banks in the recently developed Mifex Rural Finance Program. All of the members of the Centro Agricola de Santa Lucia Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers in Santa Lucia. They will use the microloans to prepare their lands and cultivate rice on their farms. Because they form part of a communal bank, they are all each other's guarantors for the loan. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the Centro Agricola Association are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many microfinance programs, but Mifex believes that is imperative for the communities we work with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Below is more information about Santa Lucia compiled by Luis Crespo and Robert Edgar of the Mifex team when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program. Special thanks to Mario Balazantegui who provided expert insight and contributed to the development of the alliances with the local organizations.

Economy of Santa Lucia

Santa Lucia County has a population of about 33,000 people. The sector is fit for rice cultivating because it is not in the lowlands and therefore it is not at risk of flooding. There is also great access to water because of the Daule River, which is accessible to many of the farmers in the area. About 70% of the farmers have basic infrastructure for watering their crops.

Rice production is the main economic activity of the area as about 80% of the people are rice farmers. Almost everyone is either directly or indirectly involved with the rice production, as they produce, commercialize or participate in activities that add value to the product. Within the county, there is a small town also named Santa Lucia. The town is filled with many small businesses and it serves as the social and commercial hub of the area.

Rice Farming in Santa Lucia

Most of the people in the Santa Lucia area are small farmers. They produce about 100 sacks of rice per hectare of land. In order to farm they first must prepare the lands by removing weeds and plowing. The farmers then fill an area with water to form what is known as a paddy field, because rice is a very water intensive crop. The rice seeds are either dispersed freely (the process is known as boleo in Spanish) or hand sowed. Once the rice has grown, most farmers rent machinery that helps them gather their production. A risk factor does exist in rice farming because of drought, but in Santa Lucia this is somewhat mitigated by the access to water form the nearby river.

Access to Credit

The biggest struggle in the area has been the lack of credit. Because people do not count on formal financial services, they have turned to loan sharks for financing. They have been affected by expensive lines of credit that exceed 100% interest a year and can be as expensive as 240%. Intermediaries also exploit the farmers because of their outstanding debt. Farmers also lack skills and knowledge to commercialize their products and pay fair prices for their crops.

Loan Use

The loans in this sector will be used to to buy soil, seeds, fertilizer and insecticides. They will also be used to prepare the land prior to farming, to plant the seeds and purchase other materials. The loan repayment schedule is also different from the typical microentrepreneur. Because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures, Mifex asks them only to pay 50% of the capital in the first 6 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the seventh and final month.

loans.use: Invest in rice production

payments.comment: This adjustment was made to compensate for an error with the previous payment posted.

loans.name: Efren

texts.en:
Efren is a rice farmer from Santa Lucia, Ecuador. On his small farm Efren has some chickens and he also cultivates corn. He hopes he will receive a loan because he wants to increase the rice production on his lands. He will accomplish this by planting more seeds and adding fertilizer to the soil. Efren has 4 children; two help on the farm while the younger ones are still in school. Efren has his rice processed and commercialized at his association’s facilities, where he also works part time.

The Santa Lucia Communal Bank

He is part of one of the newest Communal Banks in the recently developed Mifex Rural Finance Program. All of the members of the Centro Agricola de Santa Lucia Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers in Santa Lucia. payments.comment: This adjustment was made to compensate for an error with the previous payment posted.

loans.name: Soa

texts.en: Soa N. is 54 years old and lives with his wife and five children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  N. is a security guard and makes about $6.00 per day.  His wife raises animals and can make about $2.00 per day.  Three of their five children are students, while the other two are too young to attend school.  N. hopes to use this loan to purchase a motorbike so he no longer needs to take a taxi to and from work.  Additionally, he would like to use the loan to repair the family's house to protect it from leaking during the rainy season.  In the future, the couple hopes they will be able to afford to build a concrete house.  Eventually, they hope to be able to send their children to a university.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for transportation and to repair house to protect from rain.

loans.name: Grey

texts.en:
Grey lives with her parents on their farm. Her parents are too elderly to run and manage the operations of the lands so they have given the responsibilities to their daughter. With the guidance of her parents, Grey is planting rice on the lands and she is gaining much experience. She wants the loan because she needs to invest in seeds and fertilizer. She also wants to avoid borrowing from informal lenders because her parents have told her about the risks of their interest rates. She hopes she can save the profits from the land in order to start a family of her own some day.

The Santa Lucia Communal Bank

She is part of one of the newest Communal Banks in the recently developed Mifex Rural Finance Program. All of the members of the Centro Agricola de Santa Lucia Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers in Santa Lucia. loans.use: To farm rice on her lands

payments.comment: This adjustment was made to compensate for an error with the previous payment posted.

loans.name: Kak

texts.en: Kak P. is 32 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  P. operates a grocery store in her village and generates about $25 per day in revenue.  Her husband, is a driver at a microfinance institution and makes about $7.00 per day.  The couple has two children, one of whom is a student and the other is too young to attend school.  They hope to use this loan to buy more grocery items so P. can expand her business.  Additionally, they hope that they can use this loan to repair their house in order to protect it from leaking during the rainy season.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items in order to expand grocery business and to repair house to protect from leaking

payments.comment: Congratulation!!!!! Mrs. Kak Phov has successfully repaid her loan very early. She was so impressive with the loan that impact on her family and her business. In the near future, Kak Phov would like to take out another loan to keep expanding her business to fulfill her customer demand.

loans.name: Leng

texts.en: Leng S. is 33 years old and lives with her two children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  Unfortunately, her husband passed away and she now has to support the family herself.  She runs a baby-sitting organization where she watches the children of friends and neighbors in the village.  This business generates about $12.00 per day for S..  She hopes to use this loan in order to buy pigs to raise.  Additionally, S. wants to use the loan to purchase rice in to make rice wine--a Cambodian specialty.  After using rice to make this wine, the rice is then fed to pigs, which become fatter much more quickly.  In the future, S. would like to expand her rice making/pig raising business by buying even more pigs to feed.  Eventually, she hopes she will be able to send her children to a university.

loans.use: Buy rice for her rice making and pig raising business.

payments.comment: Congratulations to Leng Sivorn for repaying the Kiva loan early!

loans.name: Roth

texts.en: Roth P. is 49 years old and lives with her husband and four children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  P. runs a small grocery store in her village, which usually generates about $25 per day in revenue.  Her husband is a tailor and can make about $8 per day.  The couple has four children, who are still in school.  They hope to use this loan to purchase more grocery products in order to expand P.'s business.  In the future, the couple would like to build a house which they could use for a rental income.  Eventually, they hope that they will be able to send their children to a university.

loans.use: To buy more groceries in order to expand her business.

loans.name: Dang

texts.en: Dang is 28 years old and married. Her son is attending first grade. Her family's business is making bamboo baskets and their income is $8 per person per month. They want to receive a loan of $75 to purchase bamboo and they will repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: Dang would like to purchase bamboo in order to make baskets.

loans.name: Lach

texts.en: Lach M. is 26 years old and lives with his wife in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  Lach sells shoes at the local market and is able to generate an average of about $40 per day in revenue.  His wife works with him at the local market, but she sells clothes.  With this loan, the couple hopes to expand their respective businesses by purchasing more shoes and clothes to sell.  Additionally, Lach wants to buy a car so that they can transport their shoes and clothes to and from the market.  In the future, Lach hopes to expand his business beyond Phnom Penh and into other provinces in Cambodia.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes to expand business and to purchase a car in order to transport shoes to and from market.

payments.comment: Lach Mengthear paid back the Kiva loan early! Congratulations!

loans.name: Chum

texts.en: Chum K. is 30 years old and lives with his wife, father, and two children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  K. drives a motorcycle taxi and can make an average of about $10.00 per day.  His wife (pictured here) stays at home and watches their two young children.  K. hopes to use this loan to purchase a tuk-tuk (a passenger carriage attached to a motorcycle) to use as a taxi.  In the future, the couple would like to build a concrete house that is more sturdy than their current house.  Eventually, they hope that they will be able to send their children to university.

loans.use: To purchase a tuk-tuk (passenger carriage attached to motorcycle) for transportation

loans.name: Kamoljon

texts.en:
Kamoljon has been cooking shish-kabab for over 11 years. He learned this skill from his father. When he was a little boy, he used to come after school to help his father. Currently he works independently at a separate business site and has constant, regular clients. He cooks shish-kabab from several types of meat: beef, lamb and chicken.

His family keeps livestock at home, which is a cheaper alternative to purchasing meat from others'. Since he feeds his livestock good quality fodder, his shish-kabab is very palatable. Currently the place where he works is rented, and he would like to buy dishes and expand the area where his clients sit. In the future he would like to add other types of national meals to his menu.

loans.use: Expansion of restaurant eating area

loans.name: Muhiddin

texts.en:
Muhiddin has 9 years of experience in the trade of food products and cooking oil. When he was a student, trade at the market was a part-time job for him and the income paid for his education. He started as a retail trader by buying goods from wholesale traders and, as he expanded his business, he started importing goods from Uzbekistan.

Currently the assortment and range of his goods has expanded, and he is also selling various canned foods and sugars, as well as mayonnaise and other supplies. He currently rents a small place at the Central Market. He stores his goods at the houses of people who live not far away from the market, and pays them in return. Muhidding would like $1100 to expand his work place.

loans.use: Expansion of workplace

loans.name: Khursheda

texts.en: She started trading at her market with small table with limited number of goods on it and has continued trading for seven years Although she has a university degree, she could not find a good job and had to work at the market. She is married and has three little children. Her mother-in-law takes care of them while she is at work. The family income depends on her salary because her husband's salary it not high enough. With the new season Khursheda would like a loan in order to buy a new assortment of goods, buy thinner fabric for national dresses, and bed clothes that will be brought by her friend from China.

loans.use: Buy seasonal goods

loans.name: Dilrabo

texts.en: Dilrabo sells children clothes at the trading center Nuri Khujand, located in the center of Khujand. She brings her goods from wholesale market in Istaravshan as well as from wholesale traders who bring their goods from China. Her parents help her in the business by trading the clothes in her place while she is away acquiring new goods. Mostly her clothing items are for infants and kids up to 6-7 years old. She would like a loan to buy clothes for the upcoming warm season. In the future she would like to expand her business by adding children’s shoes.

loans.use: Purchase of seasonal clothing items

loans.name: Mukaram

texts.en: Mukaram, a woman with one child and a university degree, has been in business for over 13 years. Her husband is her business partner. He is responsible for trips to the wholesale market, and sometimes she accompanies him to make sure he chooses the suitable items.  She sells mainly sports clothes, which are in high demand by young people. Mukaram rents a place at the “Nuri Khujand,” which is not far away from her town's central market. She would like to rent one more place where she could sell clothes for teenage boys. She already has the money for rent and a portion of the money for goods. She will use the $1,200 to travel to the wholesale market.

loans.use: Trip to wholesale market

loans.name: Munavar

texts.en: Munavar has been in business for over six years. She buys her goods from the central market in Khujand. She started her business with $100 that her husband, a labor migrant in Russia, sent her.  She and her husband have two small children and live with Munavar’s parents-in-law. She works every day of the week in an open-air market and would like to rent a place in the shop. She will spend her next loan on goods, as she will have more space at the shop.

loans.use: Purchase of goods

loans.name: Mok

texts.en: Mok P. is 32 years old and lives with her mother and sister in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  She works as a tailor and can make about $7.00 per day in revenue.  As she is a single woman, she struggles to support the family.  P. would like to use this loan to purchase sewing machines and also to buy clothes in order to expand her business and increase her income.  In the future, P. would like to open a grocery store in her village because she feels that grocery is a more lucrative business than tailoring.

loans.use: To purchase sewing machines and more clothes for her business

payments.comment: Mok Phally has successfully repaid her loan early! Thanks to you, she was able to expand her business and improve the life of her family. Thank you for your support!

loans.name: Cuc

texts.en: Cuc is 52 years old, and her husband is 53. They live alone because all of their children left home for the first time. Their business is to charge batteries. Their income is $14 per person per month. They want to get a loan of $75 to expand their business. They will repay the loan on a monthly basis.

loans.use: To expand the shop where they charge batteries.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is married and has three children. She and her family live in Vasilyevka, Ukraine. Valentina runs a small business selling knitted wear, socks and shoes in the local market. Her kiosk is located on the main market aisle where there are many customers every day. Valentina has been in business for 10 years. Her family actively helps her with operations. Currently, her monthly gross income is about $2,000. Valentina is a high achiever and a consistent entrepreneur who is very knowledgeable about the market environment. Her professional skills and perseverant work have helped to ensure the success of her business. Valentina is requesting a loan for $1,200 to increase the assortment of inventory in her kiosk. She is hoping that this loan will help her venture grow and generate extra profits. Valentina is planning to use these funds to assist her family financially and help her children get settled in life. We believe that Valentina’s ability to identify tasks critical to business success and set up a system for accomplishing them will allow her to continue growing in the sphere of private entrepreneurship.

Валентина – одружена, в неї троє дітей. Вона з родиною живе в селі Василівка, Запорізької області. Валентина займається малим бізнесом, продає трикотажні вироби, шкарпетки та взуття на місцевому ринку. Її кіоск розташований в одному з центральних рядів ринку, де кожного дня буває багато покупців. Валентина займається цим бізнесом вже 10 років. Її родина активно допомагає їй в роботі. Зараз, щомісячний дохід Валентини становить приблизно 2000 доларів. Валентина володіє унікальною здатністю досягати своє мети, вона поступовий підприємець, чудово знається на ринкових відносинах. Її професійні якості та наполеглива праця сприяли успішному розвитку її бізнесу. Валентина просить про позику в 1200 доларів для того, щоб збільшити асортимент товарів у власному кіоску. Вона сподівається, що позика сприятиме росту її бізнесу, допоможе їй отримати додатковий прибуток. Валентина планує використати отримані кошти для того, щоб фінансово допомогти рідним та дати дітям можливість облаштуватися в житті. Ми вважаємо, що здатність Валентини вирішувати питання, необхідні для досягнення успіху в бізнесі, допоможе їй й надалі зростати в сфері приватного підприємства.

loans.use: To increase on stock

loans.name: Svitlana

texts.en:
Svitlana is married with a 13-year-old daughter. She runs a business selling a variety of household items such as laundry soaps, hair spray, tooth paste, and shampoo. Presently, she has about $10,000 in inventory.

Svitlana is an energetic and focused business owner with an enterprising spirit. She has been in this business for more than ten years. Svitlana loves challenges and has overcome many difficult situations with her business. Her perseverance and diligence have been keys to her success.

Today, Svitlana is requesting a loan for $1,200 to re-supply her product inventory. She is in the process of constructing a new store and believes that the household items will continue to sell well and provide necessary funding to complete the store construction. Additional retail space in the new facility will allow her to increase sales even further and bring in more income. She is confident that the availability of lending services will facilitate the construction process and help her open the new store sooner. Svitlana’s goal is to continue refining her business skills so that she can keep her venture growing and provide for the needs of her family.

Світлана – одружена, в неї є 13-річна дочка. Вона займається бізнесом з продажу різноманітної побутової хімії, а саме, пральних порошків, спре їв для волосся, зубних паст та шампунів. Зараз в неї приблизно 10 000 доларів в товарі. Світлана – енергійний та цілеспрямований підприємець, дуже заповзятлива та жвава людина. Вона займається цим бізнесом вже більше 10 років. Світлана любить долати перешкоди, вона часто потрапляла в складні ситуації, пов’язані з її бізнесом. Наполегливість та відданість стали запорукою її успіху. Зараз Світлана просить про позику в 1200 доларів для того, щоб поповнити асортимент товарів у своєму кіоску. Вона зараз займається будівництвом нової крамниці. Світлана сподівається, що побутова хімія й надалі гарно продаватиметься, а, отже, прибутки від продажу нададуть їй можливість закінчити усі роботи. Нове приміщення допоможе Світлані збільшити обсяги продажів та отримати додатковий прибуток. Вона переконана, що доступність кредитних послуг прискорить процес будівництва та допоможе їй відкрити нову крамницю раніше. Світлана прагне й надалі покращувати свої ділові якості, для того, щоб розвивати власний бізнес та забезпечувати потреби родини.

loans.use: To increase assortment of laundry soaps

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana is divorced and raises her 5-year-old daughter by herself. She has to work very hard to provide for all the needs of her family. Oksana runs a little store selling baked goods, candy, and sweets at the local market in Dniprorudnyi, Ukraine. Her store is well known in the town because it provides the best assortment of food items that can please any sweet-tooth.

Oksana is a focused hard worker. She has been in this business for more than 5 years. Her motivation in life and in business is to be successful. Oksana has benefited greatly from the financial assistance she has received through Nadiya Ukraine, and she tells many people about the available lending services.

Oksana is hoping to get a loan for $1,200 to buy some new equipment for her store. She believes that upgrading her facilities will help guarantee sustainability for her business and provide a stable income for her family. We believe that flexibility, loyalty, and the ability to handle challenges are some of the characteristics demonstrated by this young entrepreneur that will help her repay this loan and will secure the future success of her business.

Оксана – розлучена. Вона самостійно виховує 5-річну донечку. Оксана змушена наполегливо працювати для того, щоб забезпечити потреби власної родини. Вона – власниця невеличкої крамнички з продажу випічки, цукерок та солодощів на місцевому ринку в м. Дніпрорудний. Її крамничка відома у місті, тому що саме в неї можна знайти найкращий асортимент товарів харчування, які будуть до смаку будь-якому солодкоїжці. Оксана – наполеглива та працьовита. Вона займається цим бізнесом вже більше 5 років. Вона прагне досягти успіху в роботі та житті. Фінансова підтримка, яку Оксана отримала від „Надії України”, дуже позитивно відбилася на розвитку її бізнесу. Оксана багатьом людям зараз розповідає про доступні кредитні послуги. Оксана сподівається отримати позику в 1200 доларів для того, щоб придбати нове обладнання для своєї крамниці. Вона вважає, що модернізація приміщення гарантуватиме стабільність та прибуток для її бізнесу. Ми віримо, що гнучкість, вірність та здатність долати перешкоди – це самі ті якості Оксани, які допоможуть їй сплатити цю позику та забезпечать подальший успіх її бізнесу.

loans.use: To buy equipment for her store

loans.name: Blanca

texts.en:
Blanca has a very well situated store, located on a main street. She started her business with the help of a $200 loan from the loan sharks. At first she only sold rice, sugar and oil. Now she continues to offer those products, along with legumes and ice cream.

Blanca will use the loan to buy additional merchandise with which to expand her store. She has every confidence that the business will grow and she will be able to continue making investments.

Blanca is the mother of 5 children and a widow. She is 35 years old. She depends entirely on her business for the income she needs to support her family. She hopes that this loan will give her financial security and permit her to save for her children's education.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Blanca tiene una tienda muy bien ubicada en una calle principal. Blanca empezó el negocio con la ayuda de un crédito que solicito a los chulqueros de 200 dólares. Al principio solo vendía arroz, azúcar y aceite. Ahora ella continúa ofreciendo estos productos junto con legumbres y helados.

Blanca usara el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería para incrementar su tienda. Ella tiene toda la seguridad que negocio crecerá y podrá seguir haciendo inversiones.

Blanca es madre de cinco hijos, viuda, tiene 35 años. Ella depende de su negocio completamente para apoyar a su familia. Ella tiene la esperanza que este préstamo le dará seguridad financiera y pueda permitirle ahorrar para la educación de sus hijos.

loans.use: Invest in merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy merchandise at whole-sale prices

loans.name: Santa

texts.en:
Santa sells clothing and lingerie in the area where she lives and also to friends. Santa originally began her business with a small amount of capital she borrowed from high interest lenders. She will use the loan to buy merchandise at whole-sale prices. She is certain that with this new merchandise her business will see growth. Santa is the mother of three children and is single. She is 47 years old. Santa is convinced that with this loan she will improve the economic standing of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Santa se dedica a la venta de ropa y lencería en provincias y amistades en su sector. Santa empezó su negocio con un pequeño capital que solicito a los churqueros. Ahora ella vende ropa y lencería en provincias y en su sector. Ella usara el préstamo en comprar mercadería a precios de mayoristas. Ella tiene la plena seguridad que con esta nueva mercadería su negocio va ha tener crecimiento. Santa es madre de tres hijos, soltera. Ella tiene 47 años. Santa esta convencida que con este préstamo mejorara el nivel económico de su familia.

loans.use: To buy clothing at whole-sale prices

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Neli sells perfumes, cosmetics, and lingerie. She began her business with the help of her brother, who gave her the merchandise she needed to get started. At first she sold only children’s clothing. Now she sells children’s clothing and also perfumes and lingerie. Neli wants to sell all kinds of clothing along with things for the home, like irons and pressure cookers, which are the types of things her customers ask her for. She will use the loan to invest in buying merchandise at whole-sale prices. She is certain that with these new products, her business will grow. Neli is the mother of two children. She is 37 years old and it has been very difficult for her to help her family get ahead. Her business is the only source of income for her household. Neli has the hope that this loan will give her financial security and allow her to save up for her children’s education and to continue building her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Neli es comerciante de perfumes, cosméticos y lencería. Neli empezó su negocio con la ayuda de su hermano quien le dio mercadería para que empezara su negocio. Al principio solo vendía ropa de niños . Ahora el continúa ofreciendo ropa de niños junto con perfumes y lencería. Neli aspira vender todo tipo de ropa junto con articulos para el hogar como planchas y ollas de presión es lo que solicitan sus clientes. Ella usara el préstamo para invertir comprando mercadería al por mayor. Ella tiene la seguridad de que con estos nuevos productos su negocio crecerá. Neli es madre de dos hijos. Ella tiene 37 años le ha sido muy duro salir adelante con su familia. Su negocio es la única fuente de ingreso en el hogar. Heli tiene la esperanza que este préstamo le dará seguridad financiera y pueda permitirle ahorrar para la educación de sus hijos y poder seguir construyendo su casa.

loans.use: To buy clothing and household articles at whole-sale prices

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia has a beauty salon that she started with the help of her husband who gave her the start up capital. She was able to grow in the past 6 months thanks to a loan from the Kiva community. She did quite well with the loan she received. She was able to invest in her beauty salon as she planned. She bought some furniture for her shop and she made some improvements to the physical appearance of the shop. Her business is much more stable now and she is receiving many more clients. Now she is hoping that she can invest in more display cases and secondary products to sell from her store.

loans.use: Invest in furniture for the shop and complimentary products to sell

loans.name: Fanny

texts.en:
Fanny has had her business for a year. She says "The store is at my house, but I do not have much merchandise to offer. I would like to buy more products to increase the sales, because this is my family's only income. Therefore, I'd like to get a loan for $1,000 so I can invest in this business."

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

La sra. Fanny tiene su negocio desde hace 1 año “Mi negocio lo tengo en mi casa pero tengo muy poca mercancía, me gustaría poder comprar más para aumentar mis ventas ya que es el sustento de mi familia” Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para invertir en el negocio”.

loans.use: Invertir en el negocio

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.en:
Guillermo sells sportsware for men, women, and children.  Guillermo started his business selling clothing door-to-door.  Initially he only sold children's clothes, which he continues to sell together with men's and women's clothing.  He will use this loan to purchase backpacks and plastic products for resale. He is confident that the addition of these products will help his business grow and he will be able to make additional investments.  Guillermo has one son, is separated, 57 years old and originally from Oriundo de Ambata. He is sure that this loan will help to improve his family's quality of life and will help to grow his business.



 
 Guillermo  se dedica a la venta de ropa sport para damas caballeros y niños.
Guillermo   empezó  su negocio  vendiendo ropa puerta a puerta.  Al principio el solo vendía ropa para niños. Ahora ofrece este producto junto con ropa de caballeros   y damas.
El usara el préstamo para la  para comprar mochilas y artículos plásticos.
El tiene fe que con la introducción de estos productos nuevos  su negocio se incrementara   y  seguirá haciendo inversiones.
Guillermo  es  padre de  un hijos, separado  tiene 57 años Oriundo de Ambato.
El tiene la seguridad  que el préstamo le ayudara   a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y su negocio crecerá.

loans.use: Buy book bags and plastic products

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David has a restaurant inside the market. He began his business with the help of his wife, who encouraged him to buy a location in the market. In the beginning, they only sold breakfasts. Now they offer both breakfasts and lunches. He will use the loan to buy industrial-style kitchen equipment and to make improvements to the restaurant. David has faith that his business will grow with the improved service and comfort he will be able to give to his customers. David is 46 years old and married, with four children who are all studying. Life hasn’t been easy for David, working together with his wife to provide food, education, and clothing for his family. David hopes that this loan will help him save up to build his house and to educate to his children.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

David tiene un restaurante dentro del mercado. El empezó su negocio con la ayuda de su esposa quien la motivo para comprara un modulo en el mercado. Al principio solo vendían desayunos. Ahora continúan ofreciendo este producto junto con almuerzos. El usara el préstamo para invertir en comprar una cocina industrial y adecuaciones del local. David tiene fe que su negocio crecerá con el mejor servicio y comodidad que dará a sus clientes. David tiene 46 años casado, tiene cuatro hijos todos estudian. Para David la vida no ha sido fácil teniendo que trabajar junto con su esposa para dar alimentación, estudios y vestimenta. El depende totalmente de su negocio para salir adelante con su familia. David tiene la esperanza de que este préstamo le ayudara ahorrar para construir su vivienda y darle educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: To buy new kitchen equipment

loans.name: Laurette

texts.en: A. Laurette is a brave 46-year-old woman who has three children (two daughters and a son) and lives in Yopougon, a big township in the north of Abidjan. A. works with her first daughter, who did not have chance to go to school and thus stayed with her mother to manage their cassava cakes business. With the revenue generated from this busines, A. has helped her husband, a carpenter, send the other children to school. A. has been working with AE&I since June 2005 and has already experienced the benefits of several small loans that she reimbursed without problem.  A. has applied for a loan of USD 550.

loans.use: Abia Laurette will use the loan to develop her cassava cakes business.

loans.name: Fabiola

texts.en:
Fabiola has a lube shop where she offers automotice services such as an oil change and filter replacement. Fabiola began her business with the help of her ex husband. Initially she only provided the oil change service. Now she offers this service and sells automobile accessories and maps. Fabiola will use the loan to purchase lubricant and oil at wholesale volume prices. She is sure that these new products will help grow her business. Fabiola is 26, is separated and has a five year old child in school. She is dependent on her business to succeed and to help her child who is the source of her inspiration.

Translated by Kiva Volunteer Julie Lerch

Fabiola tiene una lubricadora donde presta servicios de cambio de aceites y filtros a vehiculos. Fabiola empezó su negocio con la ayuda de su ex esposo. Al principio solo prestaba servicio de cambio de aceite. Ahora ella ofrece servicio junto con venta de accesorios guias de vehiculos. Fabiola usara el préstamo para invertir en comprar lubricante al por mayor y aceite en tanque. Ella tiene la seguridad que con estos nuevos productos va ha tener un crecimiento. Fabiola tiene 26 años, es separada tiene un hijos de cinco años que estudia. Ella depende del negocio para salir adelante con su hijo que es su fuente de inspiración.

loans.use: To purchase oil and lubricant at wholesale prices

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria operates a Bazaar and stationery store out of her home where she sells various items and school supplies. Gloria started her business with a loan for 200 dollars, which she used to buy a display case. Initially she only sold notebooks. Now she also sells gifts and other stationery. Gloria will use this loan to invest in additional merchandise at volume wholesale prices to increase her profits. She is sure that this loan will help her business grow. Gloria is 58 years old and lives with two nephews who are still in school. She depends on this business to support her family. She is confident that this loan will provide the financial security her family needs and to be able to improve the quality of their home.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Julie Lerch

Gloria tiene un Bazar y Papelería en su domicilio donde vende artículos varios y útiles escolares. Gloria empezó su negocio prestando un dinero a los chulqueros de 200 dólares para la compra de una Vitrina. Al principio solo vendía cuadernos. Ahora ella ofrece este producto junto con regalos y papelería . Gloria usara el préstamo para invertir en comprar mercadería a precio de mayorista y asi obtener mayores ganancias. Ella tiene la seguridad que su negocio va ha tener un crecimiento. Gloria tiene 58 años, vive con 2 sobrinos ellos estudian. Ella depende del negocio para apoyar a su familia. Gloria tiene la confianza que este préstamo le dará seguridad económica a su familia y permitirle adecuar su vivienda. .

loans.use: Invest in merchandise

loans.name: Salimata

texts.en: Salimata O. is a dynamic 38-year-old woman living with her husband and her three children in Treichville, a popular commercial township in Abidjan. Salimata started the production and sale of stewpan in March 2004 with a USD 450 loan from AE&I. She has developed the business over the last three years and now wants to increase production in order to sell stewpan in the neighbouring countries of Burkina, Faso, and Mali, where she has relatives. Salimata O. is an example of a brave and courageous person who has shown excellence in self-taught management skills. She has applied for a loan of USD 750.

loans.use: Ouattara Salimata will use the loan to increase her production of stewpan.

loans.name: Béatrice

texts.en: Béatrice D. is a dynamic 31 year-old woman who has one daughter and lives in Yopougon, a township north of Abidjan. Béatrice sells aromatic and exotic products in the Yopougon open market and has been doing so since she was 16 years old. The rainy season is favorable to her business, as her exotic aromas are reputed to prevent against malaria. She has repaid all microcrédits she received from AE&I in timely manner. With this loan, she hopes to purchase her products in bulk to benefit from wholesale prices.

loans.use: Béatrice Droh will use the loan to make bulk purchases of aromatic and exotic products.

loans.name: Letty

texts.en:
Letty has a school in the north of the city. Letty founded the school with a loan from her famiily for the construction and with help from her husband and local residents because there was no school in that neighborhood. She will use this loan to purchase school supplies to help the parents of her students finance their education. She is sure that with this assistance her students will be motivated and supported since students generally have a hard time financially. Letty is 26 years old, married and has two children. She is dependent on this business to support her family. Letty is sure that this loan will give her family financial security and will help her improve the quality of their home.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Julie Lerch

Letty tiene una escuela en un barrio marginal del norte. Letty empezó su negocio prestando un dinero a familiares para así empezar la construcción de la escuela y trabajando con su esposo y moradores del sector ya que no había una escuela cercana. Ella usara el préstamo para la compra de útiles escolares y material didáctico para darle facilidad a los padres y puedan adquirirlos con plan acumulativo. Ella tiene la seguridad que con esta facilidad de compra sus alumnos estarán motivados y apoyados ya que la situación económica de sus alumnos es difícil. Letty tiene 26. años, esta unida tiene dos hijos. Ella depende del negocio para apoyar a su familia. Letty tiene la confianza que este préstamo le dará seguridad económica a su familia y permitirle adecuar su vivienda.

loans.use: To purchase school supplies

loans.name: Efrain

texts.en:
Efraín has been running his business for a year and a half. "My business is a money-exchange shop near the border. People need to convert their money into U.S. dollars to go shopping in Texas, and that is how I provide a service to my community. I would like to invest more money into my business to increase my earnings, but I have not been able to. I'm asking for $1,200 to invest in my business."

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

El Sr. Efraín tiene su negocio desde hace 1 año y medio “Mi negocio es una casa de cambio y está en una zona fronteriza, la gente requiere de cambiar su dierno en moneda americana y poder hacer sus compras en en estado de Texas asi es que presto un servicio a la comunidad me gustaría poder invertir para aumentar mi capital pero no he podido” Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para invertir en el negocio.

loans.use: Invest in his money-exchange shop.

loans.name: José Guadalupe

texts.en:
Mr. Hernández has dedicated himself to the sale of jewelry for the past five years. He imports his products from the Mexican states of Guanajuato and Jalisco. "I make trips every month to stock up on supplies. I currently have some orders, but I have not been able to make the trip due to lack of funds. I need $1,200 to fulfill these responsibilities. I hope you can help me."

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

El Sr. Hernández lleva 5 años dedicándose a la venta de joyería y artículos de piel, sus productos los trae del estado de Guanajuato y Jalisco. "Realizo viajes cada mes para abastecerme de mercancía ya tengo varios pedidos pero no he podido salir a comprarlos pues necesito $1,200.00 dlls para lograrlo ojala me puedan ayudar.

loans.use: To stock up on supplies and fulfill orders at his jewelry store.

loans.name: Taiba

texts.en: K. Taiba is a 34 year old woman with two young children. Dynamic and ambitious, she has been in the fish business since she was 18. K. is the main financial resource provider for her family, as her husband recently lost his job. She wants to expand her grilled fish selling activities in order to be able to make school fee payments in October 2007 for her two children.  K. received her first loan from AE&I on December 2005 and has always reimbursed in a timely manner.

loans.use: Kablan Taiba will use loan to expand her sales of grilled fish.

loans.name: Justice Kwame

texts.en:
Kwame A. is a half-owner of J & K Engineering, a truck and automobile repair shop in Pokuase, just north of the city of Accra on the Achimota Highway. He has a wife and three children and lives in the neighboring town of Ofankor. As a child, Kwame walked two miles to school each day. He completed middle school, went on to a five-year engineering apprenticeship, and then worked three years at Big Joe Engineering in Ofankor before he struck out on his own.

In twelve years, J & K Engineering has grown to a thriving business with 11 apprentices and a contract to repair all of the DAF trucks and buses used by Ghana's Education Department. Kwame is on call to travel all over Ghana at a moment's notice, whenever there is a breakdown, and he is known for his ability to restore battered vehicles to better than new! Having to travel into Accra for spare parts is very time-consuming, and Kwame plans to use the $1,000 to purchase and maintain a parts inventory, reducing his time away from repairing vehicles and training his apprentices.

loans.use: The purchase of an inventory of spare parts

loans.name: María Ana

texts.en:
Mrs. G. spends her time selling sheets and quilts, which she gets from various inner-Mexico cities. "My business helps my husband with household expenses and my daughter with school. I have many orders, but I need a loan of $1,000 to be able to fulfill them."

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. G. ocupa su tiempo con la venta de sabanas y edredones, estos los consigue en varias ciudades del interior de la republica. "Con mi negocio le ayudo a mi esposo con los gastos de la casa y a mi hija con su escuela, tengo muchos pedidos pero necesito un préstamo de $1,000.00 dlls".

loans.use: Buy supplies to fulfill orders for the sheets and quilts she sells

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort O. joined the Women's Trust loan program in March 2006. In a year's time, she has repaid loans of $55, $88, and $100, and established herself as an excellent client. She has three children and lives in housing that was once barracks for workers on an agricultural station three miles from the center of Pokuase. Each day, Comfort makes 4 to 5 gallons of wheat porridge and sells it from a pan she carries on her head as she walks the three miles to Pokuase center and back.

In this past year, Comfort has assessed that her neighborhood is lacking in prepared food businesses and has begun to develop a clientèle for a small restaurant (chop bar). She has laid a stone foundation. With her porridge profits, she has begun raising chickens and goats for the stews she plans to serve when her restaurant is completed. With the help of two employees, Comfort is currently serving fufu and stew alfresco on-site to enthusiastic diners, and she continues to sell porridge in town each morning. Comfort's gradual growth business plan is sound. With $500, she will be able to complete construction and purchase provisions for the Fast Corner Chop Bar.

loans.use: Construction costs and operating capital for the Fast Corner Chop Bar

loans.name: Bertha Alicia

texts.en:
Bertha has run her grocery store for a year and a half. "I run my business from inside my home. I have worked hard to get it. I'm a widow and my children help me run it since it's our only means of income. I would like to buy more merchandise to increase sales. I'm asking for $1,000 to invest into my business."

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. Bertha tiene 1 año y medio con su negocio “Mi negocio lo tengo dentro de mi casa, he trabajado mucho para tenerlo soy viuda y mis hijos me ayudan para atenderlo ya que son los únicos ingresos que tenemos me gustaría poder comprar más mercancía y tener más ventas”. Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para la inversión.

loans.use: Invest in her grocery store; buy more supplies to increase sales.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.en:
Manuel de Jesus has been running his grocery store for six months. "I have not been able to buy enough supplies for my business. I have two adolescent-aged kids and they help me in their free time. I would like to invest in more supplies. Right now, my store is missing many things and my customers will go somewhere else to buy there things because of this. I'm asking for $1,000 to buy supplies for my store."

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

El Sr. Manuel de Jesus tiene 6 meses con su negocio “No he podido comprar más mercancía para mi negocio, tengo hijos adolescentes y en sus ratos libres me ayudan para atenderlo me gustaría invertir en la compra de más mercancía ya que me faltan muchas cosas y mis clientes se va a comprar a otra parte debido a eso”. Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para comprar mercancía para mi negocio.

loans.use: Invest in supplies for the grocery store.

loans.name: Servando

texts.en:
Mr. M. has dedicated himself to selling sheets, bedspreads and quilts by catalogue. He also holds a steady job, but his salary is not sufficient, and his wife underwent a costly medical procedure. "I need your help to continue supplying my business. I have been blessed with good sales, but I need a loan of $800 to keep it up."

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

El Sr. M. se dedica a la venta de sabanas, colchas y edredones por catalogo además tiene su empleo pero su ingreso no es suficiente, por si fuera poco su esposa lleva un tratamiento medico costoso. "Necesito de su ayuda para seguir surtiendo la mercancía gracias a dios he logrado realizar buenas ventas, este seria por la cantidad de $800.00 dlls

loans.use: Buy sheets, bedspreads and quilts to sell.

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.en:
Mr. V. started his accessory and novelty shop about a year and a half ago and has had good business since then. But he has not been able to increase his sales because he hasn't been able to purchase items in larger quantities. "I would like to grow my business and to do that I need your help. With a $1,000 loan I can achieve it."

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

El Sr. V. inicio su negocio aproximadamente hace un año y medio y a tenido ventas buenas, solo que no ha podido escalar en las ventas pues no ha logrado invertir en cantidades mayores. "Quisiera consolidar mi negocio y para eso necesito su ayuda, con $1,000.00 dlls se logrará.

loans.use: Invest in new products at his accessory and novelty shop, like toys and dolls.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en:
Mr. M. has a vulcanizer at his repair shop, and after more than four years he has not updated his equipment. "The tool I bought more than four years ago doesn't respond to the demands of today, which is why we need to bring it up to date. My brother and I can not make do with the lack of modern equipment, and that is why we need a loan of $1,200."

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

El Sr. M. tiene una vulcanizadora y a lo largo de 4 años no ha renovado su equipo de trabajo. "La herramienta que adquirí hace mas de 4 años ya no responde a las exigencias de hoy en día por lo que necesitamos actualizarnos, mi hermano y yo no damos batalla por la escasez de equipo moderno para esto necesitamos $1,200.00 dlls".

loans.use: Buy new parts for the vulcanizer at his repair shop.

loans.name: Maria Santos

texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Santos is known by her friends to be an active and enterprising woman. The wish to see her daughter become a college graduate has motivated Maria to work very hard day after day. Maria began her business selling home made food in order to help her husband with the home expenses and to support their daughter’s education. Shortly after opening her business, her clients multiplied, thanks to her great cooking.

Currently, Maria needs a grill and a stove with larger burners, in order to increase her production and satisfy her growing number of clients. To acquire these, she is seeking a loan for $250 dollars. She plans to repay the loan within 3 to 6 months. Maria trusts in those who help the most needed and appreciates your support and care.

Translated from Spanish by Martha Martinez, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Santos, como la conocen sus amigos, es una mujer emprendedora y muy activa, los deseos de ver a su hija convertida en una profesionista la han motivado a trabajar arduamente día a día, Maria inició su negocio de venta de comidas para apoyar a su esposo en lo gastos del hogar y en la educación de su hija, y gracias a su excelente sazón, poco después se multiplicaron sus clientes.

En estos momentos, Maria necesita de una plancha y una estufa de quemadores más grandes, con los que planea incrementar su producción y de esta manera satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, para esto requiere de un crédito de $ 250 dólares, ella ofrece devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. Maria confía en las personas que ayudan a quien más lo necesita y agradece tu apoyo y cariño.

loans.use: Purchase of work equipment/  Compra de equipo de trabajo

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Jesus Fidel

texts.en:
Mr. M. installed a vulcanizer in his home and wishes to make the necessary adjustments to it so he can sell new and used tires. "I need a good room to make my business more orderly and so I can make a distinction between the work area and the sale area. To achieve this, I need a loan of $1,200."

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

El Sr. M. instaló una vulcanizadora en su vivienda y desea adaptarla de acuerdo a las necesidades requeridas, además vende llantas usadas y nuevas. "Necesito un buen cuarto para tener mas ordenado mi negocio y así definir el área de trabajo y la de venta para lograr esto se requieren de $1,200.00 dlls.

loans.use: To construct a room for tire sales and make adjustments to the vulcanizer.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Mrs. Virginia is married and has a son. Eleven years ago, her husband was left without work and it became difficult for him to find a job given the country’s high unemployment rate. At the same time, their home and son’s school expenses accumulated. As a result, they decided to open a grocery and fruit shop, a business they learned to manage, dedicate their full time, and see grow.

Virginia needs a loan for $250 dollars to grow her line of products in order to offer a better service, satisfy her clients, and increase sales. Virginia plans to repay the credit within 3 to 6 months. They are seeking for your help and support.

Translated from Spanish by Martha Martinez, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Virginia es casada, y tiene un hijo, hace once años su esposo se quedó sin trabajo y por la falta de empleo del país le resultaba muy difícil encontrar donde laborar, mientras las deudas del hogar y de la escuela de su hijo se acumulaban, así fue como decidieron juntos emprender su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes y frutería, negocio al que se han dedicado por completo y afortunadamente lo han visto crecer.

Ahora Virginia necesita de un crédito por la cantidad de $ 250 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder surtir su negocio y ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes para de esta manera conservar su preferencia y poder incrementar sus ventas, ella ofrece devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. Ellos necesitan ayuda, y tú puedes apoyarlos, no lo piense más.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise/  Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.en:
Mr. López started his wrought-iron business only a year and a half ago, but every day the demands are greater. "For me, it's urgent that I buy a van to be able to transport everything I make. For this, I ask for your help. I think a loan of $1,200 will be sufficient."

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

El Sr. López lleva tan solo un año y medio con su nuevo taller de forja pero las exigencia cada día son mayores. "Para mi es urgente que compre una camioneta para poder transportar todo lo que elaboro, por eso solicito su ayuda creo que con $1,200.00 dlls será suficiente.

loans.use: Buy a van to transport his wrought-iron products.

loans.name: Caudia Elizabeth

texts.en:
Mrs. Claudia is married and has two daughters. Fortunately it was possible for them to own their own house, however the monthly mortgage became an expense that significantly reduced the family’s income. Five years ago, under great need, Claudia decided to work and earn an extra income by opening her own business selling cosmetics products. With this income Claudia supports her family and she can pay for her daughters school supplies.

The demand for Claudia’s products has increased, and to be able to cover all client orders she needs a loan for $250 dollars, which she commits to repay within 3 to 6 months. You can be a key part in the growth of this business and in making a difference for this family, don’t doubt any longer and make a decision to support them.

Translated from Spanish by Martha Martinez, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Claudia es casada y tiene dos hijas, afortunadamente les fue posible adquirir su casa propia, pero las mensualidades que pagan disminuyó el ingreso familiar, ante esta necesidad Claudia decidió trabajar para obtener un ingreso extra, inició su negocio de venta de cosméticos hace cinco años, con el ingreso que recibe apoya a su familia y puede pagar los materiales que les piden a sus hijas en la escuela.

La demanda por los productos que comercializa Claudia se ha incrementado y para poder cubrir todos los pedidos, necesita de un préstamo por $250 dólares, que se compromete a devolver en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. Tú puedes formar parte importante en el crecimiento de este negocio y en la vida de esta familia, no lo dudes más y decídete a apoyarlos.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise/ Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Samuel Nahum

texts.en:
Samuel is a hard working man who is married and has three children ages 8, 12 and 15. Previously, he worked as a driver, delivering freight that allowed him to rent a trailer. However, the work was scares and the income wasn’t sufficient to support his family and his children’s school expenses. Five years ago, by acquiring the necessary tools, he decided to open his own printing business. Today, he is expanding the products he sells, by including invitations, invoices, and calendars, etc.

Little by little Samuel’s printing shop has been growing, and with the experience he has gained to date his products continue to improve in quality, which has been noticed by his growing clientele. Samuel needs a loan for $475 dollars to be used for the purchase of the supplies and materials, necessary to continue working, and also to renovate his shop, as he lacks space for his machinery. Samuel and his family sincerely appreciate your help.

Translated from Spanish by Martha Martinez, Kiva Volunteer.

Samuel es un hombre muy trabajador, es casado y tiene tres hijos de de 8, 12 y 15 años. Antes él trabajaba como chofer entregando fletes, ya que le facilitaban el préstamo de un trailer, el trabajo escaseaba y el ingreso que podía obtener de esta manera no era suficiente para el sustento de su familia y de la educación de sus hijos, así fue como decidió iniciar su propio negocio en la imprenta hace cinco años, adquirió las herramientas necesarias para esto y ahora ha estado ampliando los productos que vende, hace invitaciones, facturas, calendarios, etc.

Poco a poco la imprenta de Samuel ha estado creciendo y con la experiencia que ha adquirido en el negocio, sus productos cada vez son de mejor calidad y así lo hacen notar sus clientes que se incrementan cada vez más, ahora Samuel necesita de un préstamo por $ 475 dólares que empleara en la compra de los insumos que necesita para continuar trabajando y también para ampliar su local porque le falta espacio para la maquinaria que tiene. Samuel y su familia agradecen sinceramente tu ayuda.

loans.use: Purchase of supplies, materials and remodeling/  Compra de insumos y remodelación

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Mrs. Adelina is divorced and she has two older children who do not live with her. With the need to incur an income to cover her expenses, she followed a friend’s advice by staring her own business selling nutrition based products. Adelina used to buy these products, which gave her good results, and eventually led to her decision of recommending and selling them. Fortunately, the products have been widely accepted and the demand has grown considerably.

Currently, Adelina needs a loan for $700 dollars to be used in the purchase of products to cover her clients’ orders. She plans to repay the loan within 6 to 12 months. Today is a good time to help those in need; you can help Adelina to improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Martha Martinez, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Adelina es divorciada, tiene dos hijos mayores de edad que ya no viven con ella, ante la necesidad de obtener un ingreso para solventar sus gastos, ella decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de productos nutricionales, comenzó por invitación de una amiga. Anteriormente Adelina utilizaba estos productos y obtuvo muy buenos resultados, fue así como decidió recomendarlos y venderlos, afortunadamente los productos que comercializa han tenido gran aceptación y la demanda por ellos se ha incrementado considerablemente.

En estos momentos, Adelina necesita de un préstamo por $ 700 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder surtir los pedidos de sus clientes, ofrece devolverlos en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses. Hoy es tiempo de ayudar a quien más lo necesita, tú puedes ayudar a Adelina a mejorar su calida de vida, no lo dudes más.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise/ Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Oralia

texts.en:
Oralia is a single mother of a 17 year old son who is in high school. With the need to support her son, as she never received help from her partner, Oralia decided to start her own business selling second-hand clothing in a street market eight years ago. With this business she obtained the income she needed to support her son and at the same time care for him. Fortunately, her business has grown and today, as a result of her clients needs, she also sells new clothes.

In order to increase her sales, Oralia would also like to sell in a different market place. She is seeking a loan for $700 dollars, in order to buy merchandise to be able to set up shop in this new vending site. Oralia wants for her business to continue growing and you can contribute in making this a reality. Oralia sincerely appreciates your help and care.

Translated from Spanish by Martha Martinez, Kiva Volunteer.

Oralia es madre soltera D. un hijo D. 17 años que actualmente es estudia L. preparatoria. Ante L. necesidad D. sostener a su hijo, ya que nunca contó con L. ayuda D. su pareja, Oralia decidió iniciar su propio negocio vendiendo ropa usada en un mercado hace ocho años, con esto podía recibir los recursos que necesitaba para el sustento D. su hijo y al mismo tiempo darle L. atención que necesita, afortunadamente su negocio ha estado creciendo y ahora, a petición D. sus clientes, también venD. ropa nueva.

Para incrementar sus ventas Oralia quiere instalarse en otro mercado, pero para esto requiere D. L. compra D. mercancía y solicita un préstamo por $ 700 dólares que utilizará con este fin. ElL. quiere que su negocio continué creciendo y tú puedes contribuir a que sea una realidad, elL. agradece sinceramente tu ayuda y cariño.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise/ Surtir mercancía

loans.name: Crisoforo

texts.en:
Mr. Crisoforo was left without a job, following the closing of the company he worked for. Without success finding another job, he decided to open his own business in making photo albums (weddings and Sweet XV) and bibles. In October 2004, he began his business out of his house. As the business grew and there was the need for more space, he rented a space to allow him to provide a better service. Crisoforo has two children of 24 and 17 years of age who help him in the business.

In order to grow his production, he needs a loan for $925 dollars which he will use to purchase supplies and materials, needed to continue working and to be able to distribute his clients’ orders. He offers to repay the loan within 6 to 12 months. You can be an important part in the growth of this business and to improve the life of this family. They appreciate your help.

Translated from Spanish by Martha Martinez, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Crisoforo se quedo sin trabajo por el cierre de la empresa en la que laboraba, y como no encontraba otro trabajo, decidió emprender su propio negocio en la que hace álbum para bodas y XV años y biblias, en octubre del 2004, empezó en su domicilio y como estaba creciendo y necesitaba de más espacio, ahora renta un local para poder ofrecer un buen servicio y continuar creciendo, Crisoforo tiene dos hijos de 24 y 17 años que colaboran con él en su negocio.

Para incrementar su producción necesita de un préstamo de $ 925 dólares que utilizará en la compra de los insumos que requiere para continuar trabajando y poder surtir los pedidos de sus clientes, él ofrece devolver este préstamo en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses. Tú puedes ser parte fundamental en el crecimiento de este negocio, y mejorar la vida de esta familia, ellos te lo agradecerán.

loans.use: Working capital and to purchase supplies, materials/ Para capital de trabajo e insumos

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Laura Elena

texts.en:
Laura is a single mother of two children, ages 13 and 17 years old.
