In order to support and be able to educate her children, Laura decided to start her own business and open a magazine and perfume shop three years ago. This has allowed her to move forward with her family and provide the necessary attention to her children. Fortunately, the sales of perfume have grown and orders continue to increase from clients.

Currently, Laura needs a loan for $925 dollars that will be used to purchase merchandise that will allow Laura to cover her clients’ orders, increase her sales, and grow her business as she has done to date. With your support you can aid Laura in enhancing her business and in the well being of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Martha Martinez, Kiva Volunteer.

Laura es madre soltera de dos hijos de 13 y 17 años de edad. Ante la necesidad de tener un ingreso que le permitiera obtener los recursos que necesita para el sustento de sus hijos y para la educación de sus hijos, Laura decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de revistas y perfumes, hace tres años, esto le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia ella sola poder darles la atención que necesitan, afortunadamente la venta de los perfumes se ha incrementado y cada ves son más los pedidos de sus clientes.

En estos momentos, Laura necesita de un préstamo de $925 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía que le permita cubrir los pedidos de sus clientes, incrementar sus ventas y continuar creciendo como hasta ahora lo ha hecho. En tus manos esta el crecimiento de este negocio y el bienestar de esta familia, no lo dudes más y decídete a apoyar a Laura.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise/ Surtir mercancía

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura is a very hard working woman with the desire to move forward in life. Laura is married and has two small children of 2 and 4 years of age. Her husband works in construction and his income is not sufficient to support his family. Given her needs, Laura began her own business by selling cosmetic products and later she added the sale of shoes. Thanks to her friends and acquaintances, her clients and business continues to grow.

Laura needs a loan for $375 dollars to buy the merchandise she needs to satisfy her clients’ orders and to offer a better service. She plans to repay her loan within 5 to 10 months. With your help, you can contribute to the growth of this business and help Laura and her family improve their quality of life. They sincerely appreciate your help.

Translated from Spanish by Martha Martinez, Kiva Volunteer.

Laura es una mujer muy trabajadora y con muchos deseos de superación, ella es casada y tiene dos pequeños hijos, de 2 y 4 años de edad, su esposo es albañil y el ingreso que obtiene no es suficiente para el sustento de su familia, ante esta necesidad Laura inició con la venta de cosméticos, y después incorporó la con la venta de calzado, gracias a las amistades y conocidas que tiene, sus clientes se han incrementado y su negocio ha estado creciendo.

Ahora Laura necesita de un préstamo por $ 375 dólares para comprar la mercancía que necesita para surtir los pedidos de sus clientes y poder ofrecer un buen servicio, ofrece devolver este préstamo en un lapso de 5 a 10 meses. Con tu ayuda Laura y su familia pueden mejorar su calida de vida, contribuye al crecimiento de este negocio, ellos agradecen sinceramente tu ayuda.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise/ Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in rice farming

payments.comment: This adjustment was made to compensate for an error with the previous payment posted.

loans.name: Moisés

texts.en:
Moisés is married and has a 9 year old son. His wife, Violeta, studied hairdressing and following her graduation she decided to open her own business two years ago. They remodeled a room in their home for the business and little by little they acquired the supplies necessary to offer their services. Their clients continue to grow and so does their business. Recently, they remodeled the beauty salon, which used up all of their savings.

Moisés needs a loan for $475 dollars to be used to purchase merchandise necessary to be able to provide their services and to offer a better service to their clients. Moisés plans to repay the loan within 6 to 12 months. You can become a key figure in the growth of this business, try to support them.

Translated from Spanish by Martha Martinez, Kiva Volunteer.

Moisés es casado y tiene un hijo de 9 años de edad. Su esposa Violeta estudio belleza en una academia y cuando terminó su curso decidió iniciar su propio negocio hace dos años, juntos acondicionaron un espacio en su casa y fueron adquiriendo poco a podo el equipo necesario para ofrecer sus servicios, sus clientes se incrementan cada vez más y su negocio continua creciendo, últimamente remodelaron la estética y en esto gastaron el capital que habían ahorrado.

En estos momentos Moisés necesita de un préstamo por $ 475 dólares que utilizará en la compra de productos que necesita para continuar ofreciendo sus servicios, y dar un buen servicio a sus clientes, el ofrece devolver este préstamo en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses. Tú puedes ser parte fundamental en el crecimiento de este negocio, no lo dudes más y decídete a apoyarlos.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise/ Compra de insumos

loans.name: Guillermo Enrique

texts.en:
Before opening his business, Guillermo worked in a restaurant where the menu offered ‘cabrito’, a dish made from young goat. While working there, he gained experience cooking cabrito which is a traditional dish in northern Mexico, especially in the area around Monterrey. Once he had mastered the technique and saw that his style of preparing the meat was popular with customers, he decided to open his own business selling cabrito. He now spends all of his time working in his business, and has been able to support his family. He has 3 children who are in school, and a wife who works with him in his business. Guillermo is requesting a $425 loan to purchase merchandise for his business. He plans to repay the loan in 6 to 12 months, and he hopes to continue to grow his business and to support his family.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer.

Guillermo antes de iniciar su negocio, trabajaba de empleado en un restauran Que se dedicaba a la venta de cabrito y fue ahí donde adquirió experiencia para cocinar cabrito, es un plato típico del norte de México, especialmente de Monterrey. Cuando aprendió y vio que la gente gustaba mucho de su sazón, el decidió poner su propio negocio de venta de cabritos, ahora el solo se dedica a ello, y con esto a salido adelante con su familia ya que tiene 3 hijos los cuales estudian y su esposa le ayuda a la venta de cabrito.

Guillermo esta solicitando un préstamo de US $ 425 para comprar mercancía para su negocio y ofrece pagarlo en un período de 6 a 12 meses, espera su apoyo para continuar creciendo con su negocio y mantener a su familia.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Astid

texts.en:
Astrid works selling shoes to contribute to the family budget. She has two children in school and though her husband works as a laborer for a company, the wages that he receives are very low. The family’s expenses are high, and they are making payments on a house that they were able to purchase through a loan that they received through Infonavit. By bringing in extra income she is able to pay some of the household expenses and support her husband without neglecting her family.

Astrid is asking for a $675 loan to purchase merchandise and to meet her customers’ demand. She offers to repay the loan within 3 to 6 months, and asks for your support to help her to progress and to improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Astrid decidió vender zapatos para contribuir al gasto familiar ya que tiene 2 hijos que estudian y su esposo trabaja en una empresa como obrero y por ello el sueldo que el tiene es muy bajo, y sus gastos son altos aparte que están pagando la casa que pudieron comprar ya que la adquirieron por crédito de Infonavit, de esta manera ella puede solventar algunos gastos del hogar y apoyar a su esposo sin descuidar a su familia.

Astrid esta solicitando un préstamo por US$ 675 para comprar mercadería y satisfacer su demanda, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en un período de 3 a 6 meses, espera de tu apoyo para poder salir adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The loan to invest in buying furniture, in maintaining the restaurant to improve its appearance, and to buy new kitchen equipment

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.en:
Rebeca is married with 3 children; one boy and two girls. Fifteen years ago, her husband became ill, and since then he has been unable to work. Rebeca was obliged to open a business to bring in income. Because of her confectionary skills, she decided that she would sell baked goods. She works in her business every day herself, with no outside assistance.

Rebeca is asking for a loan of $825 to buy supplies for her business, and she is offering to pay the loan within 6 to 12 months. She asks for your collaboration and support, and offers her sincere thanks.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer.

Rebeca es una mujer casada y tiene 3 hijos, un varón y dos mujeres. Su esposo no trabaja ya que se enfermo y tuvo que dejar de trabajar, por ello hace 15 años que esto ocurrió, Rebeca se vio en la necesidad de emprender un negocio. Ella sabe mucho de repostería y fue eso lo que se dedico a vender. Atiende en su negocio todos los días de la semana y no tiene ayudantes, ella sola ve con el mismo.

Rebeca esta solicitando un préstamo de US$ 825 para comprar insumos que utiliza en su negocio y ofrece pagar este préstamo en un período de 6 a 12 meses, espera tu colaboración y apoyo, y te lo agradece sinceramente.

loans.use: Purchase of supplies

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The loan will be invested in maintenance and repairs for the shop, such as maintenance on the bread oven, which has been in use for nearly a decade

loans.name: Maria Candelaria

texts.en:
Maria is 36 years old and is married with 3 children, ages 15, 17 and 19. Cirilo, her husband has worked for the Ferromex Railroad Company for 18 years, but because the wages that he receives are not sufficient to cover the household costs and the education of their three children, it is necessary for her find a way to bring in extra income. For the past three years Maria has worked selling used clothing and orange juice, which she makes herself.

Love for her family and dedication to her husband drive Maria to work harder every day. She is asking for a $275 loan with she will use to purchase merchandise so that she can offer greater variety to her clients, and by doing so increase her sales. This will proviD. important help in the life of this family and in the growth of this business, and they thank you for your assistance.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria tiene 36 años D. edad, es casada y madre D. tres hijos, D. 15, 17 y 19 años. Cirilo, su esposo, trabaja desD. hace 18 años como ferrocarrillero en L. empresa Ferromex, pero el ingreso que recibe es muy poco para solventar los gastos D. su hogar y D. L. educación D. sus tres hijos, ante L. necesidad D. obtener un ingreso extra, Maria decidió iniciar, hace tres años, son L. venta D. ropa usada y jugos D. naranja, que elL. misma prepara.

El amor a su familia y el fiel compromiso con su esposo son los motivos más grandes D. Maria para esforzarse cada días más, ahora necesita D. un préstamo por $ 275 dólares que empleará en L. compra D. mercancía para ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes y D. esta manera incrementar sus ventas. Se parte importante es L. viada D. esta familia y en el crecimiento D. este negocio, ellos agradecen tu ayuda.

loans.use: Purchase of Merchandise

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is a married 44 year old mother of three children, ages 21, 22, and 24. Her husband Miguel works for the Social Security agency, but his salary is not sufficient to meet for all of the family expenses, especially since their children have begun attending the university. A love for cooking and the need to bring in extra income led her to open her own food sales business three years ago. She began working from her home, and little by little she has increased her clientele.

She is now requesting a $750 loan which she will use to purchase the necessary supplies for the food that she prepares, so that her business can continue to grow. You have the ability to improve the quality of life of this family and to help this business grow. Please don’t hesitate in making the decision to offer help to Patricia.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer.

Patricia es casada, tiene 44 años de edad y es madre de tres hijos, de 21, 22 y 24 años. Su esposo Miguel es trabajador del seguro social, pero el salario que recibe es insuficiente para cubrir todas las necesidades de su familia, sobre todo ahora que sus hijos empezaron a estudiar en la universidad. El gusto por la cocina y la necesidad de obtener un ingreso extra, incentivaron a Patricia a iniciar su propio negocio de venta de comida hace tres años, empezó en su propio domicilio y poco a poco ha ido ganando más clientes.

En estos momentos ella requiere de un crédito por $750 dólares que utilizará en la compra de los insumos necesarios para la elaboración de las comidas que vende, y de esta manera continuar creciendo con su negocio. En tus manos esta el poder mejorar la vida de esta familia y hacer crecer este negocio, no lo pienses más y decídete a ayudar a Patricia.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients

loans.name: Perfecto Benancio

texts.en:
Perfecto’s business selling nutritional products has been in place for 12 yeas. He is married to Mrs. Alejandra Bustos Chavez, who assists him in the business. A love for sales and the need to obtain income to pay the expenses of their home led them to begin this business. Because of his long history in the business, he has learned how to advise clients regarding nutritional needs, and has been able to build a large base of clients who benefit from his products and advice.

He is now in need of a $750 loan which he will use to purchase merchandise. Through his past experience, he knows that the good sales season is coming up, and he would like to be ready. He would like to purchase his products wholesale in order to get a better price and to increase his profit margin. He is in need of your assistance, and your loan will be a great help to this family. Please do not hesitate, the family sends thanks for your generosity and support.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Perfecto tiene con su negocio de venta de productos nutricionales una antigüedad de 12 años. Esta casado con la sra. Alejandra Bustos Chávez, quien le ayuda en su negocio. El gusto que tiene por las ventas y la necesidad de obtener un ingreso para solventar los gastos de su hogar lo incentivaron a iniciar con esta actividad, gracias al tiempo que tiene en este negocio, se ha capacitado para asesorar a las personas en nutrición, y ha logrado tener muchos clientes que se benefician de sus productos y de sus consultas.

En este momento necesita de un crédito por $750 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, con la experiencia sabe que es temporada de buenas ventas y quiere estar preparado para esto, desea poder adquirir los productos al mayoreo para obtener un mejor precio e incrementar sus ganancias. Él necesita de tu ayuda y tú puedes ser muy importante en esta familia, no lo dudes más, ellos agradecen tu generosidad y apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Mónica

texts.en:
Monica sells gas tanks for household use out of her home. She started her business with a small sum her mother provided. She is the only one operating this type of business, which has a strong demand. Monica will use the loan to purchase more gas tanks. She is confident this loan will help her grow the business. Monica is 24 years old, single and lives with her mother. She hopes that with this loan she can improve her family's quality of life and save to build her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Julie Lerch

Mónica se dedica a la venta de gas domestico en su domicilio. Empezó su negocio con un pequeño capital que le dio su madre. Es único negocio en su sector tiene mucha demanda de compra. Mónica usara el préstamo para invertir en compra de tanques de gas. Ella tiene la confianza que su negocio crecerá. Mónica tiene 24 años, es soltera vive junto con su madre. Ella tiene la esperanza que con este préstamo mejorara la calidad de vida de su familia y le permitirá ahorrar para la construcción de su vivienda.

loans.use: To purchase natural gas tanks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase inventory and grow the business

loans.name: Alba

texts.en:
Alba sells cosmetics and costume jewelry-door-to door. Albita started her business with $200 dollars of savings. Initially she only sold cosmetics. Now she sells all types of costume jewelry and clothing. Alba apires to sell cosmetic-clothing combos. She will use this loan to invest in merchandise at volume wholesale prices to increase her profits. Alba is married, 37 years old, married with four children. She depends on this business to support her family and to save for the future.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Julie Lerch

Alba se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y bisutería recorriendo puerta a puerta por sectores marginales. Albita empezó su negocio con unos ahorros de $200 dólares. Al principio solo vendía cosméticos. Ahora vende toda clase de bisutería y ropa. Alba aspira vender combos de cosméticos y ropa. Ella usara el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería al por mayor y así obtener mejores ganancias. Alba esta casada. Ella tiene 37 años, esta casada, tiene 4 niños depende de su negocio para apoyar a su familia y ahorrar para el futuro.

loans.use: Invest in wholesale merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase merchandise in bulk.

loans.name: Olga Guadalupe

texts.en:
Olga is a young lady with a desire to excel. She lives in the town of San Nicolas de los Garza in the state of Nuevo Leon. Because she lacked the resources necessary to continue her studies, she found it necessary to obtain a job to bring in extra income. She decided to open her own business selling shoes so that she could work without neglecting her studies, and little by little, her business has grown, to the point that she is receiving a large number of orders.

Olgas is asking for a $250 loan which she will use to purchase merchandise that has been ordered by her clients. She is offering to repay the loan in 3 to 6 months. You can be an important part of Olga’s dreams. She needs your help and sincerely thanks you for your collaboration.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer.

Olga es una joven con grandes deseos de superación, vive en la localidad de San Nicolás de los Garza en el estado de Nuevo León, ella no contaba con los recursos necesarios para continuar en la escuela, así que era muy necesario conseguir un trabajo para obtener un ingreso extra, y para no descuidar sus estudios decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de calzado, poco a poco sus clientes se han incrementado y ahora surte un gran número de pedidos.

En estos momentos, Olga necesita de un crédito por $ 250 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía de esta temporada que ya ha sido pedida por sus clientes, ella ofrece devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. Tú puedes ser una parte importante en los sueños de Olga, ella necesita de tu ayuda, y agradece sinceramente tu colaboración.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.en:
Gerardo is a hard working responsible man who lives in San Nicolas de los Garza in the state of Nuevo Leon. Gerardo is the only caregiver of his elderly parents who live with him. In order to provide for his parents needs while caring for them, he decided to open his own business selling food. His mother helped him by sharing her best recipes and cooking secrets.

Fortunately, his work has paid off, and his business has grown with more orders and new clients coming in every day. Gerardo is asking for a $1,200 loan which he will use to purchase the supplies that he needs, and to remodel his location. He hopes that by doing this he will increase sales and income. You can be a part of this growth. Gerardo and his parents thank you for your generosity and kindness.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Gerardo es un hombre muy responsable y trabajador, vive en la localidad de San Nicolás de los Garza, en el estado de Nuevo León. Gerardo vive con sus padres que son de edad avanzada y dependen solo de él. Para poder obtener los recursos que necesitan y al mismo tiempo darles los cuidados que requieren sus padres, decidió iniciar su propio negocio de venta de comidas, con ayuda de su madre, quien le comparte sus mejores recetas y secretos de cocina.

Afortunadamente, su trabajo ha rendido frutos y cada vez hay más clientes y pedidos, para impulsar su negocio, Gerardo solicita un préstamo por $ 1,200 dólares que utilizará en la compra de insumos que necesita y para remodelar el local, con lo que espera que se incrementen sus ventas y poder obtener mayores beneficios. Forma parte de este crecimiento, Gerardo y sus padres agradecen tu generosidad y cariño.

loans.use: Purchase of supplies and remodeling

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Maria Benita

texts.en:
Maria Benita is a widow with six children. After the death of her husband she needed to find a way to earn money to pay for the household expenses and her children’s education. She decided to open her own business selling tacos, and thanks to the success she has had she has been able to help her children to progress while still having time to care for them. Her business has grown little by little, and her children have helped to make it grow. Maria is asking for a $925 loan which she will use to purchase the supplies necessary for preparing the food that she sells, and to upgrade and improve her establishment. Is has not been easy for this family to overcome this great loss, but the work hard every day to progress. You can help them. Now is the time to help those most in need.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maria Benita es viuda y tiene seis hijos, después de la muerte de su esposo, ella tuvo que hacerse cargo de cubrir los gastos de su hogar y de la educación de sus hijos, razón por la que decidió iniciar si propio negocio en el que vende tacos, gracias a este negocio ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos y ha tenido el tiempo para atenderlos. Poco a poco su negocio ha estado creciendo y con la ayuda de sus hijos han podido hacerlo crecer.

Ahora Maria necesita de un préstamo por $ 925 dólares que utilizará para la compra de los insumos que requiere para la elaboración de sus comidas, así como para acondicionar y mejorar el establecimiento. No ha sido fácil para esta familia superar esa gran pérdida, pero se esfuerzan día a día por salir adelante, tú puedes ayudarlos, hoy es tiempo de ayudar a quien más lo necesita.

loans.use: Purchase of supplies and remodeling

loans.name: Francisco Gabriel

texts.en:
Francisco is married with three young daughters. Five years ago he and his wife decided to open their own business, where they offer veterinary services. They started their business with the hope that they could provide quality education to their daughters and to provide for the household expenses. Fortunately, their veterinary service is growing and bringing in many new clients. They recently had the opportunity to open an additional location, and they used all of the savings that they had available to do so.

Francisco is now asking for a $1,200 loan which he will use to expand and renovate his new location, so that he can offer good services and continue growing his business. You can be a fundamental part of the growth of this business, and in the life of this family. They need your help, so do not delay.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer.

Francisco es casado y tiene tres pequeñas niñas. Hace cinco años él y su esposa decidieron iniciar su propio negocio, donde ofrecen sus servicios de veterinaria, emprendieron su negocio con la finalidad de ofreces a sus hijas una educación de calidad y para cubrir sus gastos familiares, afortunadamente la veterinaria ha estado creciendo y ganado muchos clientes, últimamente tuvieron la oportunidad de abrir otro local en el que gastaron todo el capital del que disponían.

Ahora Francisco requiere de un préstamo por $ 1,200 dólares que empleará en la ampliación y remodelación de su nuevo local, para ofrecer un buen servicio y continuar creciendo. Tú puedes ser parte fundamental en el crecimiento de este negocio y en la vida de esta familia, ellos necesitan de tu ayuda, no lo pienses más.

loans.use: Remodeling of clinic

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Chan V. is 33 years old and is a mother of 3 children living with her husband in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She works in the nearby garment factory and normally generates around $3/day in revenue. Her husband, meanwhile, repairs tires in the village roadside and typically helps to contribute all the money to the household. Her children are students and assist their parents by cooking meals. V. hopes to use this loan to purchase an air pumping machine to help facilitate her husband's business to make more additional income. In the future, this couple hopes to make more money to open a simple vehicle repaire shop and to supplement their children's education.

loans.use: To purchase an air pumping machine to operate the tire repair business.

loans.name: Khat

texts.en: Khat A., 25 years old, mother of 1 child, lives with her husband in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She is self-employed as a garment worker and generates about $2.50/day in revenue. Her husband is struggling to work hard under pressure in construction and also feeds domestic animals such as pigs, chickens, and ducks. He typically helps his family in financing with his daily income. They have one son who is too young to attend school. In addition, Khat A. hopes the loan will allow her to purchase more pigs, chickens, and other construction tools in order to expand the business. In the future, Khat A. intends to save enough money to open a shop selling many types of construction supplies and to build a concrete house for her family's facility.

loans.use: To purchase more pigs and other construction tools.

payments.comment: Khat Ang has successfully repaid her loan early! Thanks to you, she was able to expand her business and improve the life of her family. Thank you for your support!

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lusita is 59 years old, and she is a single mother of eight! All of her children have since moved out of the house, but they take with them the many lessons that their mother Lusita taught them. When she left her parents' house many years ago, Lusita dedicated herself to selling goods near the major streets in Guayaquil. In the past she also worked in a restaurant for the Ecuadorian Navy, but when they closed their doors, she moved her business to her home. It hasn’t been easy for Ms. C.. Her husband left her to raise all eight children, so she had to find part time work outside the home to bring in enough income for the family.

Lusita is requesting her second loan with the Kiva and Mifex program. She wants to continue investing in her store and buying more and better inventory. Her first loan was a success as she was able to increase profits and make some small improvements to her home.

loans.use: Continue investing in inventory for her store

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma owns a business in which she sells gifts and knickknacks, which she has done from her home for 10 years. She began with small savings that her husband gave her so that she could invest them. Emma tends her store and her customers every day of the week from 6am to 10pm.

Emma needs a loan in order to buy school supplies and gift items. For the school year and for Mother's day, her customers are asking for things such as: "Cups Games," "Toasters", "Wave Games," and others. Because she lacks the liquid capital, she cannot meet her customers' demand, which would increase her earnings.

Emma is 46 years old and has 3 children to care for, 2 of whom are in school. Emma says that with the loan she will invest in the products in demand and with the additional earnings, she will be able to remodel her locale. Emma's husband helps her in her purchasing, which she does in order to supply and expand her store, because she knows that this source of income helps to improve her family's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor

Emma tiene su negocio de venta de regalos y bisuterías, en su domicilio desde hace 10 años. Se inicio con pequeños ahorros que esposo le daba para que ella viera en que lo invirtiera. Emma atiende a sus clientes todos los días de la semana desde las 6: AM a 22: PM

Emma tiene la necesidad de un préstamo para poder comprar útiles escolares, regalos. Por ser época escolar y el día de la Madre le están solicitando regalos como: Juegos de Vasos, Tostadoras, Juegos de Ollas y otros. Y por falta de capital no puede satisfacer esta demanda que a su vez le generaría mayores ingresos.

Emma tiene 46 años 3 hijos. A su cargo y estudiando 2. Emma indica que con el préstamo invertirá en la demanda que tiene y con utilidades generadas podrá adecuar su local. El esposo de Emma la ayuda en las diferentes compras que ella realiza para incrementar su negocio, porque sabe que es otra fuente de ingreso que también ayuda a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

loans.use: To purchase school supplies and other products

loans.name: Jerónima

texts.en:
Jeronima has the experience of 12 years, selling various items such as gifts, toys and foodstuffs. She began with some savings that she had thanks to the help of her husband, her gave them to her. On her own iniciative, she decided to sell lunches from her home. This business endeavor went very well and has been strong now for 7 years. She manages her activities with the help of her family. She works every day of the week from 12pm to 3pm.

Jeronima wishes for a loan in order to buy 2 tables and chairs for her dining area. She already has high demand around lunchtime and wishes to provide her customers with a better service.

Jeronima is married, with 4 children, 3 of whom attend school. Her husband is in charge of selling her product from the stand and in the market. She is the cook. Her goal is to give a good education to her children. Little by little, with the earnings she generates, her business will allow her to improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Jerónima tiene una experiencia de 12 años vendiendo artículos como regalos, juguetes y también víveres. Se inicio con unos ahorros que tenia gracias al apoyo que le dio su esposo. Por iniciativa propia decide comenzar a vender almuerzos en su domicilio. Negocio que le fue muy bien y al momento tiene ya 7 años. Combina las dos actividades siempre con la ayuda de la familia. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 12 p.m. hasta las 15 p.m.

Jerónima desea el crédito para poder comprar 2 mesas y sillas para su comedor. Ya que tiene buena demanda de los almuerzos y desea darle una mejor atención a sus clientes.

Jerónima es casada. Tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 3 estudian. Su esposo es la persona que se encarga de vender los productos de su tienda y bazar. Ella es la que se encarga de la preparación de los almuerzos. Su meta es poder darla una buena educación a sus hijos. Y poco a poco con la ganancia que genere sus negocios poder mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: To purchase tables and seats

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.en:
Gabriela has 12 years of sales experience. She started selling shoes but due to the time and effort this took she slowly stoped this activity. With the help of her husband, she opened a small store out of their home. This business has done very well and now they have expanded to selling fruit. They work every day of the week from 6am to 11pm. They have a cart they use in the afternoon to sell fruit along a route in her neighborhood. She needs a loan to invest in the purchase of additional fruits to meet her growing daily demand and to add to the variety of her products. Gabriela is married, and is 23 years old. Together with her husband she has managed to be successful in her business. Currently they do not have any children but they are thinking about it for the future. They live at home with her parents. Her wish is to eventually buy some land where they can build their own home.

Translated by Kiva Volunteer Julie Lerch

Gabriela tiene una experiencia de 12 años en el comercio. Se inicio vendiendo zapatos pero por el tiempo que le demandaba y su esfuerzo decide poco a poco ir dejando esa actividad. Con la ayuda de su esposo deciden ponerse una tienda en su domicilio. Dicho negocio le ha ido muy bien que incluso han incluido dentro de esta la venta de frutas. Trabajan todos los días de la semana desde las 6 a.m. hasta las 11 p.m. Tienen un carrito en el cual por las tardes salen a recorrer con la venta de las frutas.

Desea el crédito para poder invertir en frutas ya que su demanda a aumentado en su recorrido diario. Además surtir su negocio con mas frutas

Gabriela es casada. Tiene 23 años. Ella junto a su esposo han logrado sacar adelante el negocio. Al momento no tienen hijos pero están pensando en la posibilidad más delante de concebir. Viven en la casa de sus padres. Su deseo es poder mas adelante comprar un terreno en donde poco a poco ir construyendo su casita propia.

loans.use: Invest in fruit

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel has 10 years experience in her tailorshop. On her own iniciative, she began to elaborate garments, which she then began to sell. This endeavor went very well and little by little she has been purchasing different kinds of sewing machines for her store. She works every day of the week from 8am to 5pm.

Isabel is requesting this loan in order to purchase a sewing machine, which is currently on sale, and she needs it very much. With this investment, she will be able to improve her earnings and to improve her store. And so she will be able to give a better servive to her customers.

Isabel is a single mother. She is 45 and has 2 children, who are both in high school. She has her own small home which is made of cement. She would like to be able to, little by litte, to improve her quality of life and to remodel her tailorshop so that it looks nicer.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor

Isabel tiene una experiencia de 10 años con su taller de costura. Por iniciativa propia decide comenzar a elaborar prendas las que posteriormente comenzó a vender. Le fue muy bien y poco a poco ha ido comprando sus maquinas de coser para su taller. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 8 a.m. hasta las 5 p.m.

Isabel desea el crédito para poder comprarse una maquina de coser la que le están dando a un precio muy bajo y ella lo necesita. Además con los ingresos que genere piensa mejorar su local. De esta manera prestar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Isabel es madre soltera. Tiene 45 años y 2 hijos. Los que ya están en colegio y estudian. Tiene una casita propia y es de cemento. Desea poder poco a poco con sus ingresos mejorar su calidad de vida y darle una mejor imagen a su taller de costura.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Mel

texts.en: Mel S. P. is 39 years old is a widow and lives with her child in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. P. has one child who is a student.  She works in a school as a primary school teacher.  In order to supplement her income, she runs a tailoring business from her home.  She would like to use this loan in order to purchase a sewing machine and more clothes for her tailoring business.  In the future, P. hopes to open a tailoring business at the market.  She hopes that eventually she will be able to afford to send her child to a university.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and clothes to expand business.

payments.comment: Congratulations to Mel Sam Phany for repaying the Kiva loan early!

loans.name: Nila

texts.en:
Nila is a widow who runs a little business selling shoes at the busiest city market in Novaya Kahovka, Ukraine. She has been in the shoe retail business for 15 years.

Lending services from Nadiya Ukraine have promoted the expansion of Nila’s trade and helped her obtain needed inventory. Nila has proven to be an entrepreneur of integrity as she has faithfully repaid each previous loan. This-- together with her professionalism, determination, and tenacity--has added greatly to the success of her business venture.

Nila would like to get a loan of $1,200 to purchase new pairs of shoes for resale. She thinks that offering a wide assortment of brands and styles-–from sandals, flip-flops, espadrilles, and casual footwear to a great athletic shoe selection--will help her business stand out from her competitors and bring in extra profits. We believe that this loan will help Nila achieve a higher income and improve her entrepreneurial skills.

Ніла – вдова. Вона торгує взуттям на великому місцевому ринку в Новій Каховці. Вона займається цим бізнесом вже 15 років. Кредитні послуги „Надії України” сприяли розвитку торгівлі Ніли та допомогли їй отримати необхідний товар. Ніла – чесний та порядний підприємець, вона вчасно сплатила усі попередні позики. Її професіоналізм, наполегливість та витривалість стали тими чинниками, які допомогли їй досягти успіху. Ніла хотіла б отримати позику в 1200 доларів для того, щоб придбати нове взуття для подальшого продажу. Вона вважає, що широкий асортимент моделей та стилів – від босоніжок, в’єтнамок та повсякденного взуття до широкого вибору спортивного взуття, допоможе її бізнесу вигідно виділятися серед її конкурентів та принесе їй додатковий прибуток. Ми вважаємо, що ця позика допоможе Нілі отримати додатковий прибуток та набути нових навичок у веденні бізнесу.

loans.use: To purchase new shoes wholesale

loans.name: Mariya

texts.en:
Mariya is married with two grown children. She sells clothing items in one of the busiest markets in Ivano-Frankivsk. She owns three vending facilities and has three hired employees who work for her. The inventory she sells is of very high quality. Even though her prices are a little higher than average, Mariya has gained many loyal customers who keep coming back to buy clothes from her.

Mariya has been in business for 10 years. The twenty-four loans she has received and promptly repaid with Nadiya Ukraine have promoted consistent increase in her sales and profits. Currently, she has around $8,000 of working capital. Her net profit is about $2,000 every month.

Mariya has requested a loan for $1,200 to help open her fourth vending kiosk and expand her trade as a result. Her daughter just had her first baby and Mariya is enjoying her responsibilities as a grandma. She is hoping that this loan will have a positive impact on her business profitability and help her further improve the economic and social situation of her family.

Марія – одружена, в неї двоє дорослих дітей. Вона торгує одягом на одному з найбільших ринків Івано-Франківську. В неї три торгових приміщення, працює три реалізатори. Товар, яким торгує Марія, високої якості. Проте, хоча ціни трохи вище середніх, в неї багато постійних покупців, які приходять купляти одяг саме в неї. Марія займається цим бізнесом вже 10 років. Двадцять чотири позики, які вона отримала від „Надії України” та вчасно сплатила, сприяли поступовому збільшенню обсягів продажу та прибутків. Зараз в Марії приблизно 8000 доларів робочого капіталу. Її чистий прибуток складає 2000 доларів щомісяця. Марія просить про позику в 1200 доларів для того, щоб відкрити четвертий торговий кіоск та розширити торгівлю. Її дочка тільки нещодавно народила дитину, а, отже, в бабусі Марії з’явилося багато нових зобов’язань. Вона сподівається, що позика позитивно відіб’ється на прибутковості її бізнесу, а також покращить економічне та соціальне становище її родини.

loans.use: To open a new vending facility

loans.name: Qudrat

texts.en:
H. Qudrat Rustam qizi is a former refugee from Uzbekistan who fled to Varkhankend village of the Saatli district during the 1990's. She is married and has 3 children. She started her animal breeding business in the late 1990's. 

In 2005, she borrowed 700 USD from Agroinvest Credit Union and bought one milking cow. She expanded her business and used the profits to improve her living conditions. Now, she wants to borrow 550 USD to buy one more cow to expand the volume of her business.

loans.use: Wants to buy one more cow to expand her business volume

loans.name: Pyotr

texts.en:
Pyotr is married and has two grown daughters. He runs a business selling men’s clothing in the central city market. Reasonable prices for the clothing in Pyotr’s kiosk are affordable to average Ukrainians and make it a desirable stop for many customers. Pyotr works in a highly competitive segment of the market. However, he offers a big assortment of inventory in comparison to other entrepreneurs involved in this sphere of trade. Athletic and casual wear, jackets and t-shirts are just some of the clothing items to be found in his kiosk.

Pyotr has been in this business for 10 years. Previously he served in the military. His disciplined mind and the consistency, persistence, and determination he demonstrates have fueled the expansion of his business. His inventory is continuously growing and his profit margin is about 70%.

Today he is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase seasonal men’s clothing for the coming months. Pyotr realizes the role that available lending services have had in the growth of his business. Financial assistance from Nadiya Ukraine has helped him generate income that he has used to complete the reconstruction of his apartment and install a heating system and help pay for his daughters’ college education. Now Pyotr is planning to use part of his income to help his mother-in-law who owns a business in the same city market. Eventually he would also like to open a vending facility in the central city mall. We believe that his ability to make good decisions and set right goals will help him repay this loan promptly and will enable his business to continue to thrive in the future.

Петро – одружений, в нього двоє дорослих дочок. Він продає чоловічий одяг на центральному ринку міста. Помірні ціни на одяг в його кіоску доступні пересічному українцю, а, отже, в нього завжди багато покупців. Сегмент ринку, в якому працює Петро, характеризується високою конкуренцією. Проте, в його кіоску завжди можна знайти широкий вибір товарів, чим він вигідно виділяться на фоні інших підприємців, що працюють в цій сфері торгівлі. Спортивний та повсякденний одяг, куртки та футболки – це лише деякі різновиди товару в його кіоску. Петро займається цим бізнесом вже 10 років. Він певний час служив в армії. Дисциплінованість, поступовість, наполегливість та рішучість сприяли розвитку його бізнесу. Асортимент товару постійно зростає, прибуток становить приблизно 70%. Зараз Петро просить про позику в 1200 доларів для того, щоб придбати сезонний чоловічий одяг напередодні теплих літніх місяців. Петро усвідомлює роль кредитних послуг, завдяки яким його бізнес поступово зростав. Завдяки фінансовій підтримці від „Надії України” Петро зміг закінчити реконструкцію власної оселі, провести автономну систему опалення та допомогти донечкам з коштами на навчання. Зараз Петро планує використати частину отриманого прибутку для того, щоб допомогти своїй тещі, яка також займається торгівлею на тому ж ринку. Врешті-решт Петро хотів би також відкрити торгове приміщення в центральному торговому центрі міста. Ми вважаємо, що його здатність приймати розумні рішення та досягати власної мети допоможе йому вчасно сплатити позику та досягти ще більшого успіху в майбутньому.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal men’s clothing

loans.name: Asabe

texts.en:
Testimony: "The idea I had for business led me to look for people of like minds and then to form a cooperative with Urban Ministry. I began with $40 and my business has given me $10 per week of profit. I am grateful to UM as I can now assist my husband in taking care of some family needs."

Family: A married woman with six children

Current Income: I have an average income of $35.00 per month.

Business Plan: My goal is to be able to secure a place were I can have my own restaurant that will generate more income for me and my family.

Mrs. Asabe M. is part of the Rahama Cooperative and the loan is a group loan.

loans.use: Selling of basic food items needed in local communities.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Testimony: "My eagerness to contribute to my family and community has encouraged me and my friends to work together as a group. Today, I am proud of having a positive contribution at both levels: family and community. My opinion can be heard in our community."

Business: Shoe Seller

Family: A married woman with five children

Current Income: I have an average income of $45.00 per month.

Business Plan: I want to secure a shop were I can stock my goods for sell instead of going from place to place.

This is a group loan that Mrs. Mary belongs to called Gaskiya Cooperative.

loans.use: To rent a small shop and enlarge her stock of general use items.

loans.name: Toma

texts.en:
Testimony: "I am grateful to UM for making enabling me to own my shop. I can now feed my family out of the $40 profit I make per week from the business. I have two employees whom I pay on a monthly basis. I have contributed my local government efforts of providing employment as well as reducing poverty in our community."

Business: Cement Seller

Family: A married man with 7 children

Current Income: approximately N25,000 per month

Business Plan: Source more funds to stock my shop for a better profit.

Mr. Toma C. is part of the Wunanto Cooperative and the loan is a group loan.

loans.use: Increase stock of cement and fertilizer for my shop to increase profit.

loans.name: Lady

texts.en:
Mrs T. is married with two children. She has been in this business for one and a half years. She sells food and goods used in the home, such as soap, matches, oil, dairy products, and cereal. She grateful to have a store in her home that facilitates her to sell goods without having to pay big costs, such as the cost to carry out goods. This type of business from home helps her to take care of her children by working from home without going around to sell her goods .

With the loan of $200, she can count on adding more cereal to her merchandise line. With the remaining money, she will buy others things like soap, milk, and oil.

Mrs T. is one of the HELP Africa beneficiary groups called, “Fezirewe.” The three women of this group are asking for a loan of $200 each. The total amount for the group is $600.

loans.use: Augment inventory

payments.comment: Thank you for helping Tchakondo. She was able  to pay  50 dollars as of today August 16 th. From now going she will be able to keep the ball runs because she understands beter the system  and HELP Africa put more staff  to help them in the system .Again thank you

Thak you . Your support was needed to make this big change on this woman's life 
Thank yoou
Thank you for supporting her business . She looks forward to continue supporting  her  business to grow  more

loans.name: Djaretou

texts.en:
Mrs Djaretou is married with two children. She has sold charcoal and corn for five years. Her strategy of selling is to distribute goods to her clients as soon as she makes storage room. This means that she has permanent clients; she knows them well, and their business and their family situation. She often sells some of her charcoal at the local market. Some customers pay cash, others pay after ten or fifteen days; in this way she increases the number of her clients day by day and all her goods are sold. She benefits from a strong return on investment, which permits her to help her husband to support her family.

Mrs Djaretou is one of the HELP Africa women beneficiary groups called “Yerima-Djaretou.” The five women of this group are asking for a loan of $500 dollars total.

With this loan, she can account for the entirety of the needed charcoal stock.

loans.use: Purchase charcoal

payments.comment: This is an adjustment to a payment made by Djaretou to HELP Africa.  The amount that was marked as paid was off by a bit because there was some reporting confusion about how to use the Kiva website among the HELP Africa team.  It is now cleared up, and we expect monthly payments to come in as scheduled.  Thanks!
Thank you for helping me  and supporting my business

We apprecaite your support which was needed to make her dreams come true 
Thank you

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en:
Mrs. A. is married with one child. She has made and sold food for 2 years. She prepares many dishes every day, especially “fufu,” cassava, rice, and lettuce. Apart from this business, she is also a hairdresser, which was her first business before she began making food.

She is hopeful for this business, because she sells all of her prepared food on a daily basis. (In Togo, workers and students don’t go back home for lunch, they prefer to buy something near their jobs or schools.) By keeping this business, Mrs. A. can afford to pay her loan in good time and take care of herself. One half of her loan will be used to buy corn and yams, the other half to repair the place where clients eat.

Mrs Claudine A. created the restaurant, “Alafia,” with three of her friends. They have been working as a group under HELP Africa assistance for two years. The four women need a total of 6$00 dollars to improve their food restaurant business.

loans.use: Purchase corn and yams; finance building repair

payments.comment: This is an adjustment to a payment made by Claudine to HELP Africa.  The amount that was marked as paid was off by a bit because there was some reporting confusion about how to use the Kiva website among the HELP Africa team.  It is now cleared up, and we expect monthly payments to come in as scheduled.  Thanks!

Thak you . Your support was needed to make this big change on this woman's life 
Thank yoou
Thank you so mch for your support
Thank you so much for your support  to her business

loans.name: Amivi

texts.en:
Mrs A. is married with two children. She runs a business shop with her friend. The two have been in this business since 2002, after receiving the first loan from HELP Africa. They have all types of groceries/products in the shop. Some of these products are sold by less fortunate women who come and take the groceries from the shop and sell them by going around the town. In the afternoon, they report what they have sold, and they are paid accordingly. However, most of the products are sold in the shop.

There is a huge demand, but Mrs A. and her friend don’t have money to augment supplies. But with the 800 dollars requested by the two women, they will more buy products, sell these supplies, and make more profits. This allows them to take care of their children and pay back loans. The total requested by these two women is $800.

loans.use: Buy more inventory

payments.comment: This is an adjustment to a payment made by Amivi to HELP Africa.  The amount that was marked as paid was off by a bit because there was some reporting confusion about how to use the Kiva website among the HELP Africa team.  It is now cleared up, and we expect monthly payments to come in as scheduled.  Thanks!
Thank you so much . I became human

Thak you . Your support was needed to make this big change on this woman's life 
Thank yoou

loans.name: Xuyen

texts.en: Xuyen is 27 years old and Kien, her husband is 33. They have two children. They have 10,000m2 of land where they grow cashew nut trees and corn. Their main income from this land is very low at only $10 per person per month, so Xuyen must work as a daily laborer for the local handicraft workshop. Now, they hope to get a loan of $75 to improve their crops.

loans.use: Xuyen would like supplies to grow more cashew nut trees and corn.

loans.name: Sau

texts.en:
Mrs. Sau and her husband are old, 66 and 65, and they have no children. 
They have 3000 square meters of land but they must hire people to grow rice because they are too weak. So Sau is selling food for breakfast at their house. This is important for increasing their income, which averages $14/person/month. She wants to borrow $50 for her food sales business.

loans.use: retail sales

loans.name: Dieu

texts.en: Dieu and her husband are 26 and 24 and they have two children who are 1 and 6. They have 9000 square meters where they planted cashew nut trees. The cashew nut trees were only planted two years ago so they don’t give cashew nuts yet. Dieu works as a daily laborer for the local handicraft workshop at her hut. Her husband also works as a day laborer but the work is not stable so they have no capital to buy fertilizer for cashew nut trees. Their income is low at only $7 per person per month. They want to get a loan of $75  to buy fertilizer. They promise to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: Dieu would like to buy fertilizer to grow her cashew nut trees.

loans.name: Henriette

texts.en:
G. Henriette is a 39-year-old woman who lives with her husband and her 4 children in Koumassi, a township in the south of Abidjan. Henriette sells various vegetables in the Koumassi main open market. She wants to purchase palm oil as it is the production season and prices are better now than at any other period of the year. She will stock the oil in casks and start reselling it in August, 2007 to make a profit.

G. is an enthusiastic woman. She received her first loan from AE&I in July, 2004, and we have never had any reimbursement issues with her. She significantly contributes to her family's revenue generation.

loans.use: Gauze Henriette will use the loan to purchasing palm oil.

loans.name: Akissi

texts.en: Y. Akissi is a 41-year-old woman with 4 children. She is a war displaced woman who was living in the northern region of Côte d’Ivoire until September, 2002 when the civil war started. She came to Abidjan with her family in March, 2003. She contacted AE&I through her sister in January, 2004 to get a loan in order to a start cassava paste selling activity. She took a $150 loan that helped her to launch her activities. She sells cooked cassava paste with sauce, a locally appreciated food. She wants to increase her volume of product as the number of her customers has increased.

loans.use: Yao Akissi will use loan to develop her cooked cassava paste selling activities

loans.name: Adriana

texts.en:
Adriana lives in Santa Catarina, Nuevo Leon. She is married but her husband Nicolas doesn't earn enough to support the family, so three years ago Adriana decided to augment their earnings by selling natural products. Her client base and sales have been growing day by day. Based on her experience in this business, Adriana knows that this is a good time to increase sales, so she is asking for a loan of $750 that she will use to purchase merchandise and meet client demand. Adriana and her family need your support. Please do not hesitate to help those who need it the most.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Alexis Hult

La señora Adriana vive en la localidad de Santa Catarina, en el estado de Nuevo León. Ella es casada, sin embargo, su esposo Nicolás no recibe el salario suficiente para obtener los recursos que necesita su familia, ante la necesidad de obtener un ingreso extra Adriana inició con su negocio de venta de productos naturales desde hace tres años, en el cual ha estado obteniendo mejores resultados y su clientela se incrementa día a día.

Con la experiencia que ha adquirido en el negocio, Adriana sabe que es una buena temporada para incrementar las ventas, razón por la cual solicita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 750 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes. Adriana y su familia necesitan de tu apoyo, hoy es tiempo de ayudar a quien mas lo necesita, no lo dudes más.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Maria Enriqueta

texts.en:
Maria Enriqueta is the single mother of one. She lives in Santa Catarina, Nuevo Leon, in northern Mexico. Her interest in sales and the need to earn money to pay for her son's schooling motivated her to start her own business 15 years ago selling clothing and shoes. She has had the good fortune of watching her business grow and she has earned a loyal customer base. Right now, Maria needs a $375 loan to buy merchandise and meet the demands of her customers. It hasn't been easy for Maria to raise her family alone, but with hard work she has succeeded. If you can help improve the lives of Maria and her son, they would very much appreciate your generous support.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Alexis Hult

La señora Maria Enriqueta tiene un hijo., es madres soltera y vive el la localidad de Santa Catarina, en el estado de Nuevo León, al norte de México. El gusto por las ventas y la necesidad de obtener un ingreso para el mantenimiento y la escuela de su hijo, la motivaron a iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de calzado y ropa desde hace 15 años, afortunadamente ha logrado hacer crecer su negocio y ha permanecido en el gusto de sus clientes durante todo este tiempo.

En estos momentos, Maria necesita de un crédito por $ 375 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, y continuar creciendo con su negocio. No ha sido fácil para Maria sacar adelante a su familia ella sola, pero con su esfuerzo lo ha logrado. Tú puedes mejora las condiciones de vida de esta familia, María y su hijo agradecen grandemente tu generosidad y apoyo.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Gricelda

texts.en:
Gricelda is married. To earn extra income and support her family, and because she enjoys sales, she began her own business selling shoes six years ago. Gricelda is hardworking and entrepreneurial. She is comfortable with people, something that has helped her win customers and stay in business. Right now she is looking for a $250 loan to buy the merchandise her customers want. She proposes to repay the loan in 3-6 months. The well-being of this family and the growth of the business is in your hands, so please do not hesitate to help.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Alexis Hult

La señora Gricelda es casada, la necesidad de obtener un ingreso extra para poder sacar adelante a su familia y el gusto por las ventas la incentivaron a iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de calzado, desde hace 6 años. Griselda es una mujer muy activa y emprendedora, su carácter le ha ayudado a sobresalir en su negocio por la facilidad que tiene de relacionarse con los demás, así es como durante este tiempo ha estado ganando clientes y ha logrado permanecer en el negocio.

En estos momentos ella necesita de un crédito por $ 250 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes y cubrir sus demandas, ella ofrece devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 3ª 6 meses. En tus manos está el bienestar de esta familia y el crecimiento de este negocio, no lo dudes más.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Julia Alejandra

texts.en:
Julia Alejandra is married and has one daughter. Her husband Francisco is a truck driver but he does not earn enough to support the family alone. Julia began selling clothing 20 years ago when she was very young and continued with her business after she was married to help support her family and raise and educate their daughter. Right now she needs a loan of $250 to buy merchandise and offer her customers a good product line. She proposes to repay the loan in 3-6 months. If you can help Julia grow her business, she and her family would sincerely appreciate it.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Alexis Hult

La señora Julia Alejandra esta casada y tiene una hija, Francisco, su esposo, trabaja conduciendo un trailer, sin embargo, su salario es muy poco para el sostén de su familia. Desde hace 20 años, Julia se dedica a la venta de ropa, inició este negocio desde muy joven y lo continuó después de que se casó para ayudar a la economía familiar, y poder ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su hija y una educaron de calidad, el esfuerzo y trabajo de Julia la ha ayudado a mantenerse durante tanto tiempo en el negocio..

Ahora Julia necesita de un crédito por $ 250 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía de esta temporada, para poder ofrecer una mayor variedad a sus clientes y mantener su preferencia, ella ofrece devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. Hoy tú puedes ayudarla a Julia para continuar creciendo con su negocio, se parte importante en la vida de esta familia, ellos agradecen sinceramente tu colaboración.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.en:
María Elena is married and has 4 children who are 26, 20, 19 and 8 years old. Her husband works as a bricklayer and his salary is low and varies, since there are some seasons when there is no construction. During these times, the family's income is reduced. For this reason, she has decided to help with the family's expenses by opening her own business, which she started when a friend invited her to sell beauty products. Her sales have gone well, and have been increasing, as well as her customers.

María Elena is requesting a loan for US$275 to purchase merchandise and to have a supply of products and be meet the demand she has had recently. María is offering to pay this loan in a period of 4 to 8 months and hopes for your support to continue growing her business.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva Volunteer.

María Elena esta casada y tiene 4 hijos de 26, 20, 19 y 8 años de edad, su esposo trabaja como albañil y su sueldo es bajo y variable, ya que hay temporadas en las que no hay obras y por ello no hay ingresos familiares, por ello ella decidió ayudar al gasto familiar abriendo su propio negocio, el cual lo comenzó cuando una amiga la invitó a vender productos de belleza y así ella comenzó con su negocio. Le ha ido bien y sus ventas se han incrementado y sus clientes también.

María Elena está solicitando un préstamo por US $ 275 para comprar mercadería y tener surtido sus productos, además de poder cumplir con los pedidos que ya tiene actualmente. María ofrece pagar este préstamo en un lapso de 4 a 8 meses y espera de tu apoyo para continuar creciendo con su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia is a widow and the mother of eight. She has been working hard since she was very young, dedicating her life to supporting her children. She started cooking snacks and selling them on the street and through the years her business grew and she set up a small area in her home where she serves her home cooking. With the help of her children she now caters banquets and prepares tamales that others sell on the weekends. Celia is asking for a loan of $275 to buy ingredients and meet the growing demand for her cooking. She proposes to repay the loan in 4-8 months and thanks you in advance for helping her give her 8 children a good education and better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Alexis Hult

Celia es una mujer viuda que se ha dedicado a trabajar desde muy joven, tiene 8 hijos por los cuales ha dedicado toda su vida para sacarlos adelante, ella empezó con su negocio vendiendo comidas y gorditas (comida típica) en la calle en un puesto semi fijo, pero con el paso de los años fue creciendo con su negocio y en su propia casa abrió un pequeño local para la venta de sus comidas, algunos de sus hijos la ayudan en su local y han crecido, ya que ahora ella ofrece sus comidas a terceros al por mayor para su venta y también ofrece el servicio de banquetes y tamales los fines de semana.

Celia esta solicitando un préstamo por US $ 275 para comprar suministros y así cumplir con la demanda creciente que esta teniendo, ofreciendo pagar este préstamo en un período de 4 a 8 meses y espera de tu apoyo para continuar creciendo y así poder darles una buena educación y mejor calidad de vida a sus 8 hijos.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a pensioner. Several years ago Maria decided to start her own business. She was working in a garment factory near her home and knew a lot about making clothing, so with some savings she opened a small seamstress shop, helping her husband support the family. In time, she gained customers and a good reputation for her work. Maria is asking for a loan of $275 to buy the materials she needs to fill orders, especially one she has right now to sew athletic uniforms for a kindergarden. She would be very grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Alexis Hult

María esta casada y tiene 4 hijos, su esposo es pensionado y por eso ya no trabaja solo recibe su pensión mensual, por ello María hace algunos años atrás decidió abrir su propio negocio. Ella trabajaba en una maquiladora de su localidad y fue ahí donde aprendió mucho sobre lo que es la confección de ropa y con lo que pudo ahorrar abrió su propio tallercito de costura para apoyar a su esposo en los gastos familiares, con el tiempo se ha ido haciendo conocida y se han incrementado sus clientes.

María esta solicitando un préstamo de US $ 275 para comprar mercadería para su negocio y así poder cumplir con los pedidos que ya tiene a la fecha sobre todo uno de confección de uniformes deportivos a un Kinder cerca de su colegio y por ello espera de tu apoyo y te lo agradece mucho.

loans.use: To buy materials.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is married. Her husband is a bricklayer and together they support their children. She works very hard to support her family. She used to work in a workshop that makes furniture but the pay was low, and her husband's income variable, so she decided to invest her small savings to buy clothing and cushions to sell, having her money work for her and gaining customers. Julia is requesting a loan of $275 to buy women's and children's clothing. She has chosen this customer base carefully based on experience, and proposes to repay the loan in 4 to 8 months. She hopes you will support her and thanks you in advance.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Alexis Hult

Julia esta casada y su esposo trabaja como albañil, ambos mantienen a sus hijos y por la necesidad económica fue que Julia tuvo que trabajar y como es una mujer muy trabajadora lo hizo; anteriormente trabaja en un taller de mueblería pero su salario era muy bajo y el de su esposo variable, entonces decidió invertir un pequeño ahorro en comprar ropa y colchas para venderlas, y así fue dando vueltas a su capital y fue teniendo más clientes, y salir adelante.

Julia esta solicitando un préstamo por US $ 275 para comprar ropa de dama y niños quienes son la mayoría de sus clientes y como ella fue seleccionando su mercado con la experiencia, ofreciendo pagar este préstamo en un período de 4 a 8 meses. Ella espera la apoyes y te esta muy agradecida por ello.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Sai

texts.en: Sai and her nephew who is in grade 8 live together as a family. They have 7,000m2 of planted cashew nut trees but their productivity is very low because she has no capital for fertilizer investment. Sai sells lottery tickets to earn money for her nephew who is going to school. Their income has increased by $6 per person per month. Sai wants to borrow a loan of $50 to buy more lottery tickets to sell (if she buys them in cash she can save 10-20 cents/day) and to buy fertilizer for her cashew nut trees.

loans.use: Sai would like to buy fertilizer for cashew nut trees.

loans.name: Be Be Khan Am

texts.en:
Be Be Khan Am is 44 years old and lives in a household of eight in District 15 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is an educated woman, and she wants to help her husband's business. He has a tire repair shop, and he also works part-time as a taxi driver. When Be Be Khan Am took her first loan, she used it to buy new machines for her husband's tire repair business and also made improvements on his car, which is used as a taxi. To improve the business and support the family, Be Be Khan Am wants to take anther loan for her husband. They will use the loan to expand his business and enlarge his shop. The profits will allow them to make a good future for their children, and they are happy that they can help their family.

**Note: the picture featured in this business profile is the husband of the entrepreneur. In Afghanistan, it is culturally unacceptable to post a picture of a woman to the internet; however, the loan is to the female entrepreneur.

loans.use: To buy new machines for her husband's tire repair business and improve the family's car/taxi

loans.name: Frozahn

texts.en:
Frozahn is 22 years old and lives in a household of ten in District 15 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is a tailor. She wants to work for herself because she doesn’t want to take money from her family.

She used her first loan to buy new machines for her business. She has a good business and has found a lot of clients. She wants to take another loan to make a shop in her house. To expand her business, she needs to buy furniture and another machine for her student. She hopes that she can take the loan, and she is thankful to AFSG for helping her improve her quality of life.

**Note: Frozahn's face is not visible because it is culturally inappropriate in Afghanistan to post a picture of a woman on the internet.

loans.use: To buy new machines, chairs, and tables

loans.name: Vahid

texts.en: Vahid O. is from the Aghsu region of Azerbaijan, where he currently lives with his wife and three children. He started selling agricultural food products, such as vegetables, about twenty years ago. He recently began selling his goods at the local bazaar. Vahid has requested a loan to expand his business in order to sell a wider variety of agricultural goods, such as fruits and other staple goods.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for resale

loans.name: Seyran

texts.en: Seyran Q. is from the Aghsu region of Azerbaijan where he currently lives with is wife and three children. He is 39 years old. Seyran started selling agricultural goods about 12 years ago from a remote location and currently is selling his products at the bazaar. His sales have greatly increased after receiving his first loan from Normicro last year. Seyran is currently requesting a loan to purchase more goods and to offer a more diverse variety of agricultural products.

loans.use: to purchase more goods

loans.name: Gulbas

texts.en: Gulbas M. is a native of the Aghsu region of Azerbaijan. She is a 52 year-old widow with two children. She has been in the business of selling fresh produce, such as parsley, spinach and radishes, at the local bazaar for over a decade. After receiving her first loan from Normicro last year, she was able to expand her sales. Gulbas is now requesting a loan to purchase more goods from her local agricultural suppliers in order to offer more fresh vegetables and fruits to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase more goods

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is married and has 5 children (eldest is 14 years, youngest is 4 months). They have a family business. Her husband has been working in their restaurant since he was 20 years old. Now he is 45. Besides this business, they produce cheese and ice cream.

She used her first loan to purchase the premises for their store at the local market. Now she leases it. She plans to use her next loan to extend their restaurant and establish a summer cafe.

In the future, Elena and her husband plan to sell the restaurant building.

loans.use: business expansion

loans.name: Nuybar

texts.en: Nuybar B. is a native of the Aghsu region of Azerbaijan. She currently lives in the city of Aghsu with her husband and two children. She has been selling agricultural products for the past ten years.  Her business has been slowly growing, she has gone from selling only potatoes and onions to providing a vast variety of goods. As the spring and summer seasons are coming, Nuybar is requesting a loan to purchase more seasonal goods, such as tomatoes and melons.  She also hopes toexpand her inventory of staple agricultural products.

loans.use: to purchase more agricultural products

loans.name: Rasim

texts.en: Rasim I. was born and raised in the Aghsu region of Azerbaijan, where he currently lives with his wife and three children. To help support his family, Rasim started using the family car as a taxi to transport people around the city and to local villages. After about eight years of use, the vehicle which he has come to rely on, needs maintenance and repair. Rasim is asking for a loan to make the necessary repairs on his taxi.

loans.use: to repair his taxi

loans.name: Khamis

texts.en: Khamis M. is a resident of the city of Aghsu in Azerbaijan. This 29 year-old man is married and is supporting his wife and two small children. He opened up a small booth at the local bazaar two years ago selling household items, such as flatware and kitchen utensils. After receiving a small loan from Normicro last year, he was able to double his business revenue. Khamis is now hoping to expand his business further in order to provide his customers with more products to meet all of their household needs.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for his shop

loans.name: Zeynal

texts.en: Zeynal N. is a native of the Aghsu region of Azerbaijan, where he is currently living with his wife and two children. Eight years ago he stared a small food market near the bazaar in the city of Aghsu and has watched it flourish. He sells dry goods, tea, carbonated beverages and snack candy, among other things. Zeynal is requesting a loan from Normicro to increase his product variety to include fresh products, such as fruit and vegetables, for purchase.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for his shop

loans.name: Ilham

texts.en: Ilham B. is a native resident of the Aghsu region of Azerbaijan. He is 45 years old and is married with one child. Six years ago, he started selling women's clothing and has since procured a booth at the local bazaar to sell his items. Ilham is requesting a loan from Normicro to purchase more inventory and expand the variety of women's clothing items available for customer purchase.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
This entrepreneur is an active women who is working hard for her business. She has worked since 2003. She wants to get a loan from Kiva and Al-Aman to buy a new sewing machine.Fatma is sigle female live with her Mother and her small sister she is only person who work in the home this is her first loan from MFI in Iraq she want to use the profit from her work to enhance her live stander and by some

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan. Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Habil

texts.en:
Habil A. was born and raised in the Aghsu region of Azerbaijan. He is the sole supporter of his wife and three children. He has been to some extent involved in the family business of tailoring and alterations for the past 20 years. Habil realized the need to expand his operations and has started working with leather to create belts in addition to making commissioned clothing items. 

Habil is requesting a loan from Normicro to purchase more raw materials and supplies for his shop in order to meet the growing demand of his customer base.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials and supplies

loans.name: Valeh

texts.en: Valeh Q. is a native resident of the Aghsu region of Azerbaijan. He is 40 years old and is married with four children. About six years ago, Valeh began using the family vehicle as a taxi service in order to support his family. He normally stays within the region of Aghsu transporting individuals around the city as well as to surrounding villages. Valeh is requesting a loan from Normicro to perform routine maintenance on his vehicle as well as to repair/rebuild his engine.

loans.use: to repair his taxi

loans.name: Gulbakhor

texts.en:
Gulbakhor started her business in the local market. She has over 15 years of experience in trade. First she had only a little table. After a loan, she rented a slightly bigger counter. Since working at an open-air market is not easy, she would like to rent a place in a store. Her current request for a loan will be used for renting a shop and increasing the assortment of her goods.

Gulbakhor is married and has 3 children (two girls and one son).

loans.use: business expansion

loans.name: Nilufar

texts.en:
Nilufar has been engaging in trading since she was 17 years old, so she has over 30 years of experience in trade. During these years, she tried different kinds of business activity. Currently she rents a big shop and she trades china, toys, perfumes, and sweets. She used her last loan to purchase a refrigerator. She plans to use her new loan to extend her selection of perfumes.

Nilufar has two children. Her girl is 26 years old, and her son is 32.

loans.use: Expand perfume selection

loans.name: Abduvali

texts.en:
Abduvali has run a carpenter shop for over 5 years. His elder son helps him, and he has two assistants. In the shop, they make window frames and doors. He used his first loan to purchase construction materials. He sells them in his own shop.
Abduvali has 4 children and 7 grandchildren. His elder son graduated the institute (faculty of physics) and another son still studies at the institute. Abduvali has been working to help all his children to graduate and support their families.

loans.use: carpenter, trading construction materials

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en:
Nargis is a young mother; she has two little children. Nargis runs a salon for brides. She gets dresses and accessories from Tashkent, which she sells or rents. She also provides hair-dressing services, especially for weddings.

Previously, Nargis rented a small room for her salon. After a loan received from Microinvest, she expanded her territory. Now she would like to diversify the dresses at her salon and add national Tajik dresses. She will purchase national Tajik fabric and order various party outfits from dressmakers.

loans.use: expand business

loans.name: Tujginoy

texts.en:
