The members of this group work in a local farm. Their salary is too small ($10 per month). They use their salary for firewood to heat their house in winter. To support their families, they have their own livestock and rent a piece of land on the farm. There they grow cotton and sell it to the government at a very low price.

All these ladies have families and children. For example, Tujginoy is 44 and has 4 children. One of the main dreams of any Countryman is establishing their own family, having a big wedding and kids. Tujginoy’s two children are married and the main source of income is her business. Their request is for purchasing hogs, to feed them and then to sell.

loans.use: livestock

loans.name: Alisher

texts.en:
Alisher is a farmer. He has been engaged in this activity for over 12 years. He has 5 cows, 5 sheep, 20 hens, and some turkeys. He used his last loan to purchase a cow and one hog. Recently one of his sheep bore twins. Now Alisher is requesting a loan for purchasing ducks. There is a big demand for ducks eggs in confectioner's stores. Chicken eggs are expensive and it takes twenty eggs to make one liter, and as for ducks it takes only 15 eggs for one liter.

Alisher has 3 children. He lives in a house with his parents and his brother, who also has a family. Now they save money for purchasing land and to construct a house for his brother.

loans.use: livestock

loans.name: Bakhrom

texts.en: Bakhrom has 5 children. His wife and two of his girls help him in their family café. They have been managing this business for over 10 years. Besides his family, Bakhrom has two assistants who work for him. In their café they cook national dishes. He would like to receive a loan to purchase a refrigerator for meat and soft drinks. Bakhrom is a handicapped person (his hand is broken) and he is from a poor family. He is a very hard-working man and tries the best to make a living for his family.

loans.use: business expansion

loans.name: Asia

texts.en: Asia  lives in the Lumo area of Dar es Salaam. She owns a vegetable and fruit stall where she sells different fruits and vegetables. She fetches some of the fresh produce like tomatoes and spinach from local farmers near her residence. She wants to increase the quantity of the stock to overcome shortages. She is also planning to have cases for product hygiene and attractive display. This will make her product offering more attractive and therefore increase sales. To fulfill these requirements, she is in need of USD 400 to subsidize her capital.

loans.use: To add stock of vegetables and fruits and to buy display case

loans.name: Halima

texts.en: Halima lives in the Lumo area of Dar es Salaam. She has over four years in the food vending business. Different from other food vendors who have permanent premises, Halima’s business is mobile. She produces food at home, packs the food, and distributes it to various customers she has, especially office workers. She plans to improve her business by adding sufficient numbers of food serving dishes, stock of food, and packaging materials. She also wants to employ an assistant to help her in business. Recently she has obtained orders to serve two more offices located at City Centre, so more working capital is needed. To facilitate her plan, Halima needs USD 550.

loans.use: To add stock of food items, serving dishes, and packaging materials

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius lives in the Lumo area of Dar es Salaam. He is married with two children. He owns a retail shop near his residence. The shop sells different consumable items, especially food items. Rice, maize, cassava, potatoes, and beans are staple foods in Tanzania. Julius plans to increase the stock of these items. There is an expectation of their price rising in the near future. Having enough stock now will help him make more money later. The extra stock demands more funding. Through his savings, he managed to contribute 20% of the required stock. The strategy will help him increase income, the aim being to sustain his family and pay for school fees for his children. To implement his plans, Julius needs USD 750 as working capital.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Selina

texts.en: Selina is married with four children. She lives on the outskirts of Dar es Salaam, in the place called Lumo. After finishing  primary education, she was married to a carpenter. Her parents could not afford her further education costs. After being married, Selina could not stand being a housewife alone. She started a cloth selling shop with the aim of generating income for the family, as her husband’s income was not sufficient to cover all family requirements, especially school fees for their children. It is now the fourth year since she started this business. She has experienced minimal improvements for all that period, due to competition she faces from nearby opened shops selling clothes. Selina has discovered unique competencies, usage of which can outperform her competitors. First is to have enough stock of frequently purchased clothes and second is to order new fashionable clothes that competitors could not order. These strategies need additional funding. She is in need of USD 750 to implement her plans.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Semeni

texts.en: Semeni is married and has four children. She lives in the Lumo area of Dar es Salaam. Semeni sells fried fish near her residence. She collects fresh fish from fishermen on the Indian Ocean shores, spices them, and fries them to be ready for sale. She wants to make her  business more profitable. Proper equipment for storage and fish treatment before sale will help her improve her business. The display case and aluminium wrapping materials will even make her business attractive and therefore profitable. The increased income will enable her to save for school fees for her children. To implement her plan, she needs USD 550.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator and water storage equipment for his dairy business

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 48 year old woman. She started a community training college to offer nursery teaching, computer, and counseling courses to 12 students. The college now has 40 students.

Florence is an innovative and hard-working woman who wishes to borrow funds to renovate the college buildings and purchase a printer. She has 10 years of experience in education. Her dream is to expand the capacity of the college and to publish books.

Florence has 5 children aged between twenty three and twelve. They are all at school.

loans.use: Renovation of a community college building and purchase of a printer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more groceries for his grocery shop business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase  a cow for his dairy farming business  and seeds for his farming business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a cow for her commercial dairy farming business

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy is 36 years old, married, and has 3 children between fourteen and two years old.

Prossy, partly the bread winner of the home, has been in the retail business for three years. She sells household commodities.

She wishes to borrow funds to increase her stock, which will eventually increase her income. She hopes to repay the loan in six installments.

loans.use: Expansion of business

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.en:
Madeleine A. is 42. She is married and has 4 children. She lives with her family in Yopougon, a township in the north of Abidjan.

Madeleine has sold cosmetic products since 2003 after she lost her position as secretary clerk in a government agency. Madeleine enjoyed her first loan from AE&I in February 2004 ($450), which helped her to build a container as a shop. Madeleine A. now wants to expand her activities in head dressing and would like to acquire a ladies hairdressing-table and helmet. With the revenue generated from her activities, Madeleine has strongly participated in the education of her children.

loans.use: Madeleine Ayeli will use the loan to buy a ladies hairdressing-table and helmet.

loans.name: Ange Laetitia

texts.en:
Ange Touré is a 35 year old woman with 3 children. She lives in Angré, near Abidjan, and has a children's garment store.

Touré opened her garment store in 2002 with a microcrédit of $400 from a microcrédit institution. She is very dynamic and has been able to expand her activities since then. Ange Touré joined AE&I in November 2004 and received different loans that she reimbursed in a very good manner.

Touré has won a tender to produce and deliver school garments to a Catholic primary school, but she does not have enough money to ensure production of these goods. This is a very good business opportunity for her that will help boost her activities.

loans.use: Ange Touré will use the loan to purchase a stock of primary school garments.

loans.name: Delfino

texts.en:
Delfino is a married man with two children, ages 10 and 7. He decided to start his own business due to the fact that he needed a better income. He initially partnered with a friend, but later went on his own and it has been six years since he owns his business. His wife helps him in the business as well as five other people which work with him. He sells rotisserie chicken, something very common in Mexico and other parts of the world and is enjoyed by many.

Delfino is asking for a loan in the amount of $1,100 for working capital, which he will utilize for maintaining and repairing the motorcycles that he uses to make deliveries, since many people order for delivery. Of course, he's eager to offer his clients the service that they are looking for. He pledges to repay the loan within 6 to 12 months and looks forward to your support in helping him grow his business. He thanks you in advance.

Translated from Spanish by Lighthouse Translations, Kiva Volunteer

Delfino es un hombre casado y tiene 2 hijos, uno de 10 años y otro de 7 años, él decidió poner su propio negocio a raíz de que necesitaba mayores ingresos, inicialmente se asocio con un amigo y posteriormente se independizo y ahora tiene su propio negocio desde ya 6 años, su esposa lo ayuda en el negocio y tiene 5 personas más que colaboran con Delfino. Su negocio es el de la venta de pollos asados, algo muy típico en México y muchas partes del mundo que tiene mucha gente que gusta de esta comida.

Delfino está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 1,100 para capital de trabajo, el cual lo utilizará en el mantenimiento y reparación de las motocicletas que tiene para el reparto a domicilio, ya que muchas personas prefieren ese servicio y el tiene que otorgarles el servicio que sus clientes desean, ofrece pagar este préstamo en un plazo de 6 a 12 meses y espera tu apoyo para poder crecer en su negocio, te lo agradece anticipadamente.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Alma Delia

texts.en:
Alma sells cosmetics, perfume and athletic shoes, both brand-name and local brand. She is married and has two children ages 10 and 12. Her husband makes molds at a foundry, but his salary is low. To help with the family's finances, Alma works very hard. In addition to her retail sales, she also does catering. She is asking for a loan of $1200 to buy merchandise and ingredients, proposing to repay the loan in 3 to 6 months. She has a lot of turnover in her business and many orders to fill. She thanks you for supporting her dream of helping her young children thrive.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer

Alma es una mujer casada que se dedica ala venta de cosméticos, perfumería, zapatos sport de marca y marca local, esta casada y su esposo trabaja como modelista en una fundidora, ambos tienen dos hijos de 10 y 12 años respectivamente; ella quería ayudar al sustento familiar y trabaja desde su propia casa, todo empezó por que su esposo tiene un sueldo muy bajo como para poder mantener a la familia y ella es muy trabajadora y decidió ayudar en la economía de su hogar, además de su negocio se da el tiempo para otro trabajo de cocina para banquetes.

Alma solicita un préstamo de US $ 1,200 para poder comprar mercadería para su negocio y suministros para sus comidas, ofrece pagar el préstamo en un período de 3 a 6 meses, ya que tiene una alta rotación de sus productos y muchos pedidos que tiene que cubrir, les agradece mucho su apoyo y soporte en sus sueños de sacar adelante a sus pequeños hijos, gracias.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.en:
Maria Guadalupe lives in Santa Catalina, Nuevo Leon. She is married and has one daughter. Her husband, Saturnino, works as a journeyman and his salary is not enough to meet the needs of the family. This is what motivated Maria to start a shoe business this year and, fortunately, it has prospered and the clients and orders have multiplied.

To meet the demand, Maria needs a loan in the amount of $250, which she will use to purchase merchandise in order to have a wider variety of inventory and be able to offer quality service. She pledges to repay the loan within three to six months. Maria and her family thank you for your generosity and support.

Translated from Spanish by Lighthouse Translations, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Maria Guadalupe vive en la localidad de Santa Catarina en el estado de Nuevo León, ella es casada y tiene una hija, Saturnino, su esposo trabaja como obrero, el salario que recibe es muy bajo y la necesidad de obtener un ingreso extra fue lo que impulsó a Maria a iniciar su negocio de venta de calzado desde hace un año, afortunadamente el negocio ha estado creciendo y se han multiplicado los clientes y los pedidos.

Para poder surtir la demanda de sus clientes, Maria necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 250 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para tener una mayor variedad y poder ofrecer un servicio de calidad, ella ofrece devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. Maria y su familia agradecen tu generosidad y apoyo.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Belem

texts.en:
Belem is very hard working. She really enjoys sales and interacting with others. These attributes have helped her a great deal in her business selling shoes. She works hard to improve every day and get ahead and demand for her products has been growing lately. To meet this demand, she needs would like to borrow $250 which she promises to repay in 3 to 6 months. You can play a key role in the growth of this business. Belem believes in those who help others in need and thanks you sincerely for any help you can give her.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Alexis Hult

La señora Belem es una mujer muy trabajadora y activa, a ella le gustan mucho las ventas, su carácter y la facilidad para relacionarse con las personas le han ayudado mucho con su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de calzado, y se esfuerza cada día por mejorar y superarse, últimamente la demanda por sus productos se ha incrementado por la entrada de la nueva temporada, y para poder surtir estos pedidos necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 250 dólares, que se compromete a devolver en un plazo de 3 a 6 meses.

Tú puedes ser parte fundamental en el crecimiento de este negocio, Belem confía en las personas que ayudan a quien más lo necesita y te agradece sinceramente cualquier ayuda que puedas ofrecerle.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
For 10 years, Alicia has put her taste and passion for good cooking into her business making traditional Mexican tamales. She started the business to support her family financially and give her children a good education. Little by little she has won customers and now she is asking for a loan of $250 to buy ingredients and meet the strong demand for her tamales. She wants to serve her customers well and continue growing her business, and if you can help her do this, she and her family will appreciate your generous support.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Alexis Hult

El gusto por la cocina y un delicioso sazón han mantenido durante 10 años el negocio de Alicia que se dedica a la venta de tamales, este es uno de los platillos tradicionales en México. Inició el negocio por la necesidad de apoyar económicamente a su familia y poder otorgarles una educación de calidad a sus hijos, pero poco a poco se fueron incrementado sus clientes y los pedidos.

Ahora Alicia necesita de un crédito por la cantidad de $ 250 dólares que utilizará en la compra de insumos que requiere para la elaboración de los tamales, para poder surtir un buen número de pedidos que ya tiene, ella quiere ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes y continuar creciendo con su negocio y tú puedes contribuir a que esto sea posible, ella y su familia agradecen tu generosidad y apoyo.

loans.use: To buy ingredients.

loans.name: Erika Lorena

texts.en:
EriKa is a single mom with a small daughter. The need to provide for her daughter motivated or to start her own business, since it would allow her time to spend with her daughter.

For this reason, Erica has been selling clothes for the past three years. It hasn't been easy for Erica to rear her daughter by herself, but her strength and love for her child has allowed her to do it and to have her own business which has provided her with income from the very beginning.

Now is the beginning of the new season and Erika needs a loan of $250 which she will use to purchase merchandise so she can offer a more diverse inventory to her clients and continue growing the business like she has until now. She pledges to repay this amount within three to six months. Be an important part of the growth of this business and help this family. They sincerely thank you for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Lighthouse Translations, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Erika es madre soltera de una pequeña hija, la necesidad de mantener a su hija la motivaron a iniciar su propio negocio, ya que este le permitía pasar tiempo con su hija y no descuidarla, por esta razón, desde hace tres años, Erika se dedica a la venta ropa. No ha sido fácil para Erika sacar adelante a su hija ella sola, pero el amor de madre y su fortaleza le han permitido hacerlo y tener un negocio que ha rendido frutos desde su inicio.

Por el inicio de la nueva temporada, Erika necesita de un crédito por $250 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder ofrecer más surtido a sus clientes y continuar creciendo como hasta ahora, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. Se parte importante en el crecimiento de este negocio y ayuda a esta familia, ellas agradecen sinceramente tu apoyo.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Mr. Felix Barbarosa is a had worker, and thanks to his Faith he started this business 10 years ago selling religious articles. He is an active man who strives every day to obtain the resources his family needs. When he started he had very little merchandise, but his business has grown and in order to increase sales he now goes to nearby small towns to offer his products, and that has produced good results. Important dates for the Church are coming and he knows that during this time his sales will increase, so that he requests a loan of $1,200 dollars to be used for the purchase of merchandise to supply the demands of his clients, offer good service and continue to grow his business. He pledges to repay the loan withing 3 to 6 months. This will be a fundamental part of the growth of his business. Felix will sincerely appreciate whatever help you can offer him.

Translated from Spanish by Dwight Davis, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Felix B. es muy trabajador y gracias a su gran fe inició desde hace 10 años su propio negocio con la venta de artículos religiosos, él es un hombre muy activo que se esfuerza día a día para obtener los recursos necesarios para el sostén de su familia, cuando empezó tenía muy poca mercancía, pero su negocio ha estado creciendo y para incrementar sus ventas sale a los poblados cercanos a ofrecer sus productos, y le ha dado resultados.

Se aproximan fechas importantes para la iglesia, y el sabe que en este tiempo se incrementan sus ventas, así que solicita un préstamo por $1,200 dólares que utilizará en la comprar de mercancía para poder surtir la demanda de sus clientes, ofrecer un buen servicio y continuar creciendo con su negocio, él se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. Forma parte fundamental en el crecimiento de este negocio, Feliz agradece sinceramente cualquier ayuda que puedas ofrecerle.

loans.use: Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Since her children started school, Mrs. Margarita decided to start selling shoes, since her husband's income is not enough for their home's expenses and for the children's shool. She didn't want to go out to work outside the home so as to be able to care for her family. With her work, Margarita contributes to family expenses and her children help her with sales of the shoes.

At this time, Margarita needs a loan of $375 which she will use to purchase merchandise to be able to meet her customers' demands, offer good service and maintain their choices. She is committed to repaying this amount within 4 to 8 months. Please decide to support her.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

A partir de que sus hijos entran a la escuela, la señora Margarita decide iniciar con la venta de zapatos, ya que el ingreso que sus esposo obtiene no es suficiente para los gastos del hogar y de la escuela de sus hijos, ella no quería salir a trabajar fuera de su casa para no descuidar a su familia. Con su trabajo Margarita contribuye al gasto familiar y sus hijos le apoyan en las venta y cobranza de calzado.

En estos momentos, Margarita necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 375 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para poder surtir los pedidos de sus clientes, ofrecer un buen servicio y mantener su preferencia, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en un lapso de 4 a 8 meses. No lo dudes más y decídete a apoyarla.

loans.use: Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Claudia Verónica

texts.en:
Mrs. Claudia is married and has three children who all attend school. Her husband is umemployed, and despite his ongoing job search, has been unable to find work, while the family debts have begun to augment. And so, to help her family, Claudia began to fabricate and to sell pinatas, her children help her as well, and little by little their production and their sales have increased.

At this moment in time, Claudia needs a loan of $375, which she will use to purchase the needed materials to construct pinatas. The well being of this family and the success of this business lie in your hands, and the family sincerely thanks you for your support and contribution.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor

La señora Claudia es casada y tiene tres hijos que actualmente están estudiando, su esposo quedó desempleado y a pesar de buscar incansablemente, le fue muy difícil encontrar un empleo, mientras tanto, las deudas de la familia comenzaron a incrementar y para ayudar con estos gastos Claudia empezó a elaborar y vender piñatas, sus hijos le ayudaba en el negocio y poco a poco empezaron a incrementar su producción y sus ventas.

En estos momentos Claudia necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 375 dólares que utilizará en la compra de los materiales necesarios para continuar con la elaboración de las piñatas y con su negocio. En tus manos esta en bienestar de esta familia y el crecimiento de este negocio, ellos agradecen sinceramente tu ayuda.

loans.use: To purchase raw material

loans.name: Silvia

texts.en:
Silvia is a single mother of six. Her partner was not there to support her and she has had to work very hard to provide food and education for children. She runs her own food service for construction workers, where she has realized the great need that they have for food. One of her daughters helps her and she has seen her business prosper.

At this time, Silvia needs a loan in the amount of $750, which she will use to purchase ingredients needed for food preparation. She pledges to repay this amount within 6 to 12 months. She sincerely thanks you for any help you can provide.

Translated from Spanish by Lighthouse Translations

La señora Silvia es madre soltera de seis hijos, ella no contó con el apoyo de su pareja por lo que ha tenido que trabajar muy duro para darles sostén y educación a sus hijos. Silvia tiene su propio negocio en el que vende comidas principalmente en las obras en construcción, donde se ha dado cuenta de la gran demanda de alimentos por parte de los albañiles y personas que laboran en estos lugares, con la ayuda de una de sus hijas ha visto crecer su negocio.

En estos momentos, Silvia necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $750 dólares que utilizará en la compra de los ingredientes que requiere en la elaboración de las comidas, ella ofrece devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses. Ella agradece sinceramente cualquier ayuda que puedas darle.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients.

loans.name: Maria De Jesús

texts.en:
Mrs Maria de Jesus has two children who both attend school, and she also has a pizza-business, which she began from a small stand, but little by little, her product became well known and the demand for her pizzas increased, and fortunately, her business expanded as well. Now, Maria depends on the help of 3 employees to run her store.

Maria's only goal is to further the education of her children, and she works every day with this in mind. At this time, she needs a loan of $925 which she will use to purchase ingredients she needs to be able to increase production and to continue to see her business grow, as she has seen up to this point. You can be a fundamental aide in the success of this busines and Maria and her children thank you immensely.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor

La señora Maria De Jesús tiene dos hijos que se encuentran estudiando, ella tiene un negocio donde elabora y vende pizzas, inició en un pequeño local, pero poco a poco se dio a conocer y se fue incrementando la demanda por sus productos, afortunadamente el negocio ha crecido y ahora Maria cuenta con la ayuda de tres personas que laboran en este lugar.

Maria sólo busca lo mejor para sus hijos y se esfuerza cada día por conseguirlo, ahora ella necesita de un préstamo por $ 925 dólares que utilizará en la compra de los ingredientes que requiere para poder incrementar su producción y seguir creciendo con su negocio como hasta ahora lo ha hecho. Se una parte fundamental en el crecimiento de este negocio, Maria y sus hijos agradecen sinceramente tu ayuda.

loans.use: To purchase supplies

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.en:
Mr. Gilberto is married and has one son who is 17 years old and studies electrical mechanics and he also has one small daughter who is 9 and attends elementary school. Gilberto is a school bus driver, but his salary is not enough to support his family as well as cover the costs of caring for his mother. Out of necessity to find additional income, he began to selling groceries and foodstuffs from his home, and with the help of his wife, has seen his business grow.

Unfortunately, his daughter became very sick and the hospital costs cut into the savings he had, which he was going to use to invest in the business. Now, she is doing better, but Gilberto needs a loan of $200 in order to buy supplies to stock his store and to allow it to continue to grow. He suggests repaying this loan in 5-10 months. You can help improve the life of this family, their well-being rests in your hands, and everyone thanks you greatly for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

El señor Gilberto es casado y tiene un hijo de 17 años que estudia electromecánica y una pequeña hija de 9 años que estudia la primaria. Gilberto trabaja como chofer en un autobús escolar, que pero el salario que obtiene no es suficiente para el sustento de su familia además que tiene que cubrir los gastos de su madre que esta a su cuidado. Por la necesidad de obtener un ingreso extra decidió iniciar la venta de abarrotes en su propio domicilio, y con la ayuda de su esposa este negocio ha estado creciendo.

Lamentablemente su hija enfermó y los gastos de la hospitalización le redujeron el capital que tenia disponible para invertir en su negocio, ahora ella se encuentra mejor, pero Gilberto necesita de un crédito por $ 200 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para surtir su negocio y continuar creciendo, él ofrece devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 5 a 10 meses. Tú puedes mejorar la vida de esta familia, en tus manos esta su bienestar, ellos agradecen sinceramente tu apoyo.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: José Luís

texts.en:
Jose Luis is originally from Monterrey, Nuevo Leon, in the northern part of Mexico. Because of a lack of resources, he lives with his girlfriend, unmarried, Juana, and they have two small children who are 3 and 1 years old. He had a job working as a baker in the commercial centers for 6 years, and thanks to the experience he adquired, had the skills to open his own business, where he makes and sells baked goods, in order to be able to support his family and to offer a better quality of life to his children.

Luis' business has grown and the demand for his product is always increasing. To meet demand, he needs a loan of $550 which he will use to buy an oven which will increase production and to offer a better service to his customers. He will also buy supplies he needs for the business. You can be a fundamental part of the continued sucess of this business and the life of this family, please do not hesitate in your decision to help this family.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

José Luís es originario de Monterrey, Nuevo León, al norte de México. Por falta de recursos, vive en unión libre con Juana, tienen dos pequeños hijos de 3 y 1 años. Él estuvo trabajando como panadero en centros comerciales durante 6 años, y gracias a la experiencia que adquirió, desde hace año y medio decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la elaboración y venta de donas, para obtener mejores recursos para el sustento de su familia y poder ofrecerle una mejor vida a sus hijos.

El negocio de Luís ha estado creciendo y cada ves se incrementa más la demanda, y para poder cubrirla necesita de un préstamo por $550 dólares que empleará en la compra de un horno de mayor capacidad con el que aumentará su producción y ofrecerá un mejor servicio, además de la compra de insumos que requiere para la elaboración de las donas. Tú puedes ser parte fundamental en el crecimiento de este negocio y en la vida esta familia, no lo dudes más y decídete a apoyarlos.

loans.use: To purchase a furnace and supplies

loans.name: Rebeca Verónica

texts.en:
Rebeca is married and has two children, ages 2 and 9. Her husband, Mario, is a house painter but his income is not sufficient to cover the family expenses. In light of this, Rebeca started 6 years ago to sell shoes via catalog to earn an extra income and help her family. She started with a little money she had saved, yet, little by little, she started to see results and now has many clients.

At this time, Rebeca needs a loan in the amount of $250, which she will use to purchase merchandise to fill her client’s orders and continue to offer good service. She pledges to repay this amount within three to six months. Now is the time to help those most in need. Make a decision to help Rebeca.

Translated from Spanish by Lighthouse Translations, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Rebeca es casada y tienen 2 hijos de 2 y 9 años, su esposo Mario es pintor residencial, pero el ingreso que obtiene no es suficiente para los gastos de la familia, por lo que desde hace seis años, Rebeca se dedica a la venta de zapatos por catalogo, para obtener un ingreso extra y poder ayudar a su familia. Inició con un poco de capital que tenia ahorrado pero poco a poco empezó a ver mejores resultados y ahora ya cuenta con muchos clientes.

En estos momentos Rebeca necesita un crédito por $ 250 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para surtir los pedidos de sus clientes y ofrecer un buen servicio, ella ofrece regresar esta cantidad en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. Hoy es momento de ayudar a quién más lo necesita, decídete a apoyar a Rebeca.

loans.use:
To purchase inventory

Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Norma Angélica

texts.en:
Norma Angelica is married and has two children, ages 11 and 18. Her family is originally from Monterrey, Nuevo Leon. Her husband is a welder, yet his salary is not sufficient to cover their living expenses and school for the children. Facing this challenge, Norma decided to start selling kitchen utensils and accessories five years ago and thanks to the payment options that she offers her clients, her clientele continues to grows everyday.

At this time, she needs a loan in the amount of $250, which she will use to purchase merchandise to meet the needs of her clients. She pledges to repay this amount within three to six months. You can be a fundamental part of the growth of this business and help improve the life of this family. They will sincerely appreciate your help.

Translated from Spanish by Lighthouse Translations, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Norma Angélica es casada y tiene dos hijos 11 y 18 años de edad, esta familia es originaria de Monterrey, Nuevo León. Su esposo tiene el oficio de soldador, sin embargo el salario que obtiene es insuficiente para todos los gastos del hogar y la escuela de sus hijos, ante esta necesidad Norma decidió iniciar con la venta de artículos de cocina desde hace cinco años, y gracias a las facilidades que otorga para los pagos, sus clientas se incrementan cada día.

En estos momentos necesita de un préstamo por $ 250 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. Tú puedes ser parte fundamental en el crecimiento de este negocio, y mejorar la vida de esta familia, ellos agradecen sinceramente tu ayuda.

loans.use:
To puchase inventory

Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Ramón Adrián

texts.en:
Ramon Adrian is married and has two small children. He works as a delivery person in a food store, but the need to obtain an extra income motivated him to start his own business. He runs a small convenience store with the help of his wife and children. He started six years ago from home and little by little has been preparing a store to improve the service that he is offering and continue growing the business. Ramon has fought hard to improve the living conditions of his family. He wants to offer his children a quality education and he works hard every day to achieve it.

He currently needs a loan in the amount of $475 which he will use to purchase merchandise in order to restock his store. Ramon and his family need your help and sincerely thank you for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Lighthouse Translations, Kiva Volunter

Ramón Adrián es casado y tiene dos pequeños hijos, él labora como repartidor en un negocio de comida pero la necesidad de obtener un ingreso extra lo motivó a iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de abarrotes en el que recibe la ayuda de su esposa e hijos. Empezó hace seis años en su propio domicilio y poco a poco ha ido acondicionando el lugar para mejorar el servicio que ofrece y continuar creciendo.

Ramón ha luchado mucho para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, él quiere ofrecerle a sus hijos una educación de calidad y se esfuerza cada día por lograrlo. Ahora requiere de un préstamo por $ 475 dólares que utilizará en la comprar de mercancía para tener un mejor surtido en su tienda. Ramón y su familia necesitan de tu ayuda y agradecen sinceramente tu apoyo.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a 44-year-old single mother of two children: a daughter who is 23 and a son who is 20. They are natives of the state of Yucatán. Faced with the need to provide her children with sustenance and education, Lourdes began selling clothing eight years ago. She would go to neighboring small towns on weekends to sell her goods. The business has done very well and her products are in high demand. She would now like to continue to grow.

At this time, Lourdes needs a loan of $475 to acquire the merchandise necessary for meeting the demands of her customers. It hasn’t been easy for Lourdes being the only source of income in her home, but the family has worked together to overcome every obstacle and move forward. Now you can be part of the growth of this business by helping her.

Translated from Spanish by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Lourdes tiene 44 años de edad y es madre soltera de dos hijos, y una mujer de 23 años y un varón de 20, ellos son originarios del estado de Yucatán. Ante la necesidad de darle sustento y educación a sus hijos, Lourdes inició con la venta de ropa hace ocho años, aprovechando su cercanía con pequeños poblados iba a vender los fines de semana y le fue muy bien en su negocio, sus productos tuvieron mucha aceptación de sus clientes y ahora quiere continuar creciendo.

En estos momentos Lourdes necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 475 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes. No ha sido fácil para Lourdes ser el único sostén de su hogar, pero con la unión de la familia han podido superar todos los obstáculos y salir adelante, ahora tu puedes ser parte del crecimiento de este negocio, decídete a ayudarla.

loans.use: Acquire merchandise

loans.name: Estrella Maribel

texts.en:
Estrella Maribel is a 42-year-old native of Mérida, Yucatán. She is unmarried but has a 6-year-old dependent son. When she lost her job, she needed a way to earn the money to support her child while still being able to care for him and give him the attention he needs. So she decided to start her own business selling clothing. She began selling at open-air markets in working-class neighborhoods two and a half years ago.

It hasn’t been easy for Estrella to work to support her child on her own, but her love as a mother and her energy have helped her go out day after day to work hard for her child’s well-being. She is now in need of a loan of $475 to acquire merchandise for the continued growth of her business. Estrella and her daughter sincerely appreciate your help and kindness.

Translated from Spanish by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Estrella Maribel tiene 42 años de edad, es originaria de Mérida, Yucatán, ella no está casada, pero tiene un hijo de 6 años que depende de ella. Al perder su empleo, tuvo la necesidad de obtener un ingreso que le permitiera sostener a su hijos sin que este le impidiera cuidarlo y darle el tiempo que necesita, decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de ropa, empezó vendiendo en los tianguis de las colonias populares hace dos años y medio.

No ha sido fácil para Estrella trabajar para sostener s su hijo ella sola, pero el amor de madre y su energía la han ayudado a salir día con día a trabajar arduamente en busca de bienestar para su hijo. Ahora ella necesita un préstamo por $ 475 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para continuar creciendo con su negocio. Estrella y su hija agradecen sinceramente tu ayuda y cariño.

loans.use: Acquire merchandise

loans.name: Diego Jorge

texts.en:
Diego is a 53-year-old native of Mérida, Yucatán. He is married and has four children: a son who is 27 and three daughters ages 25, 23, and 22. From an early age he has been active in business, a skill he learned from his dad. He left school at 15 to help him with his business. With much effort he was able to obtain a small storefront where he sells clothes and decorative framed art. His financial situation has prospered thanks to his dedication.

He is now in need of a loan of $925 for the repair and maintenance of his vehicle, an essential part of his business, for the transfer of merchandise and the delivery of large orders. Diego needs your help to continue working. He knows that with your support and his hard work he can take his business and his family further.

Translated from Spanish by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Diego tiene 53 años de edad, es originario de Mérida, Yucatán, esta casado y tiene cuatro hijos, un varón de 27 años, y 3 mujeres de 25, 23, y 22 años. Desde muy temprana edad, se dedica al comercio, ya que su papá le enseñó el oficio, abandonó sus estudios por ayudarle en su negocio desde que tenia 15 años, con mucho esfuerzo logró obtener un pequeño local donde vende ropa y cuadros decorativos, y ha visto prosperar su economía gracias a su dedicación.

Ahora necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 925 dólares que utilizará en la reparación y mantenimiento de su vehiculo que es de gran necesidad en su negocio para el traslado de la mercancía, y para repartir grandes pedidos. Diego necesita de tu ayuda para poder continuar trabajando, él sabe que con tu apoyo y su trabajo podrá sacar adelante su negocio y su familia.

loans.use: Repair and maintenance of vehicle engine

loans.name: Oralia

texts.en:
Oralia is a young entrepreneur with an enormous desire for self-improvement. She is the youngest of eight children. She completed her studies in design and worked only in temporary jobs. However, the need for income to cover expenses for herself and her parents, both of whom are retired, motivated her to start her own business. She has been offering web and graphic design services for a year.

At this time, Oralia needs a loan of $275 to acquire supplies for graphic design, as well as the purchase of design software that will allow her to perform higher-quality work in a shorter time. She promises to repay the loan within 3 to 6 months. You can be an important part of Oralia’s success. She appreciates your trust and support.

Translated from Spanish by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Oralia es una joven emprendedora con enormes deseos de superación, ella es la menor de ocho hijos y terminó su carrera de diseño y solo tenia trabajos temporales, pero la necesidad de obtener un ingreso para solventar los gastos de ella y de sus padres, que ambos son jubilados, la motivaron a iniciar su propio negocio en el que ofrece sus servicios de diseño, páginas web y serigrafía desde hace un año.

En estos momentos, Oralia requiere de un préstamo por $ 275 dólares que empleará en la compara de insumos de serigrafía y la compra de un software de diseño que le permita realizar un trabajo de mayor calidad y en menor tiempo, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. Tú puedes ser parte importante de los logros de Oralia, ella agradece tu confianza y apoyo.

loans.use: Acquire supplies for graphic design and design software

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.en:
Maria Guadalupe is young, hard-working and enthusiastic woman who not long ago completed her studies in primary education. She is currently working in a school but needs extra income to cover expenses for herself and her parents. She therefore decided to start her own business in which she rents computers for internet access. She has one employee who helps her attend to the business in the mornings. Soon she will be getting married and she would like the business, which she started a year ago, to generate enough income to meet the needs of her parents. In this way, Maria wants to show them her appreciation for the financial security and education that they worked so hard to provide her.

In order to grow her business, Maria needs a loan of $475 to purchase the equipment she needs to offer copy services and increase her sales. She promises to repay this amount within 3 to 6 months. Become an important part of the growth of this business and support Maria.

Translated from Spanish by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Guadalupe es una joven entusiasta y muy trabajadora, hace poco terminó su carrera como maestra de educación primaria, actualmente está trabajando en una escuela pero necesitaba un ingreso extra para poder solventar los gastos de ella y de sus padres, así que decidió iniciar su propio negocio donde renta computadoras para el uso del internet, tiene un empleado que le ayuda a atender el negocio por las mañanas. Pronto ella se casara y quiere que este negocio que inició hace un año pueda generar un ingreso que cubra las necesidades de sus padres, Maria quiere agradecerles de esta manera la seguridad económica y la educaron con tanto esfuerzo pudieron darle.

Para hacer crecer su negocio, Maria necesita un préstamo por $ 475 dólares que utilizará en la compra de un equipo para ofrecer servicio de copias e incrementar sus ventas, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. Se parte importante en el crecimiento de este negocio y decídete apoyar a Maria.

loans.use: Purchase a copy machine

loans.name: Maria Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is a young woman with big aspirations. She's the youngest of three siblings. Her parents are retired. The need to earn an income that would allow her to cover her expenses and those of her parents motivated her to save enough money from previous jobs so that she could open her own business selling clothes, shoes, and accessories. She started her business two years ago and it has been well received by her clients; with sales growing continuously.

Margarita wants to continue to grow her business and is asking for a loan of $250, which she will use to purchase merchandise to improve the variety of products that she carries and continue to be a favorite among her clients. You can be an important part of the growth of this business and help Margarita fulfill her dream.

Translated from Spanish by Lighthouse Translations, Kiva Volunteer

Margarita es una joven con grandes deseos de superación, ella es la menor de tres hermanos, sus padres son jubilados y la necesidad de obtener un ingreso que le permitiera cubrir los gastos propios y los de sus padres, la motivaron a ahorrar de sus anteriores trabajos para poder iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de ropa, calzado y accesorios, inició su negocio hace dos años y ha tenido grande aceptación de sus clientes, incrementando cada ves mas sus ventas.

Ahora Margarita quiere continuar creciendo y solicita un préstamo por $ 250 dólares que empleara en la compra de mercancía para incrementar la variedad de sus productos y conservar la preferencia de sus clientes. Tú puedes ser pieza fundamental en el crecimiento de este negocio y ayuda a Margarita a cumplir su sueño.

loans.use:
To purchase inventory

Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.en:
María del Carmen lives with her common-law spouse and has 4 children ages 22, 16, 12 and 9. She has been running her business for over a year and a half, and her husband works as a city employee. Initially she sold used clothing and tacos in the mornings. Later on, due to the location of her home she decided to put up a snack bar, in which she currently works. This allows her to help her husband cover the family’s expenses.

María del Carmen is seeking a loan of $475 to purchase hot-dog-making equipment and basic supplies for her business. She is offering to repay this loan within 4 to 8 months. She hopes for your collaboration, as it is a relatively new business and she sees a lot of potential in it. She therefore would like to invest in a machine and be able to move her business ahead. She very much appreciates your support.

Translated from Spanish by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

María del Carmen vive actualmente en unión libre con su pareja y tienen 4 hijos de 22, 16, 12 y 9 años respectivamente, ella lleva con su negocio más de año y medio y su esposo trabaja como empleado municipal. Inicialmente ella vendía ropa usada y tacos por las mañanas, luego por la ubicación de su domicilio optó por poner un puestito de snack y es a lo que se dedica actualmente y con esto ayuda a su esposo con los gastos de la familia.

María del Carmen esta solicitando un préstamo por US $ 475 para poder comprar equipo para elaborar hot dog y materia prima para su negocio, ofreciendo pagar este préstamo en un período de 4 a 8 meses. Espera tu colaboración ya que es un negocio relativamente nuevo y ella le ve mucho futuro por ello desea invertir en su maquina y así poder salir adelante con su negocio, te agradece mucho tu apoyo.

loans.use: Acquire supplies

loans.name: Test

texts.en: Check 1

loans.use: Check on Biz 10k

loans.name: Vann

texts.en:
Vann S. C., is 28 years old, married with one child, and living with her husband in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She typically earns $4 day working at the local garment factory. Her husband works with her at the same place and contributes all his wages to the household. Mrs. S. C.'s child is a student at the nearby school. This couple hopes to use part of the loan to purchase a simple motorcycle for their transportation, so that they don't have to pay the daily taxi fee to to work and use the remaining funds to repair the roof of their house, which currently leaks in the rainy season.

Someday Mrs. S. C. plans to purchase a grocery stand at the market and eventually build a new house to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her family's transportation and to repair her house

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is approaching Mifex in order to receive a second loan from the Kiva program. She has done well with the loan she received. She initially used the money to boost her inventory for the upcoming Christmas season. She was able to significantly increase her profits and she has put much of the money away in savings. Although she planned on opening a new point of sale with her first loan, she recognized the immediate opportunity to increase profits during the holiday season and she chose to postpone her plans.

Angela owns a shoe store in Guayaquil, Ecuador. She has owned her business for about 9 years. She started the business with her late husband who passed away several years ago. It was very difficult for her to continue on without her business and life partner, but she has endured through the hard times. She feels very proud to know that she has been able to succeed with the help of her daughter. She is requesting this loan because she wants to set up a new point of sale managed by her daughter. She hopes she can use the money to rent some space and invest in products.

loans.use: Try to set up a point of sale for her daughter to run

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en:
Ramona has had a small store in her home for about two years. She and her husband also travel around the local area offering their products to the public from a tricycle cart. They mainly sell eggs, cheese and ham, often serving as distributors to other small stores in the area.

Ramona is hoping that she can take out a loan to improve her profits. She will purchase more of her common products at better prices and much larger quantities. She hopes to eventually start delivering these products to all the small stores in the area.

Ramona is 28 years old and she has two daughters who are in school. Her husband is very supportive of her business and helps her invest with leftover income from his job. They hope they can make some improvements to their humble home in the near future.

loans.use: Invest in ham, eggs and cheeses

loans.name: Khadidja

texts.en: Khadidja was born in 1960 in Yenikand village in the Salyan region, Azerbaijan. She is married and has four children. She has been in this business for 10 years. She enjoys looking after chickens. With her previous loan of $500, she bought 50 hens. Now, she needs a loan of $1000 to buy 100 hens.

loans.use: To buy 100 hens

loans.name: Kan

texts.en:
Khan C. is a farmer who lives with her husband and 10 children in Kompong Cham Province, Cambodia. She works almost day and night in her farm growing crops, feeding domestic animals such as pigs, chickens, and ducks. Her husband is a village chief who is responsible for the finances in the household and typically makes around 10/day in revenue. Five of her children have their own families and live separately, yet the others are students and still living at home. Khan C., who is 45 years old, hopes to use the loan to purchase more extra animal's food to supplement her farm. 
In the future, Mrs. C. hopes to own another piece of land to extend her business and she would like to purchase more animals in order to make additional income. Her greatest hope is  to earn enough money to send her children to the local university.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed for her farm

loans.name: Ikram

texts.en: Ikram is 37 and lives in the Salyan region in Yenikand village. He is married and has three children. Thirteen years ago, Ikram set up his own business. He decided to breed cattle. This business allows him to support his family. He could not start his business with his own money, so he borrowed $500 to buy a pregnant cow. Now, he needs a loan of $1000 to buy ten sheep. He plans to breed cattle and sheep.

loans.use: To buy 10 sheep

loans.name: Dayanat

texts.en:
This young man is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region. He settled in the Salyan region in Khaladj village, and he is single.

Dayanat breeds sheep. He has had his own business since 2005. This 26-year-old man thinks about his future, and he wants to provide himself with a better future. He has a lot of plans. Now, he needs a loan of $600 to buy 10 sheep in order to improve his sheep-breeding business.

loans.use: To buy 10 sheep

loans.name: Farkhad

texts.en: Farkhad was born in 1960 in the Salyan region in Khaladj village. He is married and has three children. This kind man has had this business since 2002. In the beginning of his business, he borrowed  $400 and bought two small, meaty calves. He needs a loan of $1000 to buy 15 pregnant sheep.

loans.use: To buy 15 pregnant sheep

loans.name: Malali

texts.en:
Malali lives in district 15 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is educated. She graduated from school but then she married. Her husband does not allowing to work.

Her husband is a truck driver. He needs money and his wife wants to take a group loan for her husband so that he can buy supplies that he needs for has truck, like an engine and tires. He wants to establish a close relation with some construction companies so that he can expand his business and support his family.

Note: The picture featured in this business profile is the husband of the borrower. In Afghanistan, it is culturally unacceptable to many people to post a picture of a woman to the Internet. However, the loan is to the female entrepreneur. AFSG only makes loans to women.

loans.use: To buy new engine, tires

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Keo S. is 36 years old and lives with his wife and two young children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. He is self-employed as a mechanic and normally makes around $4/day in revenue. His wife earns $2.50/day by weaving clothes and selling them. This couple hopes to use the loan to purchase a weaving machine in order to facilitate their business and to repair their house. In order to improve his family's standard of living, S. hopes to expand his wife's business by purchasing more weaving machines and hiring some workers to help her. Eventually, he would like to invest in building houses to rent to the garment workers.

loans.use: To purchase a weaving machine and to repair his house

loans.name: Frozhan

texts.en:
Frozhan lives in district 15 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is an educated woman. She is widow. Her husband died of cancer 5 years ago. Her children are small she is the only one to support her family.

She has a bakery. She wants to take a loan to complete all the necessary things to expand her bakery and find more clients. This will help her provide for her family's education and solve their economic problems to solve. She is very happy now that she can support her family better by taking this loan .

loans.use: To enlarge her bakery

loans.name: Elshan

texts.en: This young man was born in 1982 in Khaladj village in the Salyan region. He is single. He has run this business for three years. He has a plot of land where he grows grapes. Elshan works very hard to get a rich harvest. He needs a loan of $1000 to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Qardaseli

texts.en:
Qardaseli N. Agazil ogli is a 50-year-old farmer living in the Saatli region. He is married and has four children. He previously bought two calves to expand his business with a loan from Agroinvest CU.  This loan helped him to improve his business and his family's living conditions.   
To further expand his business he is looking for a loan of $700 to buy another calf.

loans.use: To buy a calf and expand his business

loans.name: Oam

texts.en:
Aom C. N. is a pharmacist and lives with her husband in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She usually makes around $4.00 per day in revenue. Her husband is a security guard and contributes his entire salary to the household every month. C. N., in addition to her pharmacy, sells medicine and cooks to provide for her family. C. N. thoroughly enjoys her daily job, but still needs money to improve her business. N. hopes the loan will help her purchase a wider range of medicines to meet the great demand from her clients.

In the future, N. would like to own a simple clinic to provide all kinds of treatments to her patients, and if she can save enough money, she would like to build a new house for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional medicines for her pharmacy

loans.name: Adil

texts.en:
Adil A. Rza lives in the Saatli region of Azerbaijan. He is married with three children. Adil began breeding cows in 1996. He previously borrowed $700 from Agroinvest to purchase a calf, and extended his business.
Now he needs a loan of $750 to buy a milk cow.

loans.use: To buy a milk cow

loans.name: Hidayet

texts.en: Hidayet Orucov Tenhali ogli is from a Meskheti Turk refugee family that fled from Uzbekistan during the Soviet regime. He is 54 years old and is married, with children. Hidayet runs a small animal-breeding business. He is looking for a loan of $700 to buy a calf and expand his business.

loans.use: To buy a calf

loans.name: Sedri

texts.en: Sedri H. Aslan ogli is from the Saatli region of Azerbaijan. He is 52 years old and has seven children. To improve his living conditions, he started his animal breeding business in 1998. He wishes to expand his business and raise his standard of living. For this purpose he needs a loan of $600 from Agroinvest to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy a calf

loans.name: Meliksah

texts.en: S. Meliksah is from a refugee family who fled Uzbekistan during the Soviet regime. Melikshah is married, has children. He has a small animal breeding business and is looking for a $700 loan from Agroinvest to buy a milking cow in order to strengthen his business and increase his family's income.

loans.use: To buy a milk cow

loans.name: Khanam Gul

texts.en:
Khanam Gul lives in district 15 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She always wants to help her family to have a good business for and to be a good business dealer in the future.

She wants to take a group loan for her son who has a retail food business. He wants to buy extra materials like cigarettes, matches, baskets, bags of sweets and bars of chocolate. She is very happy that she can help her family. She would like to thank AFSG for supporting her.

loans.use: To buy matches, baskets, bags of sweets, bars of chocolate

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.en:
Hanifa lives in district 15 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is a home-maker and is an educated woman. She wants to help her husband who is a taxi driver. She wants to take a group loan so that her husband can get a new car. If he gets a new one he can work better than now and he can help his family more. He would like to thank his wife and also AFSG for helping him to expand his business and make a good income for their family.

Note: The picture featured in this business profile is the husband of the borrower. In Afghanistan, it is culturally unacceptable to some people to post a picture of a woman to the Internet. However, the loan is to the female. AFSG only makes loans to women.

loans.use: To get a new car

loans.name: Zia Jan

texts.en:
Zia Jan lives in district 15 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She has good work experience as a baker. She wants to help her family because her husband is mentally ill and her young son is in university and she wants him to complete his studies.

Because of this, she is working. She has a bakery in her house. She needs money and she wants to take a loan to expand her business and get treatment for her husband. She would like to thank AFSG because she can help her family now.

loans.use: To expand her bakery

loans.name: Ahamad

texts.en:
Ahamad lives in district 6 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He graduated from school and started working because he had financial problems at home and could not finish his studies.

He has an ice cream shop. He wants to take a loan to buy a new ice cream machine, to build furniture for his shop and buy other materials to improve his business. He hopes to support his family better and improve their life in the future. He is happy about the loan and he thanks AFSG.

loans.use: Buy ice cream machines and build furniture

loans.name: Virginia Teodora

texts.en:
Virginia Teodora has a seamstress business. She makes clothing for children, which she sells in the popular fairs of the city of El Alto. She does not have a husband, and she lives with her four children, ages 18,10,6, and 3 years, in a hous in the Rió Seco neighborhood of the city of El Alto. The income generated by this seamstress work allows her to support her family.

This loan will be used to buy an Overlock sewing machine, which will maximize her time and enable her to sew a larger quantity of outfits to sell, and in this way increase her income.

This is her third loan. Her good record permits her to request another credit, so that she can offer better living conditions to her four children.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mang

texts.en:
Mang works as a day laborer while his wife works as a farmer. They must support 6 family members and their youngest daughter has a problem with her heart. The government and neighbors helped them to build their house. Their income is about $12.50 per person per month.

Mang wants to borrow $75 to buy a cow to raise. They will pay back this money in a period of 7 months.

loans.use: Mang would like to buy a cow to raise.

loans.name: Sau

texts.en: Sau works as a day laborer and his wife plants vegetables to sell. They have two young children, and their income is $12.50 per person per month. They want to borrow $75 to buy one more cow to raise.

loans.use: Sau would like to buy a cow to raise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: cow husbandry

loans.name: Dan

texts.en: The father is blind and his daughter just work as a day laborer. They must provide food and school fees for 4 family’s members.Their per capita monthly income is low at $9, so they want to borrow $75 to buy a steer to raise  and they will pay back this money  during 7 months.

loans.use: cow husbandry

loans.name: Chau

texts.en: Chau works as a day laborer and plants rice. She has three children who are in school. Their income is low at only $9 per person per month. They want to borrow $75 to buy a cow to raise.

loans.use: Chau wants to buy a cow to raise.

loans.name: Thuan

texts.en: Thuan works as a day laborer and his wife works as a farmer. Their family has 4 members. Their income is low at only $10 per person per month. They want to borrow $75 to buy a cow.

loans.use: Thuan wants to buy a cow to raise.

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
This entrepreneur has a small shop in the south of Kirkuk in a poor area. He has worked in this shop since 2001. Until now, he was not able to develop his small shop. This is his first loan, and he wants to use it to buy an icebox to sell ice cream during the summer.

He has a big family; he supports his mother, father, wife, and five children. He wants to enhance his family's standard of living. He wishes to succeed in his work and develop himself to be the owner of a larger mini-market in the future.

Note: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, etc.).

loans.use: Buy a new icebox

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
This entrepreneur is young, active and has a great deal of experience in carpentry. He has had his shop in the north of Kirkuk since 1999, but he uses old machines in his work. This is his first application for a loan, which will be used to buy new machines for his small business.

He wants to develop his work and bring more customers. He dreams to be an owner of the shop that allows him to showcase what he makes with his carpentry. In his own words: "I think the future is waiting for me to be one of the first famous carpenters in Kirkuk."

Note: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, etc.).

loans.use: Buying new carpenter machine

loans.name: Zachariah

texts.en: Zachariah is married with seven children, all of whom are in school.  He started his business seven years ago.  He makes kitchen utensils using melted aluminium.  He started the business while in Sudan, then moved to Kampala, and finally settled in Malaba. In Malaba, he has trained almost everyone who is interested, and the business is booming.  With a loan from PEMCI, he plans to increase his stocks of raw materials to enable him to expand his production of utensils and other household goods. His long term plan is to grow into a mini factory producing an assorted range of aluminum goods. Through his business, he has been able to employ ten people, and educate his children. His wife is also engaged in the business. He has also brought the aluminum smelting skills to the people of Malaba. Through him, many have opened similar facilities. He is, therefore, a role model and a reference point in the business.

loans.use: To Buy Stocks of Scrap Metals

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
This entrepreneur has a small shop that sells mobile devices. He got married six months ago and feels he has a big responsibility to his family. Therefore he needs to develop his shop and increase his income through this business. This loan is his first experience with Microfinance.

In his own words, "I feel I will be able to get a loan, pay it back...and increase my income." He wants to be a competitor in the area and be the first mobile shop buying and bringing new and modern types of mobile devices.

Note: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, etc.).

loans.use: Buying new kinds of mobile devices and developing the shop

loans.name: Phong

texts.en: Phong and his wife work as day laborers and they have three children. Their oldest daughter is a teacher and two of their children are in school. Their income is only $12.50 per person per month. They want to borrow $75 to buy a cow.

loans.use: Phong would like to buy a cow to raise.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a mother of three, all of whom are in secondary school.  She is a retired teacher.  She started her business in 2002 after retiring.  She bought the posho mill with her benefits.  She is also a fish monger.  Her fish stall is just next to her posho mill.  She is the chairlady of her local church’s women's organization.  She also participates in the countrywide illiteracy eradication programme where she teaches elderly illiterate women of the area. This is her second loan with PEMCI, but her first with Kiva. The first loan enabled her increase her stock, and with the second loan she intends to grow her fish business. She plans to buy fish in bulk directly from the fishermen. Through her business, she has been able to contribute to her church organization.  She has also brought milling services to the area as the locals used to go far to get the service.  She has brought development in general to the community. She is well worthy of Kiva partners' support.

loans.use: Buy Stocks of Corn and other cereals for Milling and sell to local institutions

loans.name: Phuoc

texts.en: Phuoc and his wife have 3000m2 land for rice and 150 green dragon plants. But this year they got a poor rice harvest because of insects. Their two oldest children left high school  to help their parents. The mother works as a day laborer earns $187.50 per year. And they get about $500 per year from planting green dragon. They want to borrow $75 to add to their capital to raise a calf to save money for their daughter‘s heart operation.

loans.use: Phuoc would like to buy a cow to raise money for his daughter's heart surgery.

loans.name: Nhan

texts.en: Nhan and her mother work as farmers and also as day laborers to get more money to support their family with the hope of having a better future. They want to borrow $75 to buy a cow to save for their chidren’s school and they will pay it back during 10 months.

loans.use: Nhan would like to buy a cow to save money to send her children to school.

loans.name: Teo

texts.en: Teo and his wife have 5,500m2 land to live on and have put 300 pillars in to grow green dragon & peanut trees. Teo's wife works hard as a farmer, she plants peanut trees and raises ducks. They hope their children continue their school. They want to borrow $75 to invest in their farm to buy more green dragon to get more income. They will pay it back within 10 months.

loans.use: Teo wants to invest more in his green dragon and peanut tree farm so he can send his children to school.

loans.name: Metrine

texts.en: Metrine is married with two children who are both in primary school. She is a trained hair dresser. She started her business in 2004 in order to supplement her earnings. Through her business, she has been able to support her family financially. Her husband is not employed. She is an active member of the community’s HIV/AIDS education group. With the loan of $150 from PEMCI, Metrine wishes to increase her stock of cereals and groceries to enable her to earn higher profits. Through her business, she has been able to provide for her family and also the community as a whole through her contributions in the HIV group.

loans.use: Boost Cereals trading and Grocery Business

loans.name: Lai

texts.en: Lai's husband died and she must work hard to support her family. She wants a loan of $75 to raise a cow to get more income for her family. She will pay back it during 7 months.

loans.use: Lai wants to buy a cow to support her family since her husband died.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a member of the Esenyi women's group. This group is composed mainly of people living with the HIV/AIDs virus. PEMCI has a non-discriminative policy, and we encourage people living with the virus to become economically active members of their community, and to be self-empowered. Esenyi is part of a different group forming a C.B.O that is fighting AIDS in the division. Beatrice is married with eleven children. She started her business in 1999. With the first loan from PEMCI, she was able to uplift her business and built herself a small shelter where she now lives. With this 2nd loan (her 1st with Kiva) she plans to expand her stock of fish in order to improve her income. From selling fish, Beatrice is able to offer diversity in nutrition to the vulnerable members of her community, especially those living with HIV/Aids. She is also a good role model of living positively.

loans.use: Boost her Fish monger/ Hotel Business

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is married with three children who are all in primary school.  He started his business in 1999 in order to sustain his family. He hasn’t undertaken any training.  He is an active member of his church’s self help group that deals with poverty eradication. With a loan from PEMCI, he intends to equip his barber shop and be able to provide employment to one or two people. Through his business, he has been able to care for his family and make contributions to the self help group. In view of the unemployment shortage prevailing, such endeavors should be encouraged, especially for the youth. Paul is well worth the support.

loans.use: Buy Tools for Barber Shop

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is a family man with six children who are all in primary school. He is the treasurer of a local group in the Jairos area. George has not undergone any form of training but is a shrewd and smart businessperson. He has repaid two previous loans with PEMCI in a timely manner. He started trading in cattle, goats and sheep in 1996 as a way of making ends meet, and with time has been able to support his family. With the proposed  additional loan of $300, he plans to increase his stock of animals to trade so as to increase his turnover and income. With additional funds, he will be able able to visit more market places in a week without having to wait until he has sold off the old stock. With less pressure for cash, he is also able to hold his animals and only sell when prices are good. Hence, the performance of his business is expected to improve with additional liquidity. With the income he generates, he is able to educate his children and take care of their needs. He has proven to be a good client and we highly recommend him for funding.

loans.use: Boost his Livestock Trading Business

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos “Chamo” V. has a farm where he grows rice, hay and cattle. He lives with his wife, Cecilia, and his four children. His oldest son works with him on the farm to grow their products, while the other three still go to school. He is a native of Salitre and has been raised in agriculture his entire life. He also has a small butcher shop in the small town of Salitre. He hopes that with this loan he will be able to invest in feed for his cattle and possibly buy some more steers. With the profits he will continue to educate his kids and feed his family.

He is the latest addition to one of the new Communal Banks in the Mifex Rural Finance Program. All of the members of the 10 de enero Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers in Salitre named 10 de enero. They will use the microloans to prepare the lands and cultivate rice on their farms. Because they form part of a communal bank, they are all each others guarantors for the loan. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the 10 de enero Association are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many microfinance programs, but is imperative for the communities Mifex works with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Loan Use and Repayment

The loans in this sector will be used to create water deposits that will prevent flooding in the case of heavy rains or store water in case of droughts. They will also be used to treat the land prior to farming, to plant the seeds and purchase fertilizer. The loan repayment schedule is also different from the typical microentrepreneur. Because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures, Mifex asks them only to pay 50% of the capital in the first 5 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the sixth and final month.

Below is more information about Salitre compiled by the staff at Mifex when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program.

Economy of Salitre

Salitre is a rural sector in the Province of Guayas known as the capital of Montuvios (montuvio is a cowboy) with approximately 30,000 inhabitants. The main economic activities are herding and agriculture which make up about 80% of the economy. The infrastructure and basic services are poor, especially the roads and water services.

Salitre is highly dedicated to farming rice and cattle ranching. Rice is a crop that yields about every four months. In order to farm rice, the environment must be very humid and there must be a high volume of water. The lack of a structured water system makes it difficult for the small farmers to be highly productive. The best months for cultivating rice are early in the year when it is the rainy season in the coast of Ecuador.

Salitre is a national tourist attraction as many Ecuadorians visit the fresh water Salitre River. There are cottages, small restaurants and water attractions that people come to enjoy.

Access to Credit

There are not many financial institutions that provides services to the productive sector of the local economy. The primary access to credit comes from loan sharks who charge extremely high interest rates averaging around 20% a month. The locals are also exploited by the intermediaries that buy their products in order to commercialize them in the city and to export abroad. These intermediaries buy crops in advance at very low prices, finance soil at extremely high prices and often provide emergency loans for even higher interest rates than the loan sharks.

Risks

Salitre is a dangerous sector considering it is in the rural area. There is a high incidence of robbery of cattle that results in many of the ranch owners owning weapons to protect their property. Because the police are not present in these areas, farmers and ranchers must apply their own laws and provide their own security. In some instances they have formed their own cooperatives and associations to have a community crime prevention effort.

Salitre is in the lowlands of Ecuador and is vulnerable to flooding in the rainy season. In the event of a heavy rainy season, often at its worse when El Niño occurs, the farmers of rice lose many of their crops. All this is due to a lack of infrastructure in the area.

loans.use: Farm Rice

loans.name: Miguel

texts.en:
Miguel is a farmer in the sector of Salitre. On his farm he cultivates rice and soy beans while also raising cattle. He and his wife work very diligently on the farm in order to feed their two kids who are 8 and 13 years old. His wife also makes cheese and sells milk produced from their cows. Primarily though, they sustain their family with their rice production as most people from the area do. They hope to invest in fertilizer and seeds in order to increase their crop output.

Miguel is the latest addition to one of the new Communal Banks in the Mifex Rural Finance Program. All of the members of the 10 de enero Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers in Salitre named 10 de enero.
