They will use the microloans to prepare the lands and cultivate rice on their farms. Because they form part of a communal bank, they are all each others guarantors for the loan. loans.name: Aracely

texts.en:
Aracely is a native of Salitre where she has been farming rice her entire life. She has a small farm where she farms the crop and she also a couple of cattle. Aracely lives with her husband and three children who are in school. She will invest her money in pesticides and feed for her cattle. With the extra profits she hopes she can purchase a cow and continue to provide her kids with an eduction.

She is the latest addition to one of the new Communal Banks in the Mifex Rural Finance Program. All of the members of the 10 de enero Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers in Salitre named 10 de enero. They will use the microloans to prepare the lands and cultivate rice on their farms. Because they form part of a communal bank, they are all each others guarantors for the loan. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the 10 de enero Association are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many microfinance programs, but is imperative for the communities Mifex works with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Loan Use and Repayment

The loans in this sector will be used to create water deposits that will prevent flooding in the case of heavy rains or store water in case of droughts. They will also be used to treat the land prior to farming, to plant the seeds and purchase fertilizer. The loan repayment schedule is also different from the typical microentrepreneur. Because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures, Mifex asks them only to pay 50% of the capital in the first 5 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the sixth and final month.

The lack of a structured water system makes it difficult for the small farmers to be highly productive. The best months for cultivating rice are early in the year when it is the rainy season in the coast of Ecuador.

Salitre is a national tourist attraction as many Ecuadorians visit the fresh water Salitre River. There are cottages, small restaurants and water attractions that people come to enjoy.

There are not many financial institutions that provides services to the productive sector of the local economy. The other two help him out with his cattle ranching and farming.

loans.name: Lay

texts.en:
Lay C. is 33 years old. She lives with her husband and two children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. Lay operates a business as a taxi driver with her husband and typically makes around $15.00 per day in revenue. Both of her children are students and assist their parents in cooking meals when they are not in class.

This couple will use the loan to help purchase two more taxis to continue their business. With the additional income, they hope to send their children to a university.

loans.use: To purchase a taxi for business

payments.comment: Congratulations! Lay Chanthy paid back her loan early!

loans.name: Yim

texts.en:
Yim S. is 42 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. One child is at home and one is in school. Yim makes her living by weaving clothes and selling them to retailers, and earns around $2.50 per day. Her husband is a body guard and contributes his entire salary to the household every month.

S. hopes to use this loan to create more clothes, which are in great demand from her clients. She will use her earnings to repair her home, which was damaged during the rainy season. In the future, she hopes to save enough money to buy a weaving machine to facilitate her business and to build a new house for her family.

loans.use: To purchase clothes and to repair their home

loans.name: Phy

texts.en:
Phy N. is a 42-year-old widow and lives with her son in Phnom Pehn, Cambodia. Phy is a very hard-working mother who is struggling to feed her family. She earns  money by selling tradditional Khmer cakes such as Num bot, Num Ansorm, and Num Korm. Her husband passed away many years ago and since then, she has been responsible for all the expenses in the family. her son helps his mother by doing construction work, making about $5/day. Phy N. hopes the loan will allow her to purchase some construction tools and new cooking utensils for her business. 
In the future, she would like to open a grocery store and build a concrete house for her small family.

loans.use: To buy some utensils and construction tools for a business

payments.comment: Congratulations to Phy Na for repaying the Kiva loan early!

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok S., a 57-year-old widow, has four children and lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She works hard to maintain her farm and raises a few pigs to supplement her income. Because she makes little money from her farm, one of her daughters helps with the household budget by working at the local garment factory.  Her other three children are students. Sok hopes the loan will assist her in repairing the house and purchasing some farming tools to work in her field. She hopes she will have enough money to build a concrete house one day.

loans.use: To repair her house and to buy farming tools

loans.name: Maximiliano

texts.en:
Maximiliano has been living on his ranch for over thirty years. There he has been able to cultivate rice and raise cattle in order to support his family. He has two sons who help him on the farm. One is 17 years old, and the other is 16. He also has a young 7-year-old daughter who is going to school. He and his wife hope to make the necessary investments in rice that will ensure that the crop goes well, such as fertilizer and pesticides. With this crop cycle's extra profits, they hope to save enough money to make some improvements to their home. He is pictured with Esther from the Mifex staff.

Max is the latest addition to one of the new Communal Banks in the Mifex Rural Finance Program. The loans will also be used to treat the land prior to farming, to plant the seeds and purchase fertilizer. The loan repayment schedule is also different from the typical microentrepreneur. Because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures, Mifex asks them only to pay 50% of the capital in the first 5 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the sixth and final month.

Below is more information about Salitre compiled by the staff at Mifex when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program.

Economy of Salitre

Salitre is a rural sector in the Province of Guayas known as the capital of Montuvios (montuvio is a cowboy) with approximately 30,000 inhabitants. The main economic activities are herding and agriculture which make up about 80% of the economy. The infrastructure and basic services are poor, especially the roads and water services.

Salitre is highly dedicated to farming rice and cattle ranching. Rice is a crop that yields about every four months. In order to farm rice, the environment must be very humid and there must be a high volume of water. The lack of a structured water system makes it difficult for the small farmers to be highly productive. The best months for cultivating rice are early in the year when it is the rainy season in the coast of Ecuador.

Salitre is a national tourist attraction as many Ecuadorians visit the freshwater Salitre River. There are cottages, small restaurants and water attractions that people come to enjoy.

Access to Credit

There are not many financial institutions that provide services to the productive sector of the local economy. The primary access to credit comes from loan sharks who charge extremely high interest rates averaging around 20% a month. The locals are also exploited by the intermediaries that buy their products in order to commercialize them in the city and to export abroad. These intermediaries buy crops in advance at very low prices, finance soil at extremely high prices and often provide emergency loans for even higher interest rates than the loan sharks.

Risks

Salitre is a dangerous sector considering it is in a rural area. There is a high incidence of robbery of cattle that results in many of the ranch owners owning weapons to protect their property. Because the police are not present in these areas, farmers and ranchers must apply their own laws and provide their own security. In some instances they have formed their own cooperatives and associations to have a community crime prevention effort.

Salitre is in the lowlands of Ecuador and is vulnerable to flooding in the rainy season. In the event of a heavy rainy season, often at its worse when El Niño occurs, the farmers of rice lose many of their crops. All this is due to a lack of infrastructure in the area.

loans.use: Purchase pesticides and fertilizer for rice farming

loans.name: Mohammad Qasam

texts.en: Mohammad Qasam lives in district 6 of Kabul ,Afghanistan. He is uneducated but he has good working experience. He was very small when he started carpet weaving and he has  lots of students. He wants to take a individual loan to expand his business and buy 3 more looms and the other materials necessary for weaving. He hopes that he can further this business and he can compete with other carpet weavers and export carpets to other places. He wants to thank AFSG for helping him.

loans.use: To buy 3 carpet weaving machines and other materials

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel has been living on his farm his entire life. He not only inherited his lands from his father, but he also inherited the knowledge of how to grow rice from him. He lives in his home with his wife and one of his children. He also has three sons who live separately, but help him work his lands. He will use the loan to fix his lands for farming. He will also buy fertilizer and seeds for his farm. In the future, he wants to invest in pigs and chickens.

Samuel is the latest addition to one of the new Communal Banks in the Mifex Rural Finance Program. All of the members of the 10 de enero Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers in Salitre named 10 de enero. They will use the microloans to prepare the lands and cultivate rice on their farms. Because they form part of a communal bank, they are all each others' guarantors for the loan. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the 10 de enero Association are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many microfinance programs, but is imperative for the communities Mifex works with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Loan Use and Repayment

The loans in this sector will be used to create water basins that will prevent flooding in the case of heavy rains or store water in case of droughts. Because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures, Mifex asks them only to pay 50% of the capital in the first 5 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the sixth and final month.

loans.name: Maki

texts.en:
Maki is 44 years old lives in district 1 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is a tailor and lives with her brothers. She is divorced and she doesn’t want to her brothers help her. She wants to just help herself.

She took her 4th group loan cycle and bought sewing machines, a desk and a chair for herself. She wants to expand her business and she wants to take anther loan to rent and redecorate a shop and buy other machines.

loans.use: To buy new machines and rent a shop

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
This entrepreneur has a private hairdressing business in Kirkuk. She lives with her family in the poorest area in Kirkuk. She works hard to bring in income to support her brother who is disabled. She is the only worker in her home.

This loan is her first loan from a Microfinance Institution. She want to bring more equipment and hire a women to work with her in the business. She is 36 years old and is single. Kadeja says she is very interested in getting a loan to develop herself and raise her income.

Note: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, etc.).

loans.use: Development, and to hire women to work

loans.name: Nahida

texts.en: Nahida is 38 years old and lives in district 1 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is a tailor and lives with all the members of her family. She wants to support her husband and she took her 4th cycle group loan and opened a shop for her daughters who are also tailors. They want to support their family. Now she wants to take anther loan to buy some new machines to expand her business. She is happy because she has the chance to improve her family's future.

loans.use: To buy new machines and rent a shop for her daughters

loans.name: Soeun

texts.en: Soeun R. is a 37-year-old mother of five living with her husband in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She and her husband (pictured here) make their living by cultivating, plowing, and growing crops in the field and earn about $6 per day. This couple works veR. hard day and night in order to make enough income to support the whole family. One of their daughters is a garment worker, one works on the farm with her parents, and the rest of the children are students. Soeun hopes to use the loan to purchase a cow to help her work in the farm.  In the future, she hopes to purchase more cows and grow a variety of crops as well as send her children to the local university.

loans.use: To buy a cow to work in the farm

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
Ernesto is a cattle rancher from Salitre. He wants to invest the money he receives from the loan in pesticides for rice and raising pigs. He commercializes the rice and pigs himself by traveling and selling to the nearby city of Milagro. He has one son who is in school. He wants to buy a truck in the future with the extra money he makes. He also hopes he can continue to provide an education for his 15 year old son.

He is the latest addition to one of the new Communal Banks in the Mifex Rural Finance Program. All of the members of the 10 de enero Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers in Salitre named 10 de enero. loans.name: Fazila

texts.en: Fazila is 47 years old. She lives in district 1 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is an uneducated woman and her husband died during the war in Kabul. She took her 4th group loan cycle and opened a gas shop for her son. He makes a good income for his family and his mother is very happy. She wants to take anther loan to buy extra gas canisters  and expand her son's business. She would like to thank AFSG.

loans.use: To buy extra canisters of gas

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
This enterpreneur is a carpenter with a small business in Kirkuk. He works with three employees, and make chairs for sale in the shops. The entrepreneur is 39 years old and has a big family. He is responsible for the care of his old parents and the rent of his house.

He wants to get $1000 to buy a new carpentering machine and hire three additional laborers to work with him on this new machine. He is looking to obtain more loans in the future to develop himself and increase his income.

Note: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture,, etc.).

loans.use: To buy new carpentry machinery

loans.name: Phan

texts.en: Phan S., a 47-year-old woman, has four children and lives with her husband in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. One of her children is a garment worker, another one is a chef in a small nearby restaurant, and the rest are students. Phan makes her living by growing a wide range of crops and raising animals in the field. She and her husband normally earn around $5 per day by selling crops and animals. In order to make additional income and to satisfy greater demand from the market, this couple must grow more crops and raise more animals on their farm. Phan hopes to use the loan to purchase a piece of land to grow more crops and to raise more pigs. In the future, if she has enough money, she would like to buy a car for her husband to run a taxi business and to build a concrete house for her family.

loans.use: To purchase a piece of land to grow more crops

payments.comment:
Thanks to the successful of her business that is why she can pay off the loan a head of time.
She would like to say thank deeply from her heart to all lenders.

loans.name: Ouk

texts.en: Ouk S., a 40-year-old mother of two children, lives with her husband in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She works in a farm with her husband growing and cultivating variety of crops and feeding domestic animals such as pigs, ducks, and chickens. This couple usually makes about $3 per day in revenue. One of her children works at a nearby garment factory, and another is a construction worker. They nomally contribute all their wages to the household every month. S. hopes the loan will help her purchase more seeds for her plantation and to repair her house from leaking during the rainy season.  In the future, Savoeu hopes to buy more animals to raise and to make additional income from her plantation.

loans.use: To buy seeds and to repair her house

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
This entrepreneur is a young man who owns a small computer and CD shop in Kirkuk. Two months ago, terrorists attacked his shop, and it was totally burned to the ground.

He wants to get back to work with the help of a loan from Al-Aman. He has two adorable children and he wants to send them to school. His son is 7 years old and his daughter is 5 years old. Al-Aman is very focused on helping this business, and wants to get the entrepreneur back to work. The Al-Amam staff is excited to see him get back to work and make money while paying back the loan.

Note: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, etc.).

loans.use: Renovations and developments for his shop

loans.name: Shamis Allah

texts.en: Shamis A. is 20 years old. He lives in district 5 of Kabul, Afghanistan with members of his family. He is a shopkeeper. He has a retail shop in a good area of Kabul. He is a part-time student. He wants to take an individual loan to buy more items like Cokes, bags of chocolate, and sweets. He is young but he wants to expand his business and be a good business dealer in the future.

loans.use: To buy inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase farm inputs needed for his farming business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase poultry and feed for her poultry business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase water storage equipment , etc. for his dairy business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase storage tanks for his dairy farming business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for  farm inputs for his commercial farming business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a cow and purchase feed for his commercial dairy  farming business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a cow for his dairy farming business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying and selling processed cereals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a cow for his dairy farming business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The loan will be used to make remodeling improvements and to purchase cooking utensils.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The loan with be used to pay her suppliers and the improvement of her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more stocks of cereals for his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The loan will be invested in the purchase of raw material and to pay suppliers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more livestock needed to expand his butcher business

loans.name: César

texts.en:
César is a native of Saltillo, Coahuila. He is married and his wife works as a pharmacy assistant: they have 2 children who are 1 and 6 years old. His father has a auto repair workshop and three years ago he began to help him. Thanks to the technical course he studied he knows this work well, and now he is in sole charge of the business. César wants the business to be able to grow in order to provide a better income for the well-being of his family.

In order to offer his services, given that the work done is paid once the vehicle is delivered, César needs a loan of $275 dollars that he will use to buy spare parts and tools which he needs for his work. He is committed to repaying the loan within 3-6 months. You can help to improve the quality business can grow: they thank you for your trust in them and your help.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer.

César es originario de Saltillo, Coahuila, está casado y su esposa trabaja como empleada en una farmacia, tienen 2 hijos, de 1y 6 años de edad. Su padre tiene un taller mecánico y hace 3 años comenzó a ayudarle, gracias a la carrera técnica que estudió conoce de esta labor, y ahora se encarga él solo del negocio, César quiere que este negocio pueda crecer y otorgarle un mejor beneficio para el bienestar de su familia.

Para poder ofrecer sus servicios, dado que los trabajos que realiza se los pagan una vez que ha entregado el vehículo, César necesita de un préstamo por $ 275 dólares que utilizará en la compra de refacciones y herramienta que requiere para hacer su trabajo, él se compromete a devolver este préstamo en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. Tú puedes contribuir la mejorar la calidad de vida de esta familia y ayudar al que este taller pueda crecer, ellos agradecen tu confianza y ayuda.

loans.use: Purchase of spare parts and tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cereals for her business

loans.name: Roberto Arturo

texts.en:
Mr Roberto Arturo is married and has 2 children who are 20 and 22 years old, they both attend school. His wife is a good cook and their food is always recognized by its delicious taste. Thanks to his wife's talent and their need to support the education of their children, they decided to open their own business, where they have sold food for 15 years now. They began selling lunches and BBQ on Sundays, and later tacos, tamales and now they prepare banquets and special events in a type of catering service.

At this time, they have several events scheduled to cater, but they need a loan of $475 which they will use to purchase supplies. The success of this business rests in your hands, do not doubt that you can help this family.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

El señor Roberto Arturo está casado y tiene 2 hijos, de 20 a 22 años, ambos estudian. La esposa de Roberto sabe mucho de cocina y su comida siempre se distingue por su delicioso sabor, gracias a esta cualidad que ella tiene y la necesidad de darle sustento y educación a sus hijos, entre los dos decidieron iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de banquetes y meriendas hace 15 años, empezaron vendiendo menudo y barbacoa los domingos, posteriormente tacos y tamales sobre pedido y ahora meriendas y platillos para eventos sociales.

En estos momentos tienen programados varios eventos para los que han sido contratados, pero necesitan de un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que emplearán para la compra de insumos que requiere para la elaboración de la comida. En tus manos esta el crecimiento de este negocio y el bienestar de esta familia, tú puedes ayudarlos, no lo dudes más.

loans.use: To purchase supplies

loans.name: Erika Fabiola

texts.en:
Fabiola is 23 years old, she is very hard-working and honest and has a small daughter aged 2. She was unemployed for a while, and found it difficult to find work. In order to cover the expenses of her mother and daughter, because she isn’t supported by her partner, she started to sell cosmetics. She then found a job in a law office and continued with her business because she needs the extra income she gets from selling. Also she already has a customer base and her products are of good quality and easy to sell.

At this time, Fabiola needs a loan of $375 dollars with which she will increase the variety of products she offers, in order to provide a better service to her customers and ensure they remain loyal. It’s not easy for her to have sole responsibility for her daughter and mother, but the love she feels for her family provides daily motivation. You can help her to move forward with her family: they need your help and care.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer.

Fabiola tiene 23 años de edad, es muy trabajadora y honesta y tiene una pequeña hija de 2 años. Ella estuvo desempleada por algún tiempo y se le dificultaba encontrar trabajo, para poder cubrir los gastos de su madre y de su hija, porque no cuenta con el apoyo de su pareja, ella inició con la venta de cosméticos, ahora encontró un empleo en un despacho jurídico y continua con su negocio porque necesita de este ingreso extra que obtiene de las ventas, además ella ya tiene sus clientes y sus productos son de buena calidad y fácil de vender.

En estos momentos, Fabiola necesita de un crédito por $ 375 dólares con los que incrementará la variedad de sus productos para ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes y conservar su preferencia, no es fácil para ella tener la responsabilidad de su hija y de su madre ella sola, pero el amor hacia su familia la motivan día a día. Tú puedes ayudarla a salir adelante con su familia, ellas necesitan de tu apoyo y cariño.

loans.use: Purchase stock

loans.name: Argentina

texts.en:
Argentina has a rice peeling operation in Salitre. She hopes to invest the loan in buying rice from the local farmers so she can sell it to distributors. She has three children, two males and a female. She lives in her home with two of her kids who are still in school. She hopes that she can save enough money to send her kids to school in Guayaquil.

She is the latest addition to one of the new Communal Banks in the Mifex Rural Finance Program. All of the members of the Buena Suerte de Salitre Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers. They will use the microloans to prepare the lands and cultivate rice on their farms. loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson lives on a farm that is owned by his father. He and two brothers work the lands with their father, who is now getting older and cannot work as much as he once was able to. On his lands he has cattle and he also grows rice. He hopes that he can continue to make profits with his work so that one day he can save up for his own home. He has three children who live with him, two of whom are still in school. He hopes he can continue to educate his other children, now that his oldest has graduated as an agricultural engineer.

He is the latest addition to one of the new Communal Banks in the Mifex Rural Finance Program. The best months for cultivating rice are early in the year when it is the rainy season on the coast of Ecuador.

Salitre is a national tourist attraction as many Ecuadorians visit the fresh water Salitre River. There are cottages, small restaurants and water attractions that people come to enjoy.

These intermediaries buy crops in advance at very low prices, finance soil at extremely high prices and often provide emergency loans for even higher interest rates than the loan sharks.

Risks

Salitre is a dangerous sector considering it is in the rural area. There is a high incidence of robbery of cattle that results in many of the ranch owners owning weapons to protect their property. Because the police are not present in these areas, farmers and ranchers must apply their own laws and provide their own security. In some instances they have formed their own cooperatives and associations to have a community crime prevention effort.

Salitre is in the lowlands of Ecuador and is vulnerable to flooding in the rainy season. In the event of a heavy rainy season, often at its worse when El Niño occurs, the farmers of rice lose many of their crops. All this is due to a lack of infrastructure in the area.

loans.use: Rice farming

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 46 years old, is married, and has one 22 year-old son. She is a very hard-working and optimistic woman who likes sales and thanks to her character, it is easy for her to relate to other people, which has helped her to gain many clients. She worked in a bakery before but has been unemployed for the past 7 years. She hopes to begin her business in shoe sales as a means of helping with expenses in her home and also to stay active.

Now, Rosalinda needs a loan of $475 dollars that she will use to purchase merchandise for this season so she will be able to offer her clients a better variety and increase her sales. She will pay back this amount within a period of 4 to 8 months. Rosalinda needs your trust and support, you can help her family, don't doubt it!

Translated from Spanish by Laura Kirkvold, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Rosalinda tiene 46 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo de 22 años. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y optimista, le gustan las ventas y gracias a su carácter le es fácil relacionarse con las demás personas, esto el ha ayudado a tener muchos clientes, ella trabajaba en una panadería y quedó desempleada hace siete años, entonces inicio su negocio de venta de calzado como una manera de ayudar con los gastos de su hogar y para mantenerse activa.

Ahora necesita de un préstamo por $ 475 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía de esta temporada para poder ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad e incrementar sus ventas, ella ofrece pagar esta cantidad en un lapso de 4 a 8 meses. Rosalinda necesita de tu confianza y ayuda, tú puedes ayudar a esta familia, no lo dudes más.

loans.use: To purchase new merchandise.

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan was born in Salitre over 70 years ago. He has a small farm that has helped him feed and educate his children for a lifetime. On his farm he grows rice, maize and sweet potatoes. He lives with his wife in their home. He hopes to invest the loan in agriculture so he can continue to feed himself and not depend on others.

He is the latest addition to one of the new Communal Banks in the Mifex Rural Finance Program. All of the members of the Buena Suerte de Salitre Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers. They will use the microloans to prepare the lands and cultivate rice on their farms. Because they form part of a communal bank, they are all each other's guarantors for the loan. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the Buena Suerte Association are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many microfinance programs, but is imperative for the communities Mifex works with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Loan Use and Repayment

The loans in this sector will be used to create water deposits that will prevent flooding in the case of heavy rains or store water in case of droughts. They will also be used to treat the land prior to farming, to plant the seeds and purchase fertilizer. The loan repayment schedule is also different from the typical microentrepreneur. Because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures, Mifex asks them only to pay 50% of the capital in the first 5 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the sixth and final month.

Below is more information about Salitre compiled by the staff at Mifex when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program.

loans.use: Invest in agricultural products

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is married: he and his wife have three children aged 18, 29 and 30. He has always been a salesman: previously he distributed motorcycle spare parts but then it became difficult to import these products and he decided to start sewing uniforms and embroidery ten years ago. He started with just one sewing machine and later he acquired another. He has seen his business grow little by little with the help of his wife: together they have worked tirelessly to ensure their children’s advancement.

In order to be able to speed up production and offer a better service to his customers, Daniel is asking for a loan of $1200 dollars which he will use to buy a specialised machine for embroidery: this will be of great help in expanding his business. He intends to repay this money within 6-12 months. You can play a crucial role in the growth of this business: Daniel and his family thank you sincerely for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Daniel es casado, tienen tres hijos de 18, 29 y 30 años de edad. Él siempre ha sido comerciante, antes distribuía refacciones de motocicletas pero después se le dificultó importar estos productos y decidió iniciar con la confección de uniformes y bordados desde hace 10 años. Comenzó con una sola máquina de costura y después adquirió otra, ha visto crecer su negocio poco a poco con la ayuda de su esposa, juntos han trabajado arduamente para sacar adelante a sus tres hijos.

Para poder agilizar la producción y ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes, Daniel solicita un préstamo por $ 1,200 dólares el que comprará un máquina especializada en bordados, que será de gran utilidad para el crecimiento de este negocio, él esta dispuesto a devolver esta cantidad en un plazo de 6 a 12 meses. Tú puedes ser pieza fundamental en el crecimiento de este negocio, Daniel y su familia agradecen sinceramente tu apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase sewing machine

loans.name: Andres

texts.en:
Andres has a farm where he grows rice and raises cattle. He wants to invest in fixing his lands because they are not in the best shape for rice cultivation. In the long run, he wants to save enough money to buy a truck. He lives with his wife and four children. Three of his sons work the lands with him.

Andres is the latest addition to one of the new Communal Banks in the Mifex Rural Finance Program. All of the members of the Buena Suerte de Salitre Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers. They will use the microloans to prepare the lands and cultivate rice on their farms. loans.use: Invest in rice farming

loans.name: Maria Elida

texts.en:
Mrs Maria Elida is married and has five children. Her husband is a driver and his salary is insufficient to sustain the needs of their family. Maria used to work in a tortilla shop and thanks to the experience that she gained there she was able to start her own business in order to earn a better income. With the help of her 16 year old daughter, she has been able to create her own tortilla shop that they have run for 2 years in Saltillo, Coahuila, where they are originally from.

When they began they borrowed equipment for their work and little by little they have acquired the equipment necessary for making flour tortillas: a refrigerator, a grill, chairs, tables, etc. Now Maria needs a loan of $550 dollars that she will use to buy the supplies that she needs in order to produce larger orders of her products. The power to help this family is in your hands, don't doubt it, they will sincerely appreciate your assistance.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Kirkvold, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Maria Elida es casada, tiene 5 hijos, su esposo es chofer y su salario es insuficiente para el sustento de su familia, anteriormente Maria trabajaba en una tortillería y gracias a la experiencia que adquirió pudo iniciar su propio negocio para poder obtener un mejor ingreso, con ayuda de su hija de 16 años ha podido hacer creer su tortillería que iniciaron hace 2 años en Saltillo, Coahuila de donde son originarios.

Cuando empezaron tenían equipo de trabajo prestado y poco a poco han adquirido la maquinaria necesaria para la elaboración de tortillas de harina, refrigerador, plancha, sillas, mesas, etc. Ahora Maria requiere de un préstamo por $550 dólares que utilizará en la compra de insumos que necesita para surtir grandes pedidos de sus productos. En tus manos esta el poder ayudar a esta familia, no lo dudes más, ellos agradecen sinceramente tu ayuda.

loans.use: Purchase of supplies

loans.name: Felipe Hilario

texts.en:
Felipe is married and has two children. He is an entrepreneur and very responsible: he sells herbs and religious candles in the town of Monterrey, Nuevo León, his home town. A year and a half ago he started his business as a means of self-improvement and to obtain the income his family need. Little by little he has expanded his business and he now has the help of an employee.

Now, Felipe needs a loan of $475 dollars which he will use to buy merchandise in order to keep his business well-stocked and to buy paint to improve the store’s appearance, with the aim to continue expanding as he has done up until now. He has committed to paying this money back within 4-8 months. He needs your trust and thanks you sincerely for your help, don’t think twice about it!

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Felipe es casado y tiene 2 hijos, es un hombre emprendedor y muy responsable, se dedica a la venta de hierbas y veladoras en la ciudad de Monterrey, Nuevo León, de donde es originario. Hace año y medio inició su negocio como una manera de superación personal y para obtener los recursos que su familia necesita, poco a poco ha estado creciendo su negocio y ahora cuenta con la ayuda de un empleado.

En estos momentos Felipe necesita de un préstamo por $ 475 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para tener bien surtido su negocio y en la compra de pintura para mejorar el local, con el objetivo de continuar creciendo como hasta ahora lo ha hecho, él se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en un lapso de 4 a 8 meses. Él necesita de tu confianza y agradece sinceramente tu apoyo, no lo pienses más.

loans.use: Purchasing stock and building renovation

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en:
Fernando grows rice on his small farm and has a rice peeling business named Don Fernando. He will use the loan to invest in pesticides and fertilizer for the rice he has planted. He is divorced from his wife, but he is still very close to his daughter who is 7 years old. He pays for her education and still helps her out. He hopes to continue supporting his daughter and growing his business.

Fernando is the latest addition to one of the new Communal Banks in the Mifex Rural Finance Program. All of the members of the Buena Suerte de Salitre Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers. They will use the microloans to prepare the lands and cultivate rice on their farms. Because they form part of a communal bank, they are all each other's guarantors for the loan. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the Buena Suerte Association are responsible for the amount in default. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many microfinance programs, but is imperative for the communities Mifex works with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

loans.use: Invest in his rice farm

loans.name: Angélica María

texts.en:
Angelica is a 39 year old single mother of 4 children of ages 18, 19, 21, and 23 years of age. She never relied on the support of her husband and has always had to carry on with her children on her own, which has taken a great deal of effort. It has been 8 years since she started doing grocery sales in order to earn a better income that would cover the needs of her family. Fortunately, her store has been growing and continually has an increasing number of customers.

Now, Angelica needs a loan for $925 dollars that she will use to purchase a refrigerator which will allow her to offer a better variety of products, in order to continue growing in her business and to provide for the preferences of her clients. She needs your support, don't doubt it, decide to support her!

Translated from Spanish by Laura Kirkvold, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Angélica tiene 39 años de edad, es madre soltera de cuatro hijos, de 18, 19, 21 y 23 años. Nunca contó con la ayuda de su pareja por lo que tuvo que sacar adelante a sus hijos ella sola, para lo que se ha esforzado mucho. Hace ocho años que inició con la venta de abarrotes para poder obtener un mayor ingreso que cubriera las necesidades de su familia, afortunadamente ha estado creciendo su tienda y cada vez tiene más clientes.

Ahora Angélica necesita de un crédito por $ 925 dólares que utilizará en la compra de una nevera que permitirá poder ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos, para continuar creciendo con su negocio y contar con la preferencia de sus clientes. Ella necesita de tu ayuda, no lo dudes más y decídete a apoyarla.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.en:
Ana Maria is 53 years old. 14 years ago she started selling cosmetics to obtain the income necessary to support and educate her only daughter: she never received help from her partner, meaning she had sole responsibility for meeting the cost of her daughter’s upbringing. For this reason she has worked hard and makes an effort every day. When she began she had a very small stock of cosmetics but now she has managed to increase the number of customers and her sales.

It has not been easy for Ana to have this responsibility, but the love she feels for her daughter has motivated her throughout. Now she needs a loan of $200 dollars which she will use to buy merchandise to increase her supply of products and offer a better service to her customers. Now is the time to help those who need it most: you can help to improve the living conditions of this family.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Ana Maria tiene 53 años de edad, hace catorce años inició con la venta de cosméticos para obtener los recursos que necesita para el sustento y la educación de su única hija, nunca contó con el apoyo de su pareja por lo que ha tenido que solventar ella sola los gastos de su hija, para lo que ha trabajado mucho y se esfuerza día a día. Cuando empezó tenia muy poco surtido de cosméticos pero ahora ha logrado incrementar sus clientes y sus ventas.

No ha sido fácil para Ana tener esta responsabilidad, pero el amor hacia su hija la han motivado durante tanto tiempo, ahora necesita de un préstamo por $ 200 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para incrementar el surtido de sus productos y ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Ahora es momento de ayudar a quien más lo necesita, tú puedes mejorar las condiciones de vida de esta familia.

loans.use: Purchase stock

loans.name: Nelly Morelia

texts.en:
Mrs. Nelly is 40 years old. She is married, and she has a daughter aged 12 and two sons aged 22 and 17. Her husband Miguel is a night watchman and earns a low wage, which is not enough to pay for all the expenses of their home.

In order to help her husband with the family's expenses she decided to go to beauty school and opened her own beauty salon 5 years ago in Merida Yucatan, where she is from. Little by little she has been conditioning the business to offer a better service to her clients.

Now Nelly needs $375 to buy the supplies necessary to offer her services such as sprays, hair coloring and perm liquid products, etc.

Today you can help improve the life of this family. Nelly and her family appreciate your generosity and support.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


La señora Nelly tiene 40 años de edad, es casada y tiene una hija de 12 años y dos hijos de 22 y 17, su esposo Miguel es velador y recibe un salario muy bajo, insuficiente para solventar los gastos de su hogar, como una manera de ayudar a su esposo en el gasto familiar decidió tomar cursos de belleza y hace cinco años inicio su propia estética en la localidad de Mérida, Yucatán de donde es originaria, poco a poco ha ido acondicionando su negocio para ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus cliente.

Ahora Nelly necesita de un crédito por $ 375 dólares con lo que comprará artículos necesarios para ofrecer su servicio como fijadores, tintes, compra de líquidos para permanentes, etc. Hoy tú puedes ayudar a mejorar la vida de esta familia, Nelly y si familia agradecen tu generosidad y apoyo.

loans.use: Purchasing supplies

loans.name: Eva Esmeralda

texts.en:
Mrs. Eva Esmeralda is married, she has two small children aged 1 and 8. Previously she worked in a beauty salon. A year ago she decided to start her own business selling groceries in order to have time to see for her children.

Fortunately she's done very well and business has been growing rapidly. Recently she was able to acquire a vehicle which she uses to transport merchandise to her store and keep the store well stocked. However, in purchasing the vehicle she spent a big part of the capital which she employed in the business and is therefore requesting a loan for $457 to purchase merchandise and continue growing the business as up to now. She has committed to pay back the loan in 6 to 12 months.

You can be an important part of the growth of this business and the life of this family. Eva trusts the people who help those in need and sincerely appreciates your help.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


La señora Eva Esmeralda es casada, tiene dos pequeños hijos, de 1 y 8 años de edad. Anteriormente ella trabajaba en una estética, pero para tener mas tiempo para atender a sus hijos decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de abarrotes hace un año, afortunadamente le ha ido bien con su negocio y ha estado creciendo rápidamente, hace poco le fue posible adquirir un vehiculo que utiliza para trasladar la mercancía a su tienda que le ha sido de gran ayuda para tener bien surtido, pero gastó una gran parte del capital que invertiría en su negocio, por lo que ahora solicita un crédito de $ 457 dólares para la compra de mercancía y poder continuar creciendo como hasta ahora, ella se compromete a devolver este préstamo en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses.

Tú puedes ser parte importante en el crecimiento de este negocio y el la vida de esta familia, no lo dudes más, Eva confía en las personas que ayudan a quien más lo necesita y agradece sinceramente tu ayuda.

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Mrs. Gloria is married and has seven children, all of whom are already married. Her husband Jose is retired.

Eight years ago Gloria started her own business selling clothing and toys, to help with the family's expenses. She sells her products in flea markets located in Escobedo, Nuevo Leon, where she is from. Little by little she has been investing in more merchandise and has made her business grow throughout this time.

Now Gloria needs a loan for $375 with which she will purchase used and new clothing to cover the demand of her clients, and increase the diversity of the products she sells. She has committed to pay back the loan in 6 to 12 months.

Today you can help someone who needs it the most. You can help Gloria. Don't think about it anymore and make your mind to support her.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


La señora Gloria es casada y tiene siete hijos, todos ellos ya casados, su esposo José es pensionado y para ayudar con los gastos de su hogar, hace ocho años Gloria inició su propio negocio con la venta de ropa y juguetes, ella vende sus productos en los mercados ambulantes ubicados en la localidad de Escobedo, Nuevo León, de donde son originarios, poco a poco ha ido invirtiendo más en mercancía y ha hecho crecer su negocio durante todo este tiempo.

Ahora Gloria necesita un préstamo por $ 375 dólares con los que va a adquirir ropa usada y nueva para cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, y tener una mayor variedad, ella se compromete a devolver este préstamo en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses. Hoy puedes ayudar a quien más lo necesita, tú puedes ayudar a Gloria, no lo dudes más y decídete a apoyarla.

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Manuel F. is a rice farmer in Salitre. He has been rice farming in the sector his entire life. He is also one of the main leaders of the rural associations there. He is hoping he can receive the loan in order to invest in his lands and buy feed for his livestock. F. is proud to receive these loans and be part of a communal bank he helped form. He is pictured with a tractor he rented to work his lands.

All of the members of the Buena Suerte de Salitre Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers. They will use the microloans to prepare the lands and cultivate rice on their farms. Because they form part of a communal bank, they are all each other's guarantors for the loan. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the Buena Suerte Association are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many microfinance programs, but is imperative for the communities Mifex works with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

The loans in this sector will be used to create water deposits that will prevent flooding in the case of heavy rains or store water in case of droughts. They will also be used to treat the land prior to farming, to plant the seeds and purchase fertilizer. The loan repayment schedule is also different from the typical microentrepreneur. Because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures, Mifex asks them only to pay 50% of the capital in the first 5 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the sixth and final month.

Below is more information about Salitre compiled by the staff at Mifex when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program.

Economy of Salitre

Salitre is a rural sector in the Province of Guayas, known as the capital of Montuvios (montuvio is a cowboy), with approximately 30,000 inhabitants. The main economic activities are herding and agriculture, which make up about 80% of the economy. The infrastructure and basic services are poor, especially the roads and water services.

Salitre is highly dedicated to farming rice and cattle ranching. Rice is a crop that yields about every four months. In order to farm rice, the environment must be very humid and there must be a high volume of water. The lack of a structured water system makes it difficult for the small farmers to be highly productive. The best months for cultivating rice are early in the year when it is the rainy season on the coast of Ecuador.

Salitre is a national tourist attraction as many Ecuadorians visit the fresh water Salitre River. There are cottages, small restaurants and water attractions that people come to enjoy.

Access to Credit

There are not many financial institutions that provide services to the productive sector of the local economy. The primary access to credit comes from loan sharks who charge extremely high interest rates averaging around 20% a month. The locals are also exploited by the intermediaries that buy their products in order to commercialize them in the city and to export abroad. These intermediaries buy crops in advance at very low prices, finance soil at extremely high prices, and often provide emergency loans for even higher interest rates than the loan sharks.

Risks

Salitre is a dangerous sector considering it is in the rural area. There is a high incidence of robbery of cattle that results in many of the ranch owners owning weapons to protect their property. Because the police are not present in these areas, farmers and ranchers must apply their own laws and provide their own security. In some instances they have formed their own cooperatives and associations to have a community crime prevention effort.

Salitre is in the lowlands of Ecuador and is vulnerable to flooding in the rainy season. In the event of a heavy rainy season, often at its worse when El Niño occurs, the farmers of rice lose many of their crops. All this is due to a lack of infrastructure in the area.

loans.use: Invest in rice farming

loans.name: Armando

texts.en:
Mr. Armando is married and has nine children. Eight of them are grown up and married, only the youngest lives with him and is 8 years old.

In order to make the money his family needs, Armando started selling corn, ice cream and fruits in a street stand in Sabinas Hidalgo, Nuevo Leon, where he is from.

Before that he worked for a transportation company, but due to downsizing he was laid-off. With help from a friend, he learned to make ice cream and borrowed a car to be able to sell it in the streets.

At the moment, Armando needs to borrow $275 which he will use to purchase the raw materials required to make ice cream. Because of his experience he knows that the demand for his product will increase this season and wants to be prepared to satisfy his clients. He has committed to pay back the loan in 3 to 6 months.

You can improve the life of this family, make your mind and support Armando.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


El señor Armando es casado y tiene 9 hijos, 8 de ellos son mayores de edad y están casados, solo el menor, de 8 años de edad, vive con él. Para obtener los recursos que necesita su familia, Armando inició con la venta ambulante de elotes, nieve y fruta en la localidad de Sabinas Hidalgo, Nuevo León, de donde es originario. Antes laboraba en una empresa de transportes y por recorte de personal quedó desempleado, con ayuda de un amigo aprendió a elaborar nieve y consiguió prestado un vehículo para poder vender por las calles.

En estos momentos, Armando necesita de un préstamo por $ 275 dólares que utilizará en la compra de insumos que requiere en la elaboración de la nieve, por su experiencia sabe que en esta temporada se incrementa la demanda por este producto y quiere estar preparado para satisfacer a sus clientes, él se compromete a devolver este préstamo en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. Tú puedes mejorar la vida de esta familia, decídete a apoyar a Armando.

loans.use: Purchasing Merchandise

loans.name: Maricela

texts.en:
Maricela is a married woman and she has three children, two women of 21 and 26 years of age and a seventeen year-old boy. Her husband has a temporary job as a gardener in the U.S. In order to help pay for their home and for her children's education, Maricela decided fourteen years ago to start her own business selling groceries. She begun with a few articles, and little by little she's increased the number of products she sells. Her store is now well stocked and she occasionally receives help from her children in Sabinas Hidalgo, Nuevo León..

To keep her business growing, Maricela is asking for $550 in credit, which she will use to purchase merchandise and let her buy more products for her store. This way she can offer better service to her clients, thus keeping them loyal to her store. Maricela trusts people that help those who need it most and she thanks you for your generosity and support.

Translated from spanish by Maite Barragán, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maricela es casada, y tiene 3 hijos, dos mujeres de 21 y 26 años de edad y un varón de 17 años. Su esposo tiene un trabajo temporal de jardinero en Estados Unidos, para apoyarlo con los gastos del hogar y de la educación de sus hijos, hace catorce años Maricela decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de abarrotes, empezó con pocos artículos y poco a poco ha ido incrementado el número de productos que comercializa, ahora tiene una tienda bien surtida en donde ocasionalmente recibe la ayuda de sus hijos en Sabinas Hidalgo, Nuevo León.

Para continuar creciendo con su negocio, Maricela solicita un crédito por $ 550 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía que le permita tener un mejor surtido en su tienda, ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes y conservar su preferencia. Maricela confía en las personas que ayudan a quien más lo necesita, y agradece tu generosidad y apoyo.

loans.use: Buying merchadise

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Mr. Antonio is 66 years old. Ever since 30 years ago he has been doing the trade of fixing car door locks and handles, window and door seals, windshield washers, and windows and tint glasses, in which he has stood out because of his good service and honesty. His business is in Monterrey, Nuevo Leon, in northern Mexico.

Since he finished elementary school he worked to help his parents. He has learned this business from experience. He started offering his services in the street but now he has the chance to rent a shop in which he has been getting known and he has earned many clients.

At the moment, Antonio needs a loan of $275 which he will employ to buy supplies and parts necessary to continue offering his services. He offers to pay back this quantity in 3 to 6 months.

You can help improve the life of this family and contribute to the growth of this business. Antonio sincerely appreciates your help.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


El señor Antonio tiene 66 años de edad, se dedica desde hace treinta años al oficio de arreglo de chapas y elevadores, colocación de empaques, limpiaparabrisas, vidrios y polarizados, en los cuales se destaca por su buen servicio y honestidad, en la ciudad de Monterrey, Nuevo León, al norte de México, desde que salio de la escuela primaria trabajaba para ayudad a sus padres y con base en la experiencia ha aprendido este negocio. Empezó ofreciendo sus servicios en la calle pero ahora tiene la oportunidad de rentar un local en el que se ha dado a conocer y ha ganado muchos clientes.

En estos momentos Antonio necesita de un préstamo por $ 275 dólares que empleará en la compra los materiales y refacciones que necesita para continuar ofreciendo sus servicios, él ofrece devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. Tú puedes ayudar a mejorar la vida de esta familia y contribuir al crecimiento de este negocio, Antonio agradece sinceramente tu ayuda.

loans.use: Purchasing supplies

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.en:
Porfirio is a married man with three children of 26,27 and 32 years of age. He has always been a salesman. Due to economic problems, he had to abandon his studies when he was very young in order to work and help his parents. When he was 12 years old he lived in Mexico City and sold newspapers, candies, and anything and everything. In 1991 he moved to Saltillo, Coahuila and began to sell gentleman's clothing. In 1994 he was able to rent the place in the market, where his business is still today.

Porfirio now needs a loan for $1,200 dollars, which he will use to buy merchandise, remodel his store, so that it is more attractive for his clients and to offer better service. He knows that with some hard work he can return the loan in two to four months time. Porfirio needs your trust and support, decide to help him.

Translated from spanish by Maite Barragán, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Porfirio es casado y tiene tres hijos de 26, 27 y 32 años de edad, él siempre ha sido comerciante, la necesidad en la que vivía lo obligó a abandonar sus estudios desde muy pequeño para ponerse a trabajar y ayudar a sus padres, cuando tenía 12 años vivía en el Distrito Federal y empezó vendiendo periódicos, dulces, de todo, en 1991 llegó a Saltillo, Coahuila y se dedicó a la venta de ropa para caballero y después, en 1994, le fue posible rentar un local en el mercado, donde esta su negocio actualmente.

En estos momentos Porfirio necesita de un préstamo por $ 1,200 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía y en remodelar su local, para que sea más atractivo a sus clientes y poder ofrecer un mejor servicio, él sabe que con su esfuerzo podrá devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 2 a 4 meses. Porfirio necesita de tu confianza y apoyo, decídete a ayudarlo.

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The loan will be used to purchase raw materials and to pay suppliers. She would also like to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The loan will be used to purchase leather and fabrics, which are the base products needed for him to make his crafts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She wishes to invest the loan in the expansion of her store and to purchase supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The loan will be used to pay suppliers and to purchase lubricants and other items he sells in his store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: He will invest the loan in purchasing motorcycle parts and to expand his mechanic's shop.

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en:
Ramona has been separated from her husband for seven years, she has four children but all of them are married. Ever since the separation, she started her business because she wanted to obtain her own income. She lives alone and doesn't receive any economic support from anyone. She began her business by selling candies and soft drinks from her own home, slowly she started to incorporate some groceries and she now has a well conditioned shop .

Ms. Ramona is a very hard working woman and she wishes to stock her store with stationery. For this, she is asking for a $925 dollar credit, so she can buy the merchandise which will allow her to keep her business growing. Ramona trusts the people who help those who need it most. Decide to help her, she appreciates your generosity.

Translated from spanish by Maite Barragán, Kiva Volunteer.

Ramona esta separada de su esposo desde hace siete años, tiene cuatro hijos pero todos ellos están casados. Desde que se separó inició su propio negocio para poder obtener los recursos que necesita, ella vive sola y no tiene ayuda económica de nadie, comenzó vendiendo dulces y refrescos, en su propio domicilio, y después fue incorporando la venta de otros productos de abarrotes, ahora ya tiene un local que ha ido acondicionado poco a poco.

Doña Ramona es una mujer muy trabajadora, y quiere incorporar la venta de papelería en su negocio, para esto solicita un crédito por $ 925 dólares para la compra de mercancía que le permitirá continuar creciendo. Ramona confía en las personas que ayudan a quien más lo necesita, decídete a apoyarla, ella agradece tu generosidad.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The loan will be invested in the purchase of a special machine which will make his bricks more stress-resistant and to purchase prime materials such as sand, and cement.

loans.name: Elvia Teresa

texts.en:
Elvia is 23 years old and has five children. She has 4 years of experience in business. At this point, she has just 1 animal. Her goal is to have 10 to 15 pigs. She uses 2 bags of feed ($200 each) to fatten and raise them. She has a lot of faith in achieving her goal with this loan, so she can help with her children's education and in supporting her home.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Elvia tiene23 años y cinco hijos.Tiene 4 años de experiencia en el negocio , en estos momentos tiene 1 sólo animal, su meta es llegar a tener 10 a 15 puercos.Utiliza 2 bolsas de alimento( $200 c/u ) para el engordamiento y la crianza.Tiene mucha fé en lograr su meta con este prestamo y de esa forma colaborar con la educación de sus hijos y colaborar en el sustento de su hogar.

loans.use: To raise pigs

loans.name: Arminda

texts.en:
Arminda is a very optimistic and hard working woman. She is married and has two small kids aged 2 and 8.

The lack of employment in the country made it hard for her husband to find a job for a long time, in which debt started to accumulate. In order to stop the crisis Arminda decided to begin selling shoes. Fortunately she's done well. The business allows her to take care of her children and her home since she can do it from her house. Her main clientèle are family and friends.

In order to obtain greater earnings from her products, Arminda needs to buy wholesale and for that she requires a loan of only $150. She already has many orders and with this amount she can supply them at a lower cost. She and her family thank your generosity and support.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


Arminda es una mujer muy optimista y trabajadora, ella es casada y tiene dos pequeños hijos de 2 y 8 años de edad, la falta de empleo del país provocó que su esposo no consiguiera un trabajo durante un largo periodo, en que se fueron acumulando las deudas y para poder salir de esta crisis Arminda decidió empezar a trabajar con la venta de calzado, afortunadamente le ha ido bien en el negocio, esta labor le permite estar al cuidado de sus hijos y de su hogar porque puede realizar esta tarea desde su casa, sus principales clientes son familiares y amigos.

Para obtener mejores ganancias de sus productos, Arminda necesita comprar a mayoreo y para esto requiere de un préstamo de solo $ 150 dólares, ya tiene muchos pedidos y con esta cantidad podrá surtirlos a un precio más bajo. Ella y su familia agradecen tu generosidad y apoyo.

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise
